title: Recommended
text:
Brilliant hotel, small room but great bed. Great base for exploring New York, close to the metro.
Possibility to enjoy delicious food at an attractive price.
Very friendly helpful staff.
We were a little too early for the rooftop.

title: Almost good.
text: Bathroom door offers little privacy. Paid for ‘city views’ and landed on 3rd floor no view. Refrigerator is a plus but basically useless without microwave. Shower has no door, water everywhere. Staff exceptionally friendly and helpful and the hotel has a conveniently located to quick subway access and major points downtown.

title: 1st New York trip
text: Great location close to subway and a fantastic Bagel shop. Short walk to Madison Park and The Empire State Building. Sarabeth’s restaurant around the corner on Park Avenue do a fabulous breakfast and Wednesday happy hour with live Jazz.

title: Basic but was a good base for exploring
text:
Overall an ok stay during our trip to NYC.  The kids shared a modern room (217) which was lovely.  Our room was outdated (214) and in need of modernising. 

The staff were excellent throughout.

However the “Destination fee” is obscene $30 per room per night and will put me off from ever rebooking.  I understand taxes, but $100 per room for 3 nights was grotesque.

title: Lovely boutique hotel in great location
text:
This is a little gem of a hotel in the heart of Manhattan.
On arrival, we were greeted with a warm welcome from Franchesca, which set the tone for our stay. This was the norm, all the staff, without exception were friendly and helpful. There is a daily destination charge levied at check in, although we were able to take advantage of the hotel’s 20% discount on admission to the Empire State Building. The hotel also organised tickets for us on the day.
We recommend this hotel unreservedly.

title: Promised more than delivered
text:
We had a 'Cityview' and a 'Courtyard' view. Both descriptions are a stretch. CityView was 1st floor and we could see a street, and courtyard was aircon units. Hotel also impossible to contact before visit (ignored e-mails). Staff friendly when there however...especially 'doormen'

Destination fee not worth it (although not optional!). Wine Thursday was one cocktail.....

title: Great Location!
text: We chose Park South Hotel for the location, which is absolutely perfect. We had an easy time getting everywhere we needed to be in the city. The rooms are small, but clean. The staff super attentive. Our first night was loud, thanks to our neighbors - luckily they must have checked out the next day because we had peace and quiet the rest of our nights. Not sure what we "got" out of the daily hotel fee, but they're not the only ones who charge one. Someone else mentioned the nearby bagel shop - that was a great bonus!

title: Great hotel!
text: I chose this hotel after reading many good reviews and I wasn't disappointed- great location and staff - room was plenty big enough for me and my daughter with 2 double beds- very clean and quiet. All amenities are close, subway and a great bagel shop. Would definitely stay here again!

title: Amazing service and modern hotel
text: The hotel staff were just amazing. So helpful and friendly. The hotel was clean and modern and food in the restaurant was absolutely delicious. Location super great too- very central and close to subway. Would stay again.

title: Stay at Park South Hotel
text: Bed was too soft and lumpy and no fitted sheets. Toilet handle was very hard to flush even after mentioning it to front desk. Would have been nice to have bottled water in the bedroom upon arrival instead of having to ask for it.

title: We recommend very, very HIGHLY! ❤️
text:
What more can be said ?
Excellent !!!
🎤❌
🗽 THANK YOU TO THE PARK SOUTH TEAM
Location, service and cuisine on site.
A real joy. A very, very well managed small structure! Spacious and clean room!
Really a pleasure to post an ultra positive comment ❤️

title: stay
text: Our overall stay was pretty good. The staff was very helpful and catered to our needs. Diners were close by.  The rooms were clean and they helped with making our time there special for a birthday.  Would definitely recommend.

title: Almost perfect!
text:
Our third time in New York and we decided to opt for a smaller hotel, in a quieter location. A family of 4 sharing a third floor room with two double beds. A small room but not unusual in New York, well decorated, with an adequate bathroom. The beds were very comfortable and the shower had good pressure. If I was going to be picky, the window wasn’t particularly good at sound proofing the room so there was quite a bit of noise, a higher room would help this. The heating unit in the room was old and very loud, so we switched it off when we were in the room. Room was cleaned daily to a high standard. 
One gripe was the room tax, on checking in I was told they would ‘hold’ $400 on a card for room tax and incidentals. On checking out, I was informed the room tax was all that would be charged, approx $138, however they took the full $400! Husband had to call up to query it and was told they take the whole lot then refund the difference, which is not what I was told at check in & also makes no sense. To top it off we have to wait 5-7 days for the refund and probably lose money on the exchange rate. Instructions need to be made clearer at check in if this is the actual process. I was present at check out, the $400 being held could have been cancelled and I could have given you the card to charge the correct amount. 
In better news, Chuck on the front door was an absolute legend, always had a smile, happy to help and very personable. A credit to the hotel. 
Would I recommend the hotel? Yes I would, comfortable beds and decent shower. Just make sure you check the exact procedure for paying room tax, because current procedures as they are would unfortunately put me off staying there again.

title: Great spot!
text: Loved staying here -- The Park South will be my new go to spot in NYC! Walking distance to Penn Station but enough out of the chaos of midtown that it feels quieter and a short walk to Union Sq, the East Village and more. Truly a great little find!

title: Amazing hotel!
text: I had a fantastic stay here. Room, staff, good, facilities and location were all perfect for my needs. I had a great stay! In particular I loved the cute little breakfast cafe, the staff, food and coffee were all excellent. Room service was good and I slept really well in the comfy bed!

title: Great stay at Park South Hotel in NYC!
text: We had the best time during our first visit to The Park South Hotel.  The rooms were extremely clean and well appointed.  We travel quite a bit so I am confident in recommending this hotel to anyone who wants to be warmly welcomed, have a great nights sleep and a cool library with a fireplace to relax while sipping a beverage of your choice.

title: Great location, Very Clean, Wonderful Staff!
text: We had a really great experience and would definitely stay there again. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful. The room was clean with floors, not carpets, and an average size for a NYC hotel room. And the location was amazing!

title: Great value for $!
text: Stayed for a business trip and extended a couple days to celebrate a birthday. The room much larger than what I expected for NY and it was kept VERY clean by the staff. Bathrooms are the thing I freak out the most about and this one was perfect. Visited during the first snow in a couple of years and the heating was fast and stable. All around a comfortable stay. Will book again!

title: A hiddden Gem within NoMad  NYC
text: A quiet tucked away gem of a hotel with an excellent restaurant and attentive staff. Clean contemporary rooms with plush beds and all the amenities right down to comfy bath robes and towel warmers.  Conveniently close (walking distance) to NYU/Langone Medical Center.  Definitely worth another visit.

title: Lovely Hotel
text: The Park South Hotel is a lovely hotel in the Kip's Bay neighborhood in NYC.  The room and amenities were up to date, clean and very comfortable.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  I stayed during Hotel Week so the rates were great too.  I would love to stay here again!

title: Hidden Gem
text:
Lovely hotel off the beaten track but within easy reach of Broadway, Empire State and Times Square.
Every single member of staff couldn't be friendlier or more professional with a cheery hello every time we came in.

There's a lovely restaurant which we sadly didn't get a chance to use so can't comment on food and a cool little bar. 

Room and bathroom was clean and modern - shower could've been a little more powerful. Otherwise no complaints. 

Would definitely stay again.

title: Good location and free on street parking from Friday at 7p to Monday at 7a
text: Hotel is small and nice enough.  Room is very small.  Mattress was not comfortable but otherwise all good.  They also dont have a process for upgrading Explorer status member.  Great location.  Near Union Sq

title: Tiny room, nice area, cute lobby.
text: Even by NYC standards this room was tiny! Otherwise the hotel is clean, lobby is small but cozy and the neighborhood is great. Easy walk to parks and food. Had a window but no view. Decent bed, everything worked. Cramped bathroom.

title: Park south hotel New York
text:
Very friendly and polite staff, great location within good walking distance to some of the main things like Empire State Building.
Plenty of food places local although the restaurant downstairs is definitely worth a visit

title: Perfect place in the city
text:
Nice place close to the subway, restaurants, banks, etc. 
The rooms were clean and very comfortable, 
Overall, I had a great experience with the PSH, and  staff were incredibly helpful.

My kids just liked the place, I definitely would stay again at this hotel.

title: Fantastic. Would stay again
text:
This was one of the best , most friendly places we’ve ever stayed. A small boutique hotel by Hyatt where they make sure they know your name and give you a top notch service. 
They have a bar ( where we got complimentary drinks) an area called the library with an open fire , a restaurant and a coffee shop where you could have free coffee until 10:30.  
The doormen could not do enough for you and we’re so cheerful at any hour. Cofi and Norris to name a couple. They organised the taxis , gave directions and tips. 
We would definitely recommend not staying in Times Square is you want to avoid the crowds. We visited twice and were glad not to be staying there and walking out of our hotel into chaos. This hotel had a subway yards away which was so easy to use . The line 6 went uptown through Central station and beyond and downtown through to Brooklyn Bridge . We would not hesitate to stay here again.

title: NYE in NYC
text:
We (family of four with two boys 14 & 18) stayed here over New Year. We booked via booking.com and had what the site described as a family room. Breakfast was included in our booking. Below is a summary of our stay

- The hotel is in a good spot. There is a subway station on the corner and it's a short walk to the Flatiron building, Fifth Avenue and the Empire State building.

- The staff at the hotel are friendly and helpful. Checkout was at 12.00 and there is an area to store your bags if you are leaving later like we did.

- We had breakfast included in our rate which I was glad of. There is a small cafe in the hotel where breakfast is served and you get 4 items per guest. It's typically things like croissants, bagels, yoghurt, granola etc. plus coffee and juice. if you were to pay for it all there it would be quite costly. There is a bagel place next door though which seemed very popular and a McDonalds on the corner of the block if you fancy eating outside the hotel.

- There's a restaurant on site (we didn't eat there) and a very nice bar which we went a couple of times and we could take our sons in there too. It's quite pricey but everything in NYC is.

- Our room was clean and tidy but was small. We booked a room with two double beds as booking two rooms was too expensive but the double beds were very much on the small side. There was also not much storage space for clothes with 4 of us in the room and it could get a bit cramped. 

- The decor and facilities in the hotel were very modern and stylish, especially in the lobby and restaurant/bar areas and were nicer than I anticipated. We had looked at booking a package through TUI for a similar price but I'm glad we booked separate as this was a much better hotel than the Hilton Garden Inns on offer through the package deal.

Overall I'd recommend the hotel, it's a good spot, staff were nice, facilities were good but the room was on the small side for four people.

title: Excellent Hotel!
text: From the Location to the Price to the Service to the Staff to the Rooms. Everything was  fantastic and we would not hesitate staying here again and would definitely recommend! A huge shoutout to the doormen for storing our luggage upon early arrival and late departure! Thank you!

title: I cannot fault this hotel it is amazing
text:
Myself and my partner stayed here from 22nd-27th December and we cannot fault anything about it

The room was amazing and always warm and cosy. The bed was so comfortable and we slept so well. The room was spacious (we stayed in room 517) and we didn't feel couped up

The hotel staff were all so friendly and would help with recommendations or information about the subway or anything you need, they were always so lovely to talk to

The location was so good, it was a short walk to the main attractions, there is a bagel shop a couple of doors down which is so good. There are subways and a mcdonalds at the top of the street and coffee shops all around. There is a supermarket only a block away. You have everything you need nearby.

We got married during our stay and the staff were making sure we had a car sorted 

A magical holiday, a magical time for us was made even better by this hotel

We are already planning another trip and this will definitely be the hotel we stay in

title: A lovely base for exploring Manhattan
text: We had a very enjoyable and relaxing stay here: the location is convenient, the rooms large, comfortable and well-equipped, and the staff friendly and helpful. Furthermore, the hotel was beautifully dressed and decorated for Christmas. Can recommend unreservedly!

title: We will definitely stay here again.
text: The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. They helped us with some logistical challenges we had to contend with. I have only good things to say about it. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip.

title: Dusty room
text: The location is appealing and the staff are friendly. The heating system is quite dusty and has led to coughing. The room has no fridge and the breakfast is more than 20 USD per person. We would probably not revisit.

title: Nice boutique hotel in good location
text: Well located and very near the subway. Small boutique hotel- rooms nice but a little tight fit - possibly expected in NY hotels. Good assortment of restaurants near by and union square and flat iron a five minute walk. Most tourist locations can be reached in half an hour. Staff polite and very helpful.

title: Great location and good service
text:
The hotel has a great Gramercy/Flatiron location.
If you are a foodie who loves Indian food, the hotel is a stone’s throw from several quality Indian restaurants 
The fitness center is modest but I had a great workout with free weights, exercise bench and a treadmill/elliptical

title: Nice small hotel
text: Lovely lobby, room and excellent service. Bonus exit on 27th street to save a block if you're heading south. Helps in the winter! The large hotels in the city can be a real pain with slow and crowded elevators. This property was perfect in that regard.

title: Outstanding staff and location
text: The staff was outstanding! From the moment we entered the hotel we were greeted with a smile and "what can we do to help you?" We arrived early and were given water to sip while we waited to be let into our room ahead of the normal check-in time. Our flight out was delayed by 6 hours and we were able to snag a late check-out time, again with the help of the staff. The room was very clean and comfortable, despite being NYC small, as they all are. The location was also excellent with a subway stop across the street.

title: Pésima
text:
Tuve una experiencia muy desagradable en este hotel, el cual no es simplemente un establecimiento cualquiera, sino que se promociona como un hotel de casi 5 estrellas, con un precio acorde a esa categoría. Se espera que un hotel de este nivel ofrezca un servicio excelente en todos los aspectos, pero lamentablemente no fue así. La hospitalidad fue escasa en general, pero lo peor de todo es que, al regresar al hotel después de dos noches en Washington, nos dimos cuenta de que no nos habían informado sobre una noche adicional que quedaba en nuestra reserva. Nos fuimos una noche antes sin que nos hicieran el check-out, y al volver, la recepción no nos alertó sobre la noche extra. Fue de madrugada y nos retiramos rápidamente debido a que nuestro autobús a Washington salía en 30 minutos. El día anterior habíamos informado que nos íbamos y dejaríamos nuestras maletas en el hotel, ya que teníamos otra reserva para regresar en dos días. Sin embargo, la encargada no mencionó las fechas ni la salida de la primera estadía ni la llegada posterior. Esto resultó en la pérdida de una noche en Nueva York en ese hotel, además de incurrir en gastos adicionales al tener que pagar una noche más en Washington y otra en el mismo hotel de Nueva York, que nunca nos alertó sobre la confusión. 
¿Cómo es posible que un hotel de esta categoría no realice el check-out de sus huéspedes? Nos les parece que debería alertarles a sus huespedes que se están yendo una noche antes y las fechas de regreso al hotel no concuerdan con la información proporcionada? Además, el servicio de desayuno fue notablemente ineficiente; el personal del bar no nos informó sobre todas las opciones disponibles, resultando en que desayunáramos lo mismo cada mañana habiendo otras opciones que ya teniamos pagas. Nunca más volveria a este hotel ni lo recomendaria carisimo y con empleados muy poco profesionales. Un desatre !

title: Perfect Weekend Getaway Hotel - fab service, great location.
text: Booked a BA Holiday and chose the Park South Hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and I have to say we were not disappointed.  All the things we look for were there, starting with the very warm welcome by Jonathan, the room was decorated for my wife's birthday weekend.  The room was clean, and so quiet we had perfect night's sleep.  Nothing was too much trouble for the staff.  Fab location too - 1 minute walk to Number 6 subway line so all of New York was instantly accessible.   A great hotel.  David.

title: New Your Trip for my WIfe's Surgery
text: The hotel and room was very nice and clean.  It was expensive.  We were very disappointed when we tried to eat at the hotel restaurant only to find it was closed for a private party.  No warning, not test, email or notice.

title: Restful and comfy stay close to uptown
text: I really enjoyed my stay, all the staff were super friendly the second I step a foot on the lobby of the hotel, location is very good if you want to visit uptown manhattan and great accessibility, bed very comfy and on point blackout in the room which allowed me to rest!

title: Great location, walkable to everything, clean modern rooms
text: The first room they put me in faced an air conditioning unit and was quite noisy which would have probably been OK, but I asked to move and was moved to a much nicer and bigger room on the top floor, which I was very happy with for my 5 day stay! The rooms were spotlessly clean and everything worked as it should - fast Wi-Fi, good shower pressure, comfy bed, no street noise or internal noise whatsoever. Staff were always very friendly and happy to help. I didn't have breakfast but there's a popular bagel shop next door which I went to a couple of times which was very good, plus a few other good restaurants and cafes in easy walking distance. The rooftop bar was good too, and I got given a couple of drinks tokens to enjoy there. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York!

title: Good location
text: Good location clean hotel. Friendly staff who are helpful. Rooms are small but modern and clean. They have happy hour daily and a nice lounge area in the back. I didn’t get a chance to try the restaurant.

title: Wonderful experience
text: I was in town for one evening for a meeting/event and am glad that this hotel was nearby. The staff, from the door/bell staff who greeted me to the front desk staff who checked me in were all friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. If I am back in this neighborhood I will definitely stay in this hotel again.

title: Excellent service
text: The staff is very helpful and attentive. The hotel is small but has different areas were you can sit down and relax. Our room with two double beds was spacious and we were very comfortable, and had a great sleep. Convenient location and good value for midtown Manhattan.

title: Thanksgiving hide away, but close to everything
text:
This hotel is the best value for money and so well looked after by a lovely work team who are so helpful. 
If you want to be central but hidden away this is the spot to stay, loved it & will be back 😁

title: Great hotel
text:
We really enjoyed our stay. The room was nice and very clean, perfect location and the staff was friendly. Especially the door ambassadors were super helpful. 
Overall the hotel is really, really nice and we will definitely come back again.

title: Insecure room
text: A kindle tablet disappeared from the room while we were out and it looks like someone, not us, tried to open the safety box the same day and It was automatically bloked. The cameras didn't register abnormal situations. it happened during the only the day we requested housekeeping services. We  informed this to the manager and there was no clue on what could happened. I will never go back and I don't recommend this hotel after what happened.

title: Loved it !
text:
clean, great location,perfect breakfast, easy access to public transportation and overall wonderful experience. I really recommend this hotel to everyone.
front desk staff  were really kind and supportive as well.

title: Small rooms but location more than makes up for it
text: Superb stay at this friendly centrally located hotel. Clean but small rooms with not much closet space. However this is just a small issue as the hotel is really safe and just yards from the subway station. Walk over a block and you get great views of the flatiron and empire state buildings. Didn’t eat at the hotel for breakfast as the most AMAZING bagel shop next door does fantastic breakfast burritos. Would definitely stay again.

title: Awesome
text:
Outstanding value for money
Location is perfect
Close to union square
We got to check in early
Awesome restaurants & bars in neighborhood.
The staff are all exceptional
Loved Barbara at front desk
Complimentary wine was nice
Room was very clean & comfortable

title: Nice Hotel
text: Great location, very nice enthusiastic staff, super comfortable not cramped room with a nightstand on each side of the bed! Didn’t take advantage of drink coupons but they were appreciated! All hotels in nyc are running at least  $100 more than they should be but maybe they’re still catching up after covid….hopefully….and this is directed at all hotel corporations— share the overcharging with their staff

title: great location near subway, fair price
text: This hotel has a great location mid-town right next to a 6 train subway station and a 3 blocks away from the R train which worked out great for all the locations on Manhattan we visited during our trip to NYC. Staff was friendly, elevator was quick, and there is a bagel shop next door. Checked all the boxes for us.

title: Our stay in New York
text:
Myself
My husband
In NY
For my adult son to receive medical procedure. Great central location
Route to hospital…. Convenient and safe. All needs met, zero complaints
Staff friendly professional 
Acknowledged us every time we existed or entered facility

title: Highly recommend this hotel
text: I have visited NYC before and stayed close to Madison Square Gardens. I wanted to experience staying in a different location and this hotel didn’t disappoint. It was the perfect location for getting up and downtown and was lovely to come back to somewhere away from the crowds of people, bright lights and noise. The staff were really helpful and didn’t come across like they expected tips unlike other hotels I’ve stayed at before, making you want to tip them. I loved the reception areas. There were comfy seats by a fire and large tables for us to sit and eat our bagels from the bagel shop next door. Bagel shop icing on the cake and could even make a decent cuppa. There’s also a McDonald’s close by. EPSB, time square and MSG all within easy walking distance as are subways. We only drank at hotel on first night and my son ate there once but both experiences were great. There was fresh water in reception every day and bottled water available for your rooms and if heading out for the day which was a massive positive for me especially when some places were charging 7usd per bottle. The original room we were in was a little small for 3 people with lots of luggage, could have made it work but asked if anything else available and we were moved to a larger room free of charge. The room wasn’t available until later in the day but they took care of everything for us so we didn’t have to waste our day. Beds very comfortable! Can’t imagine anyone wouldn’t be happy here.

title: Great stay in the flatiron area
text: Excellent rooms, comfortable beds and friendly staff made for a wonderful stay at Park south. We had complimentary wine cookies in our room, which was unexpected.  Also got free drink coupon to use at the bar later.  Location felt safe and easy to walk to restaurants. would stay there again.

title: Amazing! Book now.
text: What a wonderful stay! I almost want to keep this gem to myself, but wow! This hotel is amazing. William and Yami took great care of me and arranged a meeting room and breakfast for a client workshop. Norris made me feel like I was coming home every time I walked through the door.  Housekeeping made sure I had everything I needed (even a tea kettle!)  What more can I say? This was my first stay at a JDV property and I am sold! Everyone at the front desk treats you like family.  Love love love! All of this AND the hotel is super convenient to explore Manhattan? Yes please! Cannot wait to come back with the family.

title: Feels like home
text: The staff at Park South make me feel special and welcome. They are accommodating to my needs and always so pleasant. Beds and pillows are comfy and the location is in my old neighborhood in which I used to live…so feels like home!

title: One of the nicer hotels in this price range!
text:
Very clean!  Hotel in very good condition.  Staff VERY helpful.
Would like a better restaurant menu and drink selections, along with room service.
However I will try to stay here next time I visit my son and his family.

title: Good for the money
text:
Great hotel for a quick 2-day trip to NYC.  Good location, not too far uptown close to the super touristy places.  Friendly staff.  Room was clean and fairly nice, but the bathroom was outdated and small.  We had a nice room on a high floor so noise level was good, although no views.  
Would stay again.  We went on a busy week in NY so prices were a little higher than normal, but still reasonable.

title: V. McPherson
text: Park South Hotel is a great place to stay while in NY.  Accomodating in every way, rooms were clean and very comfortable and it is located in walking distance and/or short Uber trips to some of the best places to visit and/or dine in NY.

title: NYC no. 18
text: After 18 trips to The Park South Hotel in NYC would not want to stay anywhere else.  The hotel is ideally located to travel around the city with a subway station very close.  The staff are always polite, friendly and very helpful.     The rooms are very nice.

title: This place is a gem!
text: Great location, great service, super clean, and even a bar and restaurant. I was told a sushi bar was reopening in the fall-winter months. What a nice addition! Staff is energetic and friendly. There's a barber shop next door, a bagel shop on the other side, and great Indian food around the corner. It's 8 blocks form NYC's best restaurant, Gramercy Tavern, and a half block from the subway. Let's not forget Whole Foods and Trader Joes only a couple blocks. As the title describes, this place is a gem

title: Enjoyable stay in NYC
text: I was suprised by the accommodations and the service. The front desk and bellman services were excellent. The hotel was very welcoming and with a couple of bars, a restaurant and a coffee shop attached, it was very convenient. I would stay there again.

title: GREAT STAY!
text: I went to NYC for a business trip and stayed at this hotel. Staff were welcoming and kind and the restaurant on site had great food too. I stayed three nights and didn't have any issues at all. I enjoyed the stay and was much better than initially expected.

title: The best hotel in Manhattan!
text:
We stayed once again at the Park South hotel in Manhattan. The second time around just confirmed my last rating of 10. This hotel is clean, functional, friendly and has everything you want from a hotel in Manhattan. The staff is fantastic, especially the manager and doormen! We were welcomed like family, and everyone did their best to make our stay perfect. (Which it was....once again!)
The rooftop bar is amazing! What fun even at your own hotel! The restaurant is also fantastic and has a great menu. There is a subway station just outside, which makes getting around the city extremely convenient. Right next door is a great bagel place for a quick and cheap breakfast.
We can’t say enough about this hotel, they go out of their way to please their guests.
I’m so thankful for everything they did for us! John and his team, were exceptional.

title: Review
text: Fantastic place.  Location, cleanliness, overall atmosphere was fantastic.   The staff worked very hard and most importantly were really really nice.   Location is great and the value of cost relative to location and overall experience was great.

title: The details make the difference
text:
Close to the subway and somewhat centrally located, the Park South proved to be a winner. We opted for the Brownstone King Room (one of only three of this room on this property). It had windows facing the street, plenty of room, and is somewhat private at the end of the hall. 

The bed and pillows were super comfortable and everything in the room worked well - Good AC and strong water pressure.

This hotel also has a really nice full service restaurant/bar, plus another smaller restaurant for quick breakfasts and coffee as well as a rooftop bar. The food was great and the drinks spot on. 

We did experience an issue checking in. We arrived early at 2:00 for a 3:00 check in, and were told to come back around 3:00. No problem, we came back at around 5:00 and the room was still not ready for another 30 minutes. Kudos to Francesca at the front desk. She took the time to apologize and comped us on some free breakfasts for our trouble. Not only was she helpful, but was always welcoming with a great attitude and smile every time we saw her. We were traveling on our anniversary and the hotel added a nice touch by recognizing that with a complimentary bottle of wine and cookies.

Although the room is large, it surprisingly doesn't have a dresser or much space to store clothes if you want to unpack, and the counter surrounding the bathroom sink is not very big to hold your toiletries. We also had problems with the Wi-Fi which was spotty at best on some days. 

Aside from some shortcomings, every person we dealt with from the doorman to the waitstaff was great and we would certainly stay there again.

title: Spa Day & MJ Broadway Show
text: What a lovely trip . Hotel was in a great location and was so beautiful. The hotel staff were exceptionally friendly & accommodating. The beds were very comfortable & the room was a nice size considering we were in NYC .

title: A real gem
text:
Stayed at the Park South for a weekend. Really nice property, staff was engaging, helpful and friendly. 
common areas and our room were very clean.
Only down side was the size of the bathroom, a little tight by newer standards. 
Definity would stay there again.

title: NYC
text: Rooms were noisy because of the AC. The iron and ironing table were hard to locate and placed in a very inconvenient way. Bathroom is old. Overly priced for the quality of the room and overall service.

title: Great Hotel!
text: Was happy to find this hotel near Flat Iron. The rooms were clean and well sized and the people couldn't have been nicer. Plus three restaurants in the hotel was really great. Also incredibly close to the subway! I'd definitely recommend this to anyone traveling to New York.

title: Fabulous Stay
text: From check-in to check-out, we had a wonderful experience at Park South JDV.  Every single member of the staff was friendly and helpful.  Our room was immaculate. The Library area was a perfect place to gather, and we enjoyed the Sweetbriar restaurant and (especially) the Rooftop bar.  Loved the hotel location - access to the subway, so many great restaurants in walking distance. Excellent value/price. I'll definitely be back.

title: Great Location, Well Kept hotel.
text: I fully enjoyed the location, room cleanliness, amazing hotel staff.  My stay however was not what I needed because of poor and failing wi fi connectivity.  If you don't have to work in the room, I highly recommend the hotel.  If you rely on good internet, you may need to rethink.

title: NO COMPLAINTS FROM ME on staying at this hotel
text: We come twice a year for Tabletop market and this is our second stay in this hotel.  It's close to everything we need, we take our customers to the restaurant and the rooftop bar, the wine bar has a great vibe.

title: Overall Experience
text: I hesitate to let this best kept secret go.  The overall experience was superb. The staff was impecable.  The hotel was much better than expected.  I plan on returning in November to visit my daughter for Thanksgiving and will most certainly stay here again.

title: Avoid if you hate hidden fees
text: There are hidden fees they throw onto your incidental card which is extremely inconvenient when booking though your company. These fees are daily and not based on your actual use of services. it should just be baked into the upfront cost per night. Not going to stay here again since they caused me more work to get reimbursed.

title: Had a great stay
text:
I stayed here for 2 nights on a work trip and really enjoyed my stay. 

Pros:
Great restaurants and bars. The pizza at Sweetbriar is on another level. Just unbelievably good. I adored the restaurant staff. The complimentary coffee in the cafe was so good.  Rooftop bar is amazing. Gorgeous decor all over. 

Awesome location. Close to everything you need.

Front desk staff and the two gentlemen running the door/lobby area were so helpful. Francesca was just wonderful. 

The room was super clean, modern and had everything I needed. Manhattan isn’t known for big hotel rooms, so the room size was to be expected. 

Cons:
TV streaming options seemed dated. The only way to stream was to cast, and their system didn’t connect to my iPhone 12. I wish they’d upgrade to the TVs that let you manually log into your streaming accounts. 

Bed wasn’t the most comfy. Kinda firm yet bouncy mattress. The pillows were just meh. 

Overall I will definitely return. I thought it was a great deal and the hotel is very charming.

title: Great hotel!!
text: I've stayed at 5 star expensive hotels, but this hotel takes the cake and it was great for our budget!! The service was excellent, the room was modern and clean and I can't say enough about Rachel at the front desk. She was beyond helpful and friendly. I will definitely be staying here again!!

title: Great service. Location is good and easily accessible to anywhere.
text: Staff was nice and helpful. Easy to check in and room was perfect for what we needed during this stay. The room and bed was comfortable. I would recommend for anyone who doesn't need an large room or ALOT of sitting area.

title: Great Hotel in a great location
text: Had a great stay at this hotel. I needed a last minute place to stay and this met my needs. It has a great little lobby sitting area surrounded by books. It's close to the East River for an easy run and has great restaurants and coffee close by.

title: Don't let them assign you to the second floor!
text:
I stayed at Park South Hotel in NYC a few months ago and loved it. So I returned last week for a second stay. 

We were put in a double room on the second floor (room 203), and it was really bad. Dark, depressing, clinical: old brown carpet, half-size window looking at a rusted rooftop, bad overhead lighting and, worst of all, instead of nice lighting over the beds, a Walmart-reject desk lamp with a mostly bare bulb, radiating the most hospital/prison vibe ever. And it wouldn’t turn off! The repair guy spent 20 minutes fixing it right after we arrived and were trying to relax. 

They wouldn’t move us to another room, though it seemed pretty obvious that they could have, but they did move us to a well appointed and nicely decorated room  (same size and rate) the next day. It had new laminate floors, an actual chandelier and ambient over-bed lights including reading lights! 

I have no idea why Hyatt would try to pass off that second floor room as a $400+ room, but it was shameful.

title: Excellent Hotel! I would not stay anywhere else!!!
text: Best hotel in New York City!!!! Home from Home!!! The staff were so friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and roomy. Fantastic location. I would not stay anywhere else as this hotel really has it all.

title: The best hotel I have ever stayed in
text: When you go to Manhattan in New York this is the best hotel to stay in,the staff is very warm and inviting and helpful. The room was clean and roomy the cleaning staff was excellent. There was always someone there to help guide you.The security was top notch and the location was great.

title: Avoid rooms ending in 08
text: They are closets behind a very noisy elevator. You will not sleep. It was so loud that the walls shake. And the room is tiny even by NYC standards. It’s not a room at all. It’s smaller than Moxy. There is a TV in the room but you can’t watch it from the bed. I like Hyatt, but this hotel was an embarrassment.

title: Great location
text: I stayed here a second time after my first visit 13 years ago.  The hotel's location is even better now - the NoMad neighborhood is full of great restaurants and nearby night life.  It doesn't take long to get anywhere in NYC from here. The rooftop scene was great and the adjoining restaurants are pretty amazing. Lots of Indian restaurants and the awesome spice emporium Kalustyan's are super close by.

title: Som
text: This is a OK hotel not very good standard.AC was not working properly, Breakfast was not served in the restaurant, a small store with few options only. This kind of hotel should have continental breakfast.

title: Excellent location
text: I travelled with partner and 6 year old child, room was exceptionally clean and cleaned and bed redressed each day. All stay were welcoming, especially the door men and housekeeping. Reception always answered the phone when called to answer any queries. Room was nice and spacious, so close to metro and a short walk to the nearest park union square which my son loved! Didn’t initially have a fridge, I requested on check in feedback and fridge was delivered within 10 minutes! Would 100% recommend to anyone travelling for vacation.

title: Great hotel
text: We stayed here for my wife's birthday.  Staff already knew when I checked in and had wine and chocolates for us in our room. Very friendly and helpful staff ! Rooftop bar and restaurant are awesome and the rooms were really nice. We would definitely recommend.

title: Classy hotel
text: Located  off the beaten path, but not far off, Park South is a very well maintained property that I highly recommend.  Staff was very kind and responsive.  The door men were top notch.  Would have preferred a King bed for comfort.

title: Nice hotel, friendly & helpful staff, convenient location
text: My husband and I came to NYC for our anniversary and a friend's birthday party. The hotel was very nice, the amenities were good and the bed was comfortable. Location was very convenient for us. We enjoyed the rooftop bar as well. The staff was friendly and took good care of us. Highly recommend!

title: Watch Out For Junk Fees
text: Watch out for junk fees. I have stayed in this hotel a few times,  but on my last stay they added a “destination fee” . I asked what it was for and the front desk person gave a very vague explanation. Like most of us I had a plane to catch and couldn’t waste time arguing right at check out. Ask before you make your reservation and make sure they will not charge more than you expect right before you leave.

title: Outstanding Hotel
text: I can’t say enough about this hotel! The staff here are extremely friendly and go above and beyond. Upon arrival, we were greeted by the very best hotel ambassador we've ever experienced, Kofi Benn.  Kofi was OUTSTANDING!  Friendly, professional, and went the extra mile to make our stay the very best possible.  The front desk staff were equally attentive. The hotel is very clean, and our room was spacious.  Sweetbriar, the onsite restaurant and bar was impressive.  We will certainly stay again for our next overnight trip to the city.

title: Fabulous Boutique Hotel
text:
As an elderly single traveller I like to feel safe and have helpful staff - this hotel was amazing and nothing was too much trouble
For staff who all had a smile for you - Rachel reception was so lovely and nothing was too much trouble and all with a smile- the hotel is very clean and I loved my room with plenty of wardrobe and drawer space plus so many plugs - I had a walk in rainfall shower with disable seat and hand rails if needed - bed was very comfortable
There is a lovely cafe for breakfast attached to hotel plus a restaurant- the roof top bar and Restaurant was lovely and views were amazing 
Will definitely stay again on my next visit -
The staff make the hotel and the manager should be applauded for a really well run Hotel

title: Great location, friendly staff
text: The location is great and the staff was friendly and professional. The rooms were a bit small and lacked consistency (two identical rooms and only one had a coffee maker, plus a couple of other amenity differences). In addition, the plumbing could use some work/updating. Regardless, I would definitely stay at this property again especially given how friendly the staff was.

title: Unsafe, lacklustet
text: Hotel is not a place I would return. 1) no security or door man- anyone can enter and front desk view of front smdoor is obstructed. 2) Key card not needed for elevator so anyone can come in, roam floors even if they are not guests. 3) Booked two king rooms and asked to be side by side- hotel would not accommodate even though we booked last month with this as a request. We are at opposite ends of the hall with first room right outside the elevator. Not a good experience, service is not what we are used to.

title: Our best stay in New York
text: FABULOUS . Our 4 th visit to New Yprk and our first stay here  and we loved this hotel. a wonderful position away from the tourist areas but still close enough to walk. Great staff. good rooms which were clean and a good size .Beds were so comfortable .Would stay again if we returned to New York .

title: Very happy with our stay
text: Very happy to recommend this hotel.  My daughter and I were on holiday.  The staff were very helpful and made it a very pleasant stay. Location is great - close to the subway and lots of places to eat nearby.  We felt safe walking back at night.

title: Just a great place to be.
text: The staff is very friendly and helpfull, great rooms, and a perfect location for sightseeing (central in Manhatten). The rooftop bar is a great asset, with good food and drinks. The restaurant has a good atmosphere and good food.

title: Excellent location and very friendly and helpful staff.
text:
Excellent location - close to a useful subway line - and very friendly and helpful staff. 

The rooms (we had two for our family, both on the 4th floor) were clean and functional. The AC was very loud and we mostly switched it off (which we tend to do anyway wherever we are staying). Our rooms had no view other than of a dark courtyard, but this meant we experienced no street noise.

We asked for a fridge for each room and these were provided without any difficulty.

Our room rate did not include breakfast, and nearby options include Bagels & Schmear and Whole Foods.

We were aware of the 'destination fee', but it's still a sting in the tail when you check-out. The attached information sheet was given to us at check-out; it would have been more useful to have this information when we arrived. I don't think that paying this enhanced our stay!

Overall a good stay, though costly given that breakfast was not included in our room rate.

title: Lovely stay
text:
I have just returned from a four night stay and cannot praise this hotel highly enough,there was some construction going on outside but once inside you were unaware of the noise ,  from the moment you walk through the door you are made to feel welcome,  all the staff were warm and friendly and happy to help , big thank you to Jonathan who checked us in.
The rooms where clean and comfortable, with everything you could need throughout your stay,  housekeeping everyday with clean towels , comfortable beds , I haven't slept so well in a long time , the air conditioning was a life saver .
Excellent location ,away from the hustle and bustle but everything within walking distance and the subway station a short walk away, 
I will definitely use this hotel when I return in the future.

title: Pretty Good Stay
text: We had a pretty good stay! The construction in front of the hotel as well as the resort fee were an unexpected surprise, but other than that it was okay. Our window shade didn’t pull down, so there was a lack of privacy, not sure if that’s how all the rooms are. But good value for the location in NY and it was clean, which is a major priority.

title: Park South Hotel New-york
text: Ravie de mon séjour dans cet hôtel, si je retourne à New-York, je réserverai à cet hôtel directement. Le seul petit bémol, c'est qu'il n'y a ni petit frigo ni kitchinette, ce qui nous aurait permis de garder quelques boissons fraîches par ces temps très chauds.

title: Perfect holiday accomodation
text:
First of all, I got the best nights sleep I've ever had here. The bed was so comfy and I am not enjoying being back ay home in my own bed. I took a picture of the labels of the pillows so that I can purchase them myself but wish I had checked if it was a mattress protector used on the bed so I can also purchase that. My daughter also said how much she enjoyed sleeping in that bed. 

The hotel is in a great location, away from the hustle and bustle but still close enough if you wanted to walk anywhere. The subway at the end of the street is very handy. There is also a 24 hour shop, bagel shop and fruit stand nearby so easy to grab stuff on the go. 

My room had everything I needed: hairdryer, toiletries and iron. The room was serviced every day and was decorated to a good standard. The only negative I would say is I was unable to get a cup of tea in the room. There is a coffee machine with a pod for tea but there is no milk and no fridge to store milk. I had tea when I was out and about so no big deal. 

The staff are very friendly and also helped to arrange transportation back to the airport. I was able to store my bags on the last day as I had a late flight. 

My daughter and I both agreed we will go back to this hotel next time we go to New York.

title: Perfectly acceptable
text: Probably average in every way. Nothing to shout about and nothing to moan about. If you are coming to NYC and want a clean bed in a convenient location this will do just fine. Subway a few steps away and lots of food available locally. Staff are lovely, very friendly and professional.

title: A hotel with potential but in need of a refresh
text: Very good location, subway is at the door. Nice commodities in the surroundings (Whole Foods Market, a few good restaurants at walking distance). But the rooms would need a refresh (noisy airco, some traces of age and stains a bit everywhere, room and bathroom). Nice potential though. Some staff is very helpful.

title: Trip 18 to a great hotel
text: Yet another trip to The Park South in NYC has not disappointed us.  Superb hotel ideally situated with excellent professional staff who are now our good friends.  Would not want to stay anywhere else whilst in NYC.

title: Great hotel, well located, friendly staff - highly recommended
text:
We stayed in the Park South for a family trip to NYC in July 2023.  The hotel was well presented, clean and welcoming.  Staff were all friendly and helpful.

We thought the location was great - about 5 mins walk from the Empire State Building and 2 mins from the nearest subway (line 6).  Times Square was about 25 mins walk.  Financial District and WTC could have been about an hour on foot but a quick subway ride was easy.  If you want a Midtown hotel this one will work for you.  We did nearly everything on foot with just a few subway rides in four days and a couple of taxis. 

There is a restaurant which serves dinner (although we did not use) and the coffee lounge serves breakfast (limited to pastries, croissants, egg bacon and cheese croissant, tea and coffee).  Breakfast for four was about $45.  The roof top bar was very nice although not sure the rules on U21s after (?) 7.30pm - on one day we were told we couldn't go (with 18 and 20 year olds) and another day we did, and had dinner.

The rooms were clean and beds really comfy.  Others have commented on the AC being noisy and I would have to agree although it was not a major problem.  AC is 100% needed in July as the windows only open about 4 inches and it was stifling without.  We had a king bedroom which was a good size.  We later had to move to a double because of a problem (which was sorted without difficulty with a number of options and entirely to our satisfaction) and that was smaller.  As a sleeping base though the smaller room was fine.  

There are restaurants in the area and Eataly with a number of options is a short walk away.  Plenty of other offerings too within a short walk.

Overall, I would recommend this hotel and if we return to NY at some point in the future I would be more than happy to stay there again.

title: Exceptional Experience
text: Best hotel stay I've had in a very long time. Room was reasonably large for NYC, location was excellent, did not hear any street noise from 5th floor, Thursday featured free drinks in the lobby - very tasty cocktails, gym was small but met my wife's high standards (nicely air conditioned, good equipment). The best part was the staff. Hands down the best staff. Even my kids commented on it. Every interaction made us feel special and I experienced and saw other people experience over-the-top excellent and unique customer service. Will definitely stay here again.

title: Good hotel but was better 6 months ago…
text: It was my second time here and I decided to back after a good stay on december. In this time, first of all, my room was old and the shower was like a bed and breakfast hotel. They changed my room just after 2 complains about the shower. On the second room, the AC broked and I had to change again… so, during 6 nights, we had to move to 3 different rooms… maintenance is a problem here!

title: Stay here! It’s great!
text: Really lovely hotel, very relaxed, great staff, very warmly welcomed day and night. Rooms spotlessly clean , tea, coffee etc. great location too - subway at the end of the street, restaurants, coffee shops etc! One of the nicest we’ve stayed at in Manhattan - thank you😍

title: Nice rooms and great location
text: Our room this time was a bit larger, which made the experience all the better. The staff promptly brought a refrigerator to the room. Everyone was very friendly. And we love the location, close to Madison Square Park and the Flatiron Building. The nearby restaurants are top-notch.

title: Great Location with mediocre service
text: The property is located with great connectivity to Subway and food establishment however we experienced two many issues with out keycard to unlock the room. We had to request new card almost every time before attempting to open the door. They promised to repair the lock which was never done. Although staff on duty tried their best to help it wasn't sufficient.

title: My stay at the hotel
text: I had an overall great stay at the hotel. The service was great, room always clean, very beautiful ambient, free cocktail hour (which I never took advance of but should’ve). I was staying over due to a family situation, near the hospital, and although I was going through a rough time, once I walked into the hotel, everyone made me feel so comfortable and made my situation a lot easier, especially Bryan.

title: Great hotel with Poor staff
text: Great location, decent promised amenities. We bailed two services at the for the 5 day stay - laundry and housekeeping both below published standards of responsiveness. Snafus happen we get it but what you do to address it shows the mettle of the property. The patronizing attitude of the staff after both incidents of delayed laundry and 2/5 days with no housekeeping then questioning our schedule and insinuating we are liars for not turning on “green light” when we did and staying at the hotel past the time we thought we would leave for work ( because we were waiting on  clean laundry) left a poor taste in an otherwise okay stay. Every time we would come down the elevator after those incidents they would scream from behind their reception desks asking us in a patronizing tone if our room was NOW okay.

title: My stay was horrible.
text: My stay was very bad. As the front desk was handing me the keys to check in, they let me know I had been “downgraded.” They said they were sorry but couldn’t offer any compensation or an upgrade. I eventually got them to take $30 off the bill despite getting a room with a double bed the size of a closet. Do not stay here, there are many better options in the area

title: Park South Hotel is GREAT!
text: Do yourself a favor and stay at this wonderful boutique hotel. The staff are INCREDIBLE. The food at the restaurant Sweetbriar is UNBELIEVABLE (go and order the Stone Cornbread, the Hangar Steak and the American Beauty cocktail...you'll thank me). The bed was extremely comfortable and just what was needed after a long day of sightseeing. The staff at the front desk had great recommendations and treated us like honored guests. It's a perfect location, steps away from a subway stop and just a few blocks away from the FlatIron district. Great spot to stay...will definitely return!

title: Perfect location, friendly welcome
text: Could not have been more pleased with our choice of hotel for our first stay in New York. The location was perfect as it was right on the no. 6 subway line which could take you to Downtown or Uptown in a very short time. The staff were so friendly and welcoming. Rooms were clean and well equipped. Would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting for a sightseeing vacation. Many of the guests seemed to be regular visitors which says it all!

title: Horrible!
text:
I honestly feel scammed by these reviews. This hotel is horrible. The staff isn’t friendly or welcoming. They charge a destination fee then did not provide any info for the wifi, did not provide bottled water, and did not have coffee in the lobby as promised. 

The rooms are old, smelly, and dusty. Extremely worn down. Rust on every metal fixture. The AC is loud and filled with grim. The bedding wasn’t even properly done. They laid a top sheet over the mattress. Then an old discolored duvet between two more top sheets. 

Rooms are VERY small which can be expected for NYC but the lack of cleanliness and upkeep was unacceptable. 

It is a complete joke they claim to be a four star hotel.

I honestly feeling scammed out of $700 (charging nearly $350 a night for this is criminal).

title: Fun weekend.
text: My only complaint was the size of the room. It was a bit small. Also, my room wasn’t stocked with many towels…However, housekeeping happily gave me more towels. Also, valet parking at the hotel was excellent. My brand new car didn’t have any scratches when they returned it to me.

title: Above Average hotel. But you will pay $500/night and get no complementary continental breakfast.
text: Good location. Above average boutique hotel. I’m a member, and paid to upgrade my room. Had to call for water. Told at the continental breakfast bar “ you gotta pay for that.” Even Holiday Inn Express in Manhattan offers a complementary full breakfast. You would think after paying Hyatt Park Avenue $500/night they could give you a free muffin and coffee. Nope.

title: Fabulous Hotel & Customer service
text:
I booked my son & his friend into this hotel in June as he was in NYC to celebrate his 21st birthday and attend an event at Madison Sq Gardens.   

In advance of them arriving I was in touch with the hotel & Rachel from the customer support team was such a helpful attentive individual, assisting me with having everything paid for in advance of my son checking in to ensure he had no issues.  My son said the hotel was so clean and the staff very friendly, they even decorated his bedroom door and left  him a sweet gift and birthday card which was such a lovely gesture.  He was a 20 min walk to Times Sq and Madison Sq Gardens. He loved the rooftop bar with the guest private lift access from the hotel.    On his birthday I arranged with a local cake supplier to deliver a cake to the hotel and the staff ensured this was placed in his room to return back to.  They also provided a box for him to bring the cake back home - Yes he never ate it all whilst he was there!!!    The hotel staff gave me piece of mind that he was safe and in good hands whilst travelling abroad and I cannot thank them enough.  My son has said they were all brilliant, room was very clean and comfortable and he would definitely be looking at booking this hotel should he visit NYC again.   Massive THANK YOU to all the staff at the Park South Hotel for making his trip so memorable!  You are a credit to this hotel.

title: Fantastic hotel
text: I really can't say enough about our experience at Park south. From the moment we checked in to the moment we checked out the hotel staff made us feel so welcome. We have stayed all over the world but I think the hotel staff at this particular hotel really are some of the best. Particular mentions are Brian, Barbara and Coffey who went to great efforts to ensure our holiday which included us getting married in NYC went smoothly. The hotel itself is located in a great area, plenty of bars and restaurants however it is far enough out from the madness that it feels like an oasis when you get back in the evening. The roof top bar is amazing also Sweet Briar NYC the hotel restaurant is one of the best in New York we only ate there one night but it is very special. All in all we would definitely be returning to the hotel in the future. Bravo Park South

title: Love this place!!
text:
I hate Tripadvisor and seldom do reviews for them.  I absolutely adore the Park South, so I'll suck it up and write one.   

The location is great.  Safe, not too busy yet still has the NY hustle, and so many great restaurants and music venues within walking distance.  The hotel itself is modern and updated, rooms are a decent size for NYC.  Comfy bed, good water pressure in the bathroom, fast internet access, valet parking, very nice rooftop bar/lounge.   But the nicest surprise was how friendly, helpful and sincere every person who works there is.  They really made my trip super enjoyable.

title: Nice room, love (very expensive) rooftop bar
text:
We’ve stayed here at least 6 times, all before Covid. The first few times there was a free continental breakfast which I miss. After the renovation, room costs went way up and breakfast went away. Previously we stayed related to surgeries At NYU Langone- this was a good location. This time we met up with family. Would’ve loved to have stayed 2 nights but couldn’t afford it. They used to give me a better rate because I had stayed before. 
The rooms are nice and the staff are wonderful. The rooftop is great on a nice night (but you can’t bring up your complimentary glass of wine no matter what you’re told).

title: Park South always satisfies!
text: I’ve been traveling to Park South for 15+ years for business and pleasure. The staff treats me like one of the family and always tries to insure that I feel well taken care of. Krystal, Rachel, Barbara at the front desk/managers and Mohammed and Kofe  were particularly attentive on my recent stay

title: Great Stay, Great Staff!
text: Every encounter with the staff at Park South was a pleasure -- friendly, funny, anticipatory ... from check-in to cleaning staff to the bartenders at the Rooftop Garden bar. The rooms were very clean, with plenty of room for work and rest. The food and drinks were great along with the view from the roof. I wish we had a longer stay planned here.

title: Stylish hotel with great staff
text:
Stylish room, comfortable bed, no great view from our room but fabulous roof top bar made up for that. 2 other restaurant options, free drink voucher is a nice bonus. Good location to walk or take the subway on the corner. Bagel shop next door is amazing, locals queuing out of the door, plus large Whole Foods supermarket a block away for supplies.  Staff here are superb, cheerful ( in a genuine way) and helpful - ask them to arrange a cab back to the airport, plus they store luggage. 
Only issue was noise from 8th floor roof top bar, it wouldn’t put me off staying again, just ask for a lower floor.

title: Great Place to Stay in Manhattan!
text: This was my second stay at Park South Hyatt.  It's a great place, the staff is fantastic, and the location couldn't be better.  With easy access to the subway and lots of great places to eat - I love staying here when in Manhattan.

title: Great location, fantastic service.
text: The hotel staff was clean and the air conditioning was really needed and easy to control. The hotel was close to subways with easy access to get around or a nice walk to the main attractions. The roof top bar was lovely, breakfast was nice and very reasonable price. The coffee machine in the room was fantasic, and the hotel was more then happy to restock it. The hotel was in a quiet area and there was not much noise. Would highly recommend.

title: Great and safe location
text:
Great location and wonderful area. Safe area and nice staff. Close to train
Really enjoyed the front door staff and also thought the front desk staff was very knowledgeable. Nice to have a close restaurant in hotel and and roof top bar is THE BEST

title: Park South is a gem!
text: Park South is a real gem of a hotel. Absolutely amazing staff at every level who can't do enough for you. Spacious clean rooms with comfortable beds. Air con noisy but I've never stayed anywhere that has quiet AC. Incredible onsite restaurants one serving a great range of food including wood fired pizzas. Also a very trendy sushi & cocktail bar with excellent dishes. Fantastic location for exploring Manhattan's midtown. Highly recommended.

title: Solid Hotel
text:
Friendly and helpful staff, good location - close to a subway station, good sized room, room cleaned to a good level when we requested, nice and hot shower although the pressure at times could be stronger but it was always sufficient.  Finally, sleep quality was excellent; lovely, big bed, so comfortable and pillows how I like it.
I would not hesitate to stay here again nor hesitate to recommend.

title: Hidden Gem
text: We travel to NYC at least once a year for fun. We typically stay in mid-town close to Grand Central just because it’s convenient. We decided to try the Park South Hotel (PSH) as it was in a less touristy spot and we like the rooftop bar there.  The hotel did not disappoint! It’s more on the boutique side and the staff is very nice and efficient.  The room was perfect, spacious (especially for NYC) and we were lucky enough to have a view of the Chrysler Building.  The hotel is located in more of a neighborhood setting, which we loved. The subway was just a few yards away - super convenient. Again, we love The Roof bar on their rooftop. A casual outdoor lounge with amazing view and awesome staff. We’ll be back!

title: Clean Hotel, Great Location
text: Was very satisfied with the hotel. Very clean and nice room. Location was great. Definitely would consider stating at this hotel again in the future. The rooftop bar is also a very nice place to hang out. All of the staff at the hotel were very friendly.

title: Fantastic!
text: My partner and I had a fantastic stay at the Park South Hotel. The customer service was wonderful! The drinks were unique at the restaurants at the roof and next door and with an appealing aesthetic. This will be our choice hotel when staying Manhattan again!

title: Park South Hotel NYC
text: Lovely hotel offering a more opulent feel without being too big. Rooms were quiet, (May 2023) little noise heard from elsewhere. Lovely roof top bar & 2x popular restaurants & small bar to the rear also serving coffee/tea. 2 minute walk to 28th St & Park Metro gives excellent access to the 6 (green line) local trains & beyond. Very good location for accessing all of NYCs tourist attractions. Overall great feel, would definitely recommend.

title: Misleading based on website photos but good location for my needs
text: I stayed here for 5 nights during a business trip and felt like I was mislead a bit when I booked. The photos online look lovely but the hotel itself is quite old and small. I know it’s New York, but the rooms were tiny and outdated. The music at night was quite loud (likely coming from the rooftop bar) and my keys needed to be reactivated at least 1-2 times per day. I enjoyed the location and the staff were helpful but I probably wouldn’t stay here again now having seen it.

title: Great stay in New York
text:
Had 5 fantastic nights at the park south hotel in New York.
Everything about our stay was great the rooms nice and clean with a very comfortable bed.
Great location with lots of bars and restaurants within walking distance.
All staff we great and very friendly and helpful but special thanks to Chuck for arranging our return back to the airport.
Wouldn’t t hesitate to return to this hotel if back in New York.

title: The best place to stay if you want to discover NY
text:
The hotel I most probably would take again if there's a next NY-visit, also because the location seemed me perfect for someone who wants to discover New York. And you're in Manhattan!
The people a Park South were very nice and always ready to help!

title: Exceptional experience
text: From the moment we stepped in, we were greeted by Chuck who makes you feel special. Check-in was easy, room was clean and comfortable, hotel is steps from subway and centrally located. Would definitely recommend to friends. We were visiting family and traveled with my elderly mom, staff was wonderful to her.

title: Charged additional fees that the front desk told me they would waive
text: I booked this hotel in NYC the same day (I booked it over the phone, and stood outside the hotel and then walked in to check in.) I checked in. I told the front desk I may need to leave Friday afternoon and not need the additional night through Saturday.  The Manager was a lady I spoke to and she told me she completely understood and that if I needed to check out early on Friday I would NOT be charge an early check out fee and she would be there to check me out and assure no additional charges.  I told the front desk I needed to go home early and I would be checking out Friday at 12pm.  When I checked out Friday afternoon they charged me an early check out fee! I was promised there wouldn't be one.  Hyatt has always had great service when I stay with them and this time I didn't feel I received the top of the line service.

title: Hotel
text: I have recently had a holiday in New York.  The hotel was extremely clean and personnel friendly.  There was no breakfast but a coffee bar attached to the hotel - bit pricey.  There is also a restaurant where I ate once.  Food was excellent but pricey,  Very close to subway and one stop (also walkable) to  Manhattan Gardens,

title: Great service In convenient location
text: Great location and friendly, extremely helpful service! Everyone has a smile and is kind and helpful. Traveling with a family, I really appreciate this! Door Ambassador Chuck Norris has been a highlight of our trips - thank you and hope to see you next time!

title: Great hotel with amazing staff
text: Hotel was in a great position to explore NY.  Staff were amazing, friendly and very attentive.  The team on reception were friendly and could not do enough to help.  Overall this hotel exceeded our expectations with a larger than expected room for NY

title: Tout simplement Parfait
text:
Le Park South Hotel est un hotel cosy qui convient parfaitement pour séjourner dans la ville de la démesure.

Dans une partie de la 28th Street très calme, vous apprécierez de moins entendre le brouhaha permanent.

Il se trouve au milieu de Manhattan et à 50 mètres de la ligne de métro N°6, cela permet de pouvoir se rendre assez rapidement soit à Central Park soit à Wall-Street.

Tout le personnel (Portier, femme de chambre, agent d'accueil,....) est au petit soin afin de rendre votre séjour le plus agréable possible.

Les chambres sont spacieuses (27 M2) et la literie est confortable (plus souple qu'en Europe mais après 17 KM/jours, ce n'est pas un soucis...LOL)

La propreté est plus que présente que ce soit dans les chambres et les partie communes.

Ce fut une belle découverte et nous vous conseillons vivement d'y séjourner lors de votre prochain séjour.

title: A great hotel !
text:
A great stay at this hotel. A special thank you to Mohammed Shetaya for always going above and beyond . He would always greet us with a smile and nothing was too much for him. A Great asset to Park South Hotel, thank you Mohammed. 
A thank you to Alexander for being great too.

title: Mohamed Shetaya and Alexander were brilliant!
text: Mohamed Shetaya and Alexander were brilliant! They both went the extra mile for us. They are a credit to the hotel. Made us feel so comfortable and couldn’t do enough for us! Location of the hotel is great. Right next to the subway. Very close to the main attractions. We loved our stay! Thank you!

title: best hotel in nyc
text:
We love this hotel- the staff and service are fantastic. We loved the area in Manhattan and the fireplace and the ROOFTOP BAR!!!!

We can not wait to return- we are very appreciative for such awesome customer service-

title: Great location!
text: I had an excellent 4 night stay, at the Park South. I picked this Hotel instead of my usual choices mid-town, as it is walking distance to my work appointment.  It was raining pretty hard the whole time, so it gives me the chance to visit both restaurants at the Hotel.  They are excellent and I am glad I pick Park South for my trip.

title: Bon hotel
text:
Bien situé au centre de NY
Accueil et personnels très bien 
Chambre un peu petite mais propre
Réactivité du personnel dans les demandes 
Salle de bain petite également mais correcte 
Bon avis général sur cet établissement

title: Stay Midtown in this beautiful hotel
text: Stayed here recently for 4 nights - very friendly.  Great location for all the attractions, within walking distrance.  Subway 28th Street just on the corner.  Amazing bagel shop next door and other breakfast places near by - Penelopes and Sarabeth's.  Tea/coffee in the room with complimentary coffee in the morning from the cafe at the back of the hotel.  Lovely library area with warm fire glowing which was very welcome as the weekend was very wet.  We loved our stay here and will be back.

title: Great stay at Park South hotel!
text: Great stay! The location is perfect, near many restaurants, the room was very clean and quiet. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Had a great time during my stay and will definitely come back on my next visit!

title: Go-to for NYC
text: We usually stay at this property at least once a quarter given our daughter lives close by and have never been disappointed. It's not cheap, but we love the location and the staff have always been helpful and friendly. Will return.

title: Almost 4 stars, but not
text:
Rating is 3.75 stars...  it's pretty good , borderline very good.

stayed one night.  didn't hang around in the 'hood.  check-in was seamless,  the front desk peeps are very nice.  and on Thur nite free drinks til 6.   

building:  modern, boutique-ish.  small but good initial impression.  elevators are tiny...;)

location:  convenient and quiet for NYC.  

halls were clean,  decorative and very quiet.  

room:  room was amazingly quiet for nyc.  i was on 7th floor, mid way down the hall.  this is where i dinged it.  size is small, but to be expected.   furnishings stylish, but long-in-tooth.  cabinets and doors had scratches, hard to open, etc.  bed linens and stuff were clean and comfy, but the frame would creak at times.  AC/Heat was problematic in that the room is so small, you can feel the hot/cold air blowing right on you when lying in bed.  totally unacceptable.  i had to prop a pillow and chair to block 2/3rds of the vent.  it seemed to struggle maintaing a steady temp as well.  

bathroom:   very clean, nice and room to put stuff around sink, etc.  shower head  didn't flow really well.  and for a so called "boutique" hotel the shampoo, soap are in mega bottles vs individual, and were of lesser quality. 

with some basic improvements it can get to 4 stars.

title: Park South NY
text:
Excellent staff and localization 
Nice restaurant and good coffee shop 
for breakfast……….
Bathroom very clean and bed is very comfortable………..
Quiet at night and the room has all necessary stuff………………..

title: Super friendly boutique hotel
text: Echt een aanrader. De locatie is top, het personeel heel vriendelijk en de kamers zeer ruim voor New York. Zou er zeker nog eens verblijven. We voelden ons zeer welkom in het hotel dankzij het personeel en de kleine attenties. De kamers waren zeker en vast in orde.

title: Medical stay
text: NYU Langone recommended this hotel as I was coming in for surgery from out of town.  I was graciously accommodated and had an excellent experience there.  Having an upper floor facing the inside courtyard made my stay very quiet and restful.

title: Très agréable séjour
text:
Nous sommes venu 4 nuits pour une étape de notre voyage de noce.
L’hôtel nous avait été recommandé et nous n’avons pas été déçu.
Le personnel est très sympathique, la chambre petite (normal c’est New York) mais très propre et agréable.
L’hôtel est très bien situé.
Nous reviendrons pour notre prochain séjour :)

title: Simply perfect
text:
The staff is so welcoming. Always ready to help if needed. 
Room really comfortable, enough space for all the luggage. Bathroom is also super clean. 
The restaurant is top. Probably one of the best burgers I’ve eaten.

title: Great Boutique Hotel !!!
text: Had a great time at the Park South on a group trip with friends the staff were very friendly & nice & all my needs were always atteneded too , also the doorman Kofi was our Mvp he was so nice & helpful taking care of us like family we would come back here just for his smile alone

title: Great location.
text: We stayed as a family of 4. The hotel is in a great location, close to a subway station, in walking distance of Empire State Building and Times Square. The room was basic but clean. We had a two bedded room, there was not a lot of storage space for our clothes, it would be fine if there were only two people in the room. Staff were very helpful, especially the doormen. The only thing that let the hotel down, hence the 4 star rating, was the housekeeping. They only left 2 towels instead of 4. First, we thought it was an oversight, but it happened every day. Another day, they left the filled bin bag in the room, and another day did not refill the coffee supplies. If they got this right, it would be an excellent hotel.

title: Excellent stay when in the Flatiron district for business
text: The hotel is 2 blocks from work so the commute is a breeze.  The staff is friendly, helpful, and always available.   The rooms are clean and well maintained.   Also it is close to several restaurants.  Would recommend it highly.

title: Excellent service and friendly caring staff!
text: The room was clean, beautifully decorated. A nice lounge and library area. Everyone was friendly and professional. The service in Sweetbriar restaurant was excellent. It  was a pleasant experience staying there, one of the best parts of my visit to New York!

title: Be very aware of the 'location fee' which is charged outside of your room rate.
text:
The hotel was OK, the room a little tired and not the most up to date, but fine. Staff were very friendly and the location fine too.

However, what wasn't clear was that a $30 per day 'destination fee' person would be charged on top of the room rate, which they take from your incidentals deposit. Absolutely none of the supposed benefits are worth this fee and they refused to substitute tea for coffee. A discount is offered for One World Trade but a booking fee is added, which no other vendor adds, so there is no discount at all. This makes the hotel more expensive than average and just not worth it. The one free drink on arrival was nice, which did use up most of the $30 fee for one day as the bar prices here are very high.

To summarise, an ok hotel, very nice staff but overall I feel totally ripped off and simply cannot recommend to stay here whilst they a charge an additional fee.

title: Great Service/Centrally Located
text: The front desk staff was amazing especially Barbara.  Easy check in process.  We needed ice and they brought it up with in minutes of me calling.  Definitely visit the insight restaurant SweetBriar.  The food was delicious and the drinks were good too.

title: Boutique hotel with good staff
