text: This is not a large hotel by NYC standards and I think it is more accessible and friendlier because of it.  Multiple attractive in house food/drink options and a whisky tasking happy hour.   Price is competitive but NYC is not cheap (surprise).   Beds were comfortable w/no street noise in our room (not street facing).   We frequented the lower east side midtown so the location (in the middle of those) meant we were able to walk to sites, mostly, and take the #6 train north/south from close by.  I will look to staying here again.

title: A joy!
text:
At the front desk I was greeted with a friendly and enthusiastic attitude and expertly handled reservation. Barbara and Luis were both the excellent front desk people. What a welcome from Rachel, reservation manager and Tara, Sales Manager. When I got to the room, it was beautiful and spotless. 
I have to say Hyatt Park South Hotel at 28th is wonderful! 
I would stay here again.

title: Lovely hotel in a good location with friendly and helpful staff
text: I can thoroughly recommend this hotel. It was ideal to stay in on our first visit to this amazing city. Our room was nicely appointed and very clean. The hotel is located close to the subway which is very handy. The staff were all very welcoming and helpful including Chuck and all the door ambassadors. All in all, it made for a very nice stay.

title: Great location! Lovely hotel!
text: Park South hotel (part of Hyatt) is a lovely hotel!  This hotel was clean, had well-appointed rooms, and is located in the heart of Manhattan. The staff helped us with anything we needed and were friendly. We got free coffee in the mornings and read in the library. There are a ton of places to eat and drink close by. The subway is super close! I will stay here for all of my trips to NYC!

title: Worst mistake. Do not book
text: Worst hotel I’ve ever stayed in. They made the entire process a nightmare. The customer service, room cleanliness, and maintenance as well. Do not book this hotel. Run away and don’t even bother considering this.

title: Lovely Hotel and Staff
text: Situated in a quiet area of NY Mid Town with access to the Metro at the end of the street. The hotel is quiet and comfortable and exceeded our expectations. The staff are extremely efficient and friendly and if you are lucky enough to meet Chuck who is front of house, that is a real treat as he is so friendly and knowledgable and made us feel so welcome.

title: Excellent stay- a returning hotel guest
text: Happy to be back at the Park South JdV by Hyatt hotel. Comfortable and quiet rooms. Great service, nice atmosphere, and very good restaurant. This is great if you don’t want to go very far to have a nice evening at a quality restaurant.

title: Great place to stay!
text: Wonderful staff.  Wonderful location.  Very clean and comfortable.  We stayed for close to a week and were treated like family.  The staff knew our comings and goings and genuinely cared how everything was going.

title: Great location, great staff!
text: You can see from the photos how beautiful this hotel is and all of the wonderful amenities it offers. What you can’t see is the warm vibe and attentive staff. It was a welcome surprise. The hotel is in a great part of the city with tons of options for dining. I will stay here again!

title: A gem in New York
text: Just had a long weekend break at the Park South Hotel. What a find. Fully lives up to and deserving of its Trip Advisor rating of NYC hotels. Ideal location close to transport links. Great if you like to walk a lot as we do. Has lots of good restaurants within a short walk. The staff without exception are all really nice people but very good at what they do. It’s impeccably maintained and clean in the rooms and public areas. Would definitely return and would recommend it for a stay

title: Friendly,  charming staff make this hotel
text: Lovely hotel , comfortable large beds, good coffee machine in room , good shower and toiletries were excellent. First time visiting New York and we loved this hotel, in good neighbourhood with easy access to restaurants and diners and close to subway so made getting about easy. The staff here were very welcoming and we were given free drinks vouchers on arrival. There is a large dining room and bar area, plus a Japanese restaurant and also a lovely, cosy library area. The door ambassadors were all helpful , friendly and charming especially the lovely Mohamed Shetaya, who arranged a car for us back to the airport but took good care of us during the week we were there. The staff here are all friendly and helpful. Would recommend this hotel to couples or friends of any age, easy access and two lifts.

title: Hidden Gem in Awesome Location
text:
I loved absolutely everything about this hotel - the staff, ambience, location, amenities - I have nothing but positive things to say. It reminded my of the boutique hotels you’d find in Europe. Highlights included the cozy library with the fireplace, the comfy couches where they offer grab and go breakfast, and the staff that make you not only feel like you are home but part of a family. Special shout out to Kofi and Chuck!!!
I was there in late March so I didn’t get to experience the rooftop bar but from all the e photos I’ve seen and reviews I have read, I will be returning when it’s open.

title: Excellent stay at Park South
text:
I stayed at Park South for 5 nights, and I was beyond satisfied with my stay. The hotel is perfectly located, and felt safe and quiet. The room was much bigger than anticipated and very comfortable. The subway is just up the street and everything you need is
close by.
The staff was very nice and helpful.

title: Early Spring Break
text: A small hotel located conveniently in midtown Manhattan. 2 mins from the nearest subway makes easy to get to and also easy to explore the city. Many major tourist attractions are within walking distance. Our room was a little on the small side with not a great view but as we wanted to spend most of our time out and about this wasn’t an issue. It’s in a relatively quiet location so sleeping wasn’t a problem. There are some good eats and shops close by and the bagel store 2 doors up is a must.

title: Great choice
text: Lovely hotel. Convenient location. The room was spotless and comfortable. Lounge was inviting. Complimentary coffee in the morning. Staff was attentive. Overall I was very happy with this hotel choice.

title: Great hitel
text: The hotel was great. Good service and good staff. The rooms were small and not much storage for the lugage. We needed to close our lugage every night but tve rest of the hotel was very good. Can’t imagine that there is a better hotel.

title: Easy & Pleasant Stay
text: Although I stayed for a quick business trip and didn’t spend much time in the hotel, it was pleasant. Staff were friendly, and it appeared and felt clean. Staff accommodated an early check-in for me, which allowed me time to shower before my business event. I would stay there again!

title: Great Stay at Park South, cozy & professional
text:
Great overall experience. Very very helpful staff. I had to extend my stay, front desk handled easily. They answer their phones quickly. 

Chuck & door ambassadors are so nice & welcoming. 

Ate dinner at the bar in the restaurant, again great attitudes from everyone. Food was tasty. 

Room clean, pretty & normal nyc hotel size. 
Nice library with fireplace & lobby small but convenient community space. 

Roof top closed for the season but would come back in the spring. 

Location- Great bagel place a few doors down. Easy to get to anywhere plus good place to walk. 

Would definitely stay again.

title: delight stay as always
text: My New York home, lovely small hotel with perfect location and friendly staff, The doormen make the experience!!! drink coupon is a wonderful touch.  Happy hour in the bar was perfect end of long day!!

title: Best hotel stay in years!!
text: Outstanding staff who made me feel like a welcome guest.   Everyone from the bell person, to the restaurant staff, to the amazing young man that checked me in, it was a wonderful experience.  I chose the hotel because it was within walking distance of my family, but I will be coming back.

title: Very Good Stay @ Park South Hotel
text: Hotel all that you could hope for in a 5 day city break. Clean, well equipped rooms. Attentive staff. Varied and tasty menu. Would recommend to any visitor. Plus, concierge Kofi Benn worked hard to ensure our airport travel needs were catered for. Thank you Park South, we had a great time with you 🇺🇸 🇬🇧

title: Beware of Pathetic Destination Fees
text: CUSTOMERS BEWARE: We stayed in this hotel and we were slapped with a $25 per night destination fee. This was not visible on Lastminute.com. When I checked out, they told me I was 'all set' and had nothing else to owe them from my stay. They just asked for my email address. A couple of days later, they sent me a bill for $190 of hotel fees. What does this 'fee' include? Wifi, a 'FREE' drink and access to the rooftop bar.. which was CLOSED. I emailed back and said I dispute this, it was not made clear to me, and I wish to hold the payment until I seek some legal advice. They ignored my message and charged my card. I called and asked for the manager to call me - 'right away' they said, and they never called. What a dishonest, slimy way of conducting a business. All so that they can appear cheap on third-party websites. They misled me as a customer and I have told everyone I know to avoid them. Park South, I'm still waiting for your call, have you grown a spine yet?

title: Nice stay
text: Nice hotel with friendly helpful staff and nice dining room. Mohamed Shetaya was always there welcoming us and helping us spot our Lyft rides. The staff and maids were accommodating.  Enjoyed our visit.  They have a beautiful room to lounge by the fire.

title: Enjoyed our staff
text: Luis and Muhammad were exemplary from the point of arrival to the departure.  They were pleasant and engaging and readily attended our few requests during the stay.  There were other front desk personnel they were of the same character but I failed to get their names.  We enjoyed our stay and would welcome returning should the need arise.

title: A+ Stay and Micro Wedding
text: Our family had an A+ experience from the moment we arrived until departure, during our recent three night stay at the ParkSouth Hotel.  Mohamed met our family group at the front door, and was very patient and helpful in organizing and storing baggage until check-in time.   The front desk staff were very helpful and worked with us to check-in early while rooms were readied.  We were able to go about our business of going to lunch and running errands while Mohamed made sure our luggage was in our respective rooms when we got back to the hotel later in the afternoon.  Our rooms were spacious, clean, and comfortable, and served our needs very well.  Star and events staff were great to work with in planning, arranging, and setting up event space to accommodate my Son’s wedding and dinner on Saturday evening. The library area proved to be the perfect gathering space for mornings and before dinner in the evening, while the bar area was great for a pre-dinner drink.  This was our second time to stay at the ParkSouth and will definitely not be our last.

title: Go away
text: Chambres petites, prix vraiment injustifié ! Et de plus ils ont essayé de nous faire payer encore 30 dollars par nuit de destination fee !!! Soit disant compris dans ma réservation mais ce n’était pas le cas. Pas d’excuse et on nous a même rit au nez! Vraiment honteux.

title: Excellent Customer Service
text: The staff were exceptionally helpful and went above and beyond expectations. A bellhop greeted us at the Uber and carried our bags. The wine reception at 4:30 was a classy touch. The fireplace in the library was warm and cozy and the wine was terrific.

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text: We had a great stay! Louis at the desk was so helpful and able to get us double beds since we were bringing the kids last minute. Mohammed and the rest of the staff were top notch and made the stay amazing. Lovely and clean rooms. Quiet. Really great place! Right next to subway and yummy bagel place next door.

title: Excellent Stay
text: Amazing stay! Hotel was perfectly located close to everything! And the staff were super friendly and beyond gracious and helpful. Rooms were were good for what we needed and clean. Would definitely stay again.

title: Very Nice Stay!
text: This hotel was clean and just what was needed to our three night stay, a clean room and a comfy bed - location was excellent with access to the 6 line right at the corner and Bagel and Schmear for a quick breakfast to start the day. Staff were very helpful and friendly.

title: Small Wedding and Weekend Stay
text: We stayed in the Park South for a weekend and held a family wedding in the basement room. Staff are especially attentive and excellent overall service. The library space on the ground floor is an excellent option to the lobby. We did have a slight issue with the billing so best to check before leaving the hotel.

title: Perfect for us, lovely hotel
text: This was our third stay at Park South and we will definitely be back. Our daughter lives in the neighborhood and we are so happy that this lovely little hotel is only a couple of blocks from her apartment. The rooms are relatively spacious, nicely decorated, and very clean and the hotel staff is extremely accommodating and friendly.

title: Favourite Place to Stay in New York
text: We booked two rooms for four friends. Each room had two double beds. It was a ladies weekend in New York for three nights ( four days). We loved our stay at Park South hotel. The rooms were perfect and clean. The staff are very friendly and helpful. And the doormen were great. In particular Kofi. The nicest doorman in New York! Our flight back to Canada was scheduled for 7 PM, but we had to vacate a room by noon. The hotel stored our luggage during the day so we could take in the city before we left. They have two great restaurants and a bar. And in the morning we had complementary tea/coffee and our choice to purchase a medley of yummy breakfast options. The food served at the restaurants is so good that people are outside of staying at the hotel. Come to eat here. I imagine they are all New Yorkers in the neighborhood. The restaurants are packed at night! I will definitely stay at this hotel. Every time I come to New York in the future.  excellent location as well! And literally a one minute walk to the closest subway station.

title: Hidden gem
text: You will have to experience it for yourself! I❤️this property. The easy of access, cleanliness, knowledge of the staff makes for an incredible stay. Consistency is key when it comes to providing good service and JDV by Hyatt has kept up with expectations after Hyatt acquired this chain of boutique hotels!

title: Perfect Location
text: This is the perfect hotel for a weekend in the city ! Easy commute from JKF airport. The staff was so welcoming. The room was bigger than I expected and cleaned. The hotel has a little area perfect for reading a book or work on your computer. Just around the corner, you have the subway who runs uptown or downtown to Brooklyn. Overall, it was a perfect stay.

title: Great experience
text: Ottima soluzione per una breve visita a NY. Posizione davvero strategica in quanto vicinissima alla metro e anche per passeggiate in Manhattan. Camera molto bella e bel attrezzata. Staff davvero gentile e disponibile. Lo consiglio vivamente.

title: Location, service and convenience!!
text: Great location in NYC, half a block from the subway.  Excellent staff and service. Nice design with 2 good F&B options downstairs.  Couldn't experience the rooftop (winter), but i hear it is excellent.  Would definitely come back for another great weekend.

title: Wonderful hotel and experience!
text: My wife and I stayed here while visiting our daughter, a student at NYU.   Great location close to everything with many great shops and restaurants close by.   Our rooms were modern, clean and well stocked with what we needed.  Our only regret was the roof restaurant/bar was not open during the time we visited (winter).   The best part of this hotel is the staff.   From the moment we checked in, they all went above and beyond to make sure we enjoyed a great stay-  super friendly, helpful and fun.   We'll be staying here again on our next visit to NYC.   Highly recommend!

title: Fantastic Accommodations
text: If you like phenomenal customer service this is the hotel for you! From the moment the doorman Mohammed opened the door to greet us the were spot on. They were friendly and helpful to recommend places to eat, getting Ubers and room service such as extra towels and ice.

title: Barbara and Kofi Made My Stay an Excellent Experience!
text:
Two particular hotel staff made my 3-night stay at Park South Hotel a memorable one.   Barbara - you are a delight to interact with, and your customer service is beyond of that from a 5-star hotel.  You were very attentive, professional, and you accommodated my request to move to a different room that was nicer, for which I was very thankful for.  The original room was a bit outdated, and had two full beds for just one person.  The other room was on par to my liking - newer and had a one King size bed.  THANK YOU! 
Kofi - you truly gave a truly good first impression of the type of service I was to receive at the hotel.  You were welcoming, and were happy to assist in anyway that you could.  Thank you for putting a smile on my face as your smile is genuine, and infectious :)

title: Fantastic experience
text: My wife was having surgery in the city so we decided to stay due to follow-up visits. The staff was so accommodating and friendly. Room was clean and the whole hotel was beautiful. Valet parking was welcome and such a relief. Will definitely stay again.

title: Excellent location, service and amenities!
text: The staff welcomed me warmly and started my stay off great! The room was ready in a timely manner, I received complimentary drink tickets which was lovely and was able to control the temperature in the room. My room was located down some steps off of the elevator which would have been nice to know ahead of time so consider accessibiilty relatied to room assignment. Otherwise the location is perfect. I took the train straight from JFK, transferring twice. The Dominique Ansel Wokshop Bakery is about a block away as are several other restuarants if you are comfortable getting around the city without a car or train. The common spaces are decorated peccably. I would definitley stay here again!

title: Park South can’t be beat!
text:
My wife and I took the train from Baltimore for the night on Valentines Day. Park South was the perfect location from the Gramercy Theater we were going to for a concert. 

The staff went above and beyond to make our stay memorable. The room was clean and comfortable. There will be no other hotel we will stay at the next time we come up to the city. 

I never trust the reviews I read on TripAdvisor but please trust this one. We loved staying here. The only bad part about it was that we did not spend more nights here. 

Also, don’t forget to visit the rooftop bar! 

Thanks for a wonderful time

title: Awesome stay at Park South Hotel!
text: My recent stay at this hidden gem in lower Manhattan off Park Avenue beat my expectations and I would absolutely stay here again! I highly recommend this hotel to all business and non-business travelers. Even the attached restaurant was good!

title: Great experience
text: The staff was so helpful and accommodating we will come back for sure! Hotel has great location and it is really nice. Breakfast was great but mostly the attention we received from the staff at the front desk..it was superb!

title: Great hotel!
text: Great hotel and terrific, helpful, pleasant staff.  Hotel is close to everything we wanted to do, and a subway entrance only steps away.  The rooms were perfectly clean.  Can't wait to go back when the rooftop bar is open!

title: Excellent location
text: Close walking distance to many restaurants and entertainment. Hotel staff and service were amazing!!! Beds were very comfortable. I heard the hotel restaurant was great from many other guests but I didn't have a chance to try it. I definitely will be sure to visit it on my next stay.

title: One of the BEST HOTEL experiences in NYC
text: I was impressed with ALL team members that I interacted with, from the front desk to housekeeping and the restaurant everyone was exceptional. From the first time we entered the hotel and met Chuck, who was absolutely AMAZING! We then met Louis at the front desk who was equally great and even helped us get our room earlier than expected. No matter what the request we had, everyone was really helpful. Kofi also at the front was super nice and helpful. I am definitely staying at this great hotel in the future and will also recommend friends and coworkers to do so as well.

title: Chuck was the best
text:
The park south hotel exceeded our expectations from our first encounter with Louis at the front desk to Chuck Norris the service was great. Chuck went over and beyond to help us with our luggage, to assisting us with restaurants, to being our guide and giving us directions. Chuck made us feel like we were amongst family. 
The hotel was small but it’s NYC, the brownstone room was a lot bigger than the pictures showed. The staff was phenomenal overall and the rooms and public areas were always clean. I recommend staying here and ask for Chuck Norris.

title: Great property!
text: Front desk staff was extremely attentive, which is very unusual with the help we get these days. The facilities were terrific. It would have been nice to include complimentary tea along with the coffee, but I could live with that. Also, they should get the TV in the workout room working.

title: Excellent Staff
text: We were pleasantly surprised by the convenience and service at the Park South Hotel.  The location was convenient with a subway stop on the corner and taxis easily gotten on Park or Lexington.  The staff could not have been nicer - moving us to a room closer to friends.  We are native NYers and we couldn't believe how nice everyone was. Could this really be real NYers? Ye indeed.

title: Warmly recommended!
text:
We booked a short break as a belated birthday treat to see Billy Joel at Madison Square Garden. The hotel is nicely located for MSG, a comfortable walk away. Everything about the hotel was lovely - we were treated to an upgrade (from queen to king), the room was immaculately clean, well-sized, bathroom impeccable, bed comfortable, robes snuggly! Bonus treat of a bottle of fizz and chocolate biscuits for the birthday celebration. Staff were helpful and courteous at all times. They were happy to store our bags on our last day as we had a very late flight out and didn't want to tow the suitcases around Manhattan. 
We didn't use the free morning coffee or either restaurant (purely due to being spoiled for choice locally!) but the menus looked great. Lovely to have a small library area with a selection of books to browse.

title: Clean and Intimate
text: The room was small, as expected, but well designed. Plenty of space to put belongings, including a safe. Colors and decor sleek and urban. Staff accommodating and polite with the exception of the breakfast barista. Well located for access to East Side hospitals.

title: Terrific Mid-Town Hotel
text: My daughter, granddaughter and I had a wonderful time in NYC and the hotel and staff really made our trip extra special.   The hotel is conveniently located to the subway station, restaurants, shopping, etc.  The staff went out of their way to welcome us and were quick to respond to any request.  A lively bar scene added to the ambience.  Very clean, boutique hotel.  Highly recommend!

title: Great choice if visiting New York
text: This was my second stay. A friend and I go to New York for a long weekend to see Broadway shows every year and this has become our go to hotel. The rooms are nice and clean and its at a great location near so many restaurants. But the staff is what keeps us going back. They are always so friendly and considerate.

title: over and above
text:
Always a nice surprise to find a hotel that exceeds our expectations.  
Starting with the "library" through the breakfast area, the common areas were most pleasingly decorated.  The staff was very responsive and welcoming.
I have to single out your "door ambasador", Chuck Norris (?) . he is a true ambassador and you are very well represented by him.   He is a stand-out.  well done.

title: Constant and Trustworthy
text: Always a great visit and the caliber of staff are some of the best in the hospitality business. The restaurants and amenities are perfectly suited and above average for sure.  It remains a great value among others in Manhattan.

title: Best Kept Secret
text: My daughter and I enjoyed a lovely 2-nite stay at the Park South Hotel and we were pleasantly surprised by the beauty of it all! A special treat was the beautiful chandelier in our room. We loved the nooks to curl up with a book or a computer especially the fireplace in the Library. Dessert in the main restaurant was DELICIOUS! I also loved the Grab & Go Breakfast concept. The staff is Excellent. This is my new favorite hotel in New York City and I will return soon!!!

title: Nice hotel, good location, and amazing staff.
text: The hotel is not located in the middle of the "hustle and bustle" of Manhattan, but for me (a former NY'er) this was a good thing.The hotel is located on the corner of 28th and Lexington, which is still a very good and convenient location to most of Manhattan. It's on the same block as the 6 train, but you should be able to access all other train lines if you walk west 5 minutes. Herald Square (Empire State Building) is a 10 minute walk. Penn Station and Grand Central Terminal are 15 minutes away by walking. There are several indian restaurants in the area, which I loved, but my favorite restaurant was the Italian restaurant "Norma" which is Michelin rated. The hotel is small--perfect for a small group or couple or solo traveler. They have a door man who is stationed at the entrance not only to screen people coming in but to help anyone arriving at the hotel. I can't tell you how many times the door man saved us, carrying shopping bags and huge luggage--always there in a flash to welcome us in. The rest of the hotel staff was amazing as well. Alexander and Debra at the front desk were exceptional and made you feel very welcome. The hotel is small, quiet, clean and in great condition. If you are a sensitive sleeper, I would recommend asking for room away from the service elevator or housekeeping closet. I would definitely come back again on my next stay in NYC.

title: Excellent short break for our family
text: We stayed 5 nights with two children under 13 and it was perfect for us. Close enough to everything we needed, plenty of space in room for the stay, good facilities and staff very friendly and helpful.

title: New year experience
text: Competitive price with great location, close to the subway station and to several bus routes. The staff was friendly the valet service was very helpful we just needed to give a 30minutes heads up before picking the car up. They kept our bags after we checked out. Overall great experience.

title: Perfect Botique Hotel in NOMAD Neighborhood
text: Loved our first visit to Park South Hotel!  It's nicely located mid-block of 28th Street near Park Ave. in the Nomad neighborhood, near Madison Square, Union Square, the Flat Iron Building, and Gramercy Park.  The staff is friendly and helpful, including the doorman, front desk, housekeepers, and reservationist...everyone!   Best of all, the rooms are clean, quiet, nicely appointed, comfortable, and with a refrigerator, iron, and other amenities.  Rooms are small but well laid out.  They provide 24 hour parking for a fair $55/ for a 24 hour day.  This will be our new go-to hotel when we visit NYC.

title: A PERFECT BOUTIQUE HOTEL IN MANHATTAN
text: The staff is wonderful they immediately make you feel at home.  I really enjoyed the connection to Sweet Briar Restaurant and the opportunity to take a glass of wine to my room.  What a great way to unwind!.  The food was wonderful there smoked chicken superb!.

title: New Favorite NYC Hotel
text: GREAT hotel! The experience starts with A+ doorman who are welcoming and just really on their game. They make a terrific first impression and are a wealth of info when you're trying to figure out how to navigate the city.  Easy to walk to lots of things, also accessible to cabs/uber/lyft. The hotel isn't some huge impersonal mass. With 8 floors and a lot of character, it feels like a respite. Beautiful rooms and great common areas including a library with a warm fireplace and a rooftop bar. There are at least two restaurants within the building and they're both fun. Neither feels like a "hotel restaurant." Breakfast off the lobby is simple and delicious. And it's just a storefront away from The Schmear (which is legendary). We stayed at Halloween time, just now before Christmas, and we'll be back again in the new year. Bravo to the manager. We really love your place.

title: Perfect hotel Fair Price
text: Just right.  Good breakfast.  Clean room.  Very friendly staff.  Nice restaurant.  Very helpful front door men.  Convenient location.  Trip advisor reviews require 200 letters, no wonder they typically contain too much irrelevant information

title: December stay at the Park South
text: Staying in New York is always expensive, especially before the holidays. I booked in advance and thought the value was very good. We were a family of four and the room was totally spacious enough. Front desk staff were very professional and friendly. I would stay again!

title: Great bargain in Midtown
text: Fabulous, modern, intimate hotel.  Staff was friendly, attentive, knowledgeable.  Rooms were clean.  Restaurant and bar were excellent.  Cozy lounge with a great fireplace done in a library setting.  One of the best doormen ever in many years of travel to NYC.

title: great location, clean and good services
text: except for the coffee maker, it is a great hotel. it is located near many excellent restaurants and food services such as Whole Foods. It is also close to subway station and bus lines. busy but quiet street.

title: Above and Beyond Expectations
text: The staff at Park South were exceptionally courteous and helpful. The room was spotless and much nicer than we expected for the price we paid. You have to try the fries in the hotel restaurant. I’ve never had any as tasty as these.

title: Great boutique hotel!
text: Close to everything, well appointed with a very competent and responsive staff.  Loved the 'speakeasy' bar on prem, as well as the live fire restaurant with a lively bar crowd.  Rooftop is also an option, not in December, but looking forward to going back when weather is more appropriate.

title: Nice Hotel in Murry HIll / Party of Hyatt
text:
I've stayed here twice. It is a nice, clean, centrally located hotel, but also just a little of the tourist trail while still being close to everything around mid-town and above. The restaurants on site are good and it's easy to walk to Curry Hill (1 block) if you are in the mood for Indian take-out or eat-in. Plus is if you like Hyatt and want points.

My gripe is small rooms (normal for many NY hotels), no room service, and the gym is a bit larger than a walk-in closet.

title: Hidden gem in Kips Bay/Murray Hill
text: Hotel staff were courteous and professional, warm and welcoming. The lobby and rooms were very clean and well.  Don't be surprised by the size of NYC hotels, which are usually small, but the bathroom was clean and functional..  Staff was also helpful arranging transportation to the airport.

title: Very pleasant stay!
text: The location was convenient to everything, the staff were very welcoming and the room was clean and bright.  Barbara at the front desk, in particularly, went out of her way to make our stay comfortable.

title: A cute little hotel in a great location!
text: Great hotel! Very conveniently located. I stayed in the king room with a city view on the top floor and I could see the Empire State Building from my room. Very cool. Staff were lovely as well. I even got a 2pm checkout due to my explorer status. Would certainly stay again!

title: Amazing staff, convenient location
text:
Let me start by saying that the staff at this hotel is the best I have ever seen throughout my travels, and I have been to a lot of places.
Miss Krystal, Alexander, and Brian at the front desk, all the bellmen and housekeeping staff are amazing, friendly, and go above and beyond to make sure your stay is excellent.
The room I booked was the smallest one but it was sufficient for me and I had all the amenities I needed.
The location of the hotel is super convenient. It's half a block away from the subway line nr 6, and about 3 blocks from the R line, both of which I used multiple times during my stay. Safe neighborhood with great restaurants and cafes. The Empire State Building, Madison Square Park, Union Square, and the Flatiron Building are all within walking distance, as well as the Harry Potter store and Friends Experience.
I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. I will definitely be back very soon!

title: Great experience
text: Very help and friendly staff.  Hotel very conveniently located near subway but not near too many tourists. Easy to access excellent dining in a quieter area.  The price could be a little better, but the stay was excellent.

title: A touch of heaven tucked away at Park South
text: My experience from beginning to end made me feel like I was the only guest in the hotel.  They catered to my every need from the time I got out of the taxi, there was an imaginary red carpet from the door being opened to my bags being carted to a welcome back smile on the faces at the front desk. The lemon water and the aroma in the lobby just made you feel special. If you want a tucked-in bed, you got it.  You can get lost in the 3-way shower - rainforest from the top or a spa jet with the handheld or traditional, you have it.  Top it off with a warmed towel from the rack and step into the cozy housecoats.  God ahead, queens and kings, they have it all.

title: Great Stay! Will be back!
text:
The team at the hotel was amazing! My room was clean and peaceful. It felt at home and I would recommend staying there. Whether a staycation or traveling into town it would be great to stay again.
Continued success to the team there.

title: Very Nice
text: Hotel is very nice, very clean, and large by NYC standards. I wish there was more space to put my things - I ended up hanging some things in the small closet space and filling the 1 drawer with sweaters and such. Had to leave the rest of my stuff in the suitcase. Beds were very comfortable and staff was attentive.

title: Just what we needed
text: The hotel was clean and well located to walk to many attractions.  It was much quieter than anticipated.  Coffee available in the morning and lovely breakfast options to purchase.  There is also a great bagel place next door and Whole Foods is around the corner.  The staff at the front desk were very nice and accommodating.

title: nice stay
text: I enjoyed my stay.  Staff was friendly and helpful, gave me an umbrella when it was raining, and put a fridge in my room when I had leftovers from dinner.  What you would expect from a nice hotel, but still very much appreciated.

title: Good option in the area
text:
Nice hotel. Good staff. Rooms on the small side but adequate for two with a small desk and roller chair if needed. Iron and ironing board and hair dryer in room. No view from our room (or most guessing from the layout). Facilities a bit tired here and there but all functional. Nice small lounge for about ten people and some seating up front for quick snacking (did not eat at the restaurant) - but everything on the small/tight side. Wifi was fine. Hot water whenever needed. Reasonably quiet (given the two children roaming the halls)

There's nothing to really complain about and the location was very convenient. There's a great bagel shop next door (line out the door and down the street most mornings) and the 6 Subway is 100' from the hotel

title: Lovely Smaller Hotel with Great Staff
text: We chose this hotel because of its location, and it turned out to be a good decision. We were within walking distance of everything we wanted to see except the Statue of Liberty and The Metropolitan Museum. The neighborhood feels safe and is very busy with locals "doing their thing." It was fun to people watch.

title: Perfect stay in Manhattan!
text:
Wow! This hotel had it all. It didn’t baffle with “bling”, but in service and functionality! The rooms were impeccably clean, and the functionality of the room was absolutely perfect. Everything where you would need it to be. A perfect bathroom with a walk-in shower. (With retractable seat to shave legs), great mirror and sink area. The bed was heavenly comfortable with soft and yet crispy clean sheets! The first bed in New York that I didn’t feel the urge to spray Lysol in! 
The cleaning staff does an amazing job to keep the rooms pristine and I cherish that in a hotel.
Both Chuck and Brad, our concierges and doormen, read our minds regarding everything we might need. They were stellar. I can’t thank them enough for helping keep our trip stress free. They never batted an eye regarding our heavy luggage and lifting everything in and out of the car and getting it to and from our room. This alone was a feat of valor! John, our manager greeted us and took the time out of his busy day to make us feel welcome and at home. Haven’t experienced that in years!
The only downside to our stay, was that the rooftop bar was not open. We were able to sneak a peek and take pictures, so I know it must be amazing when you can sit up there for a cocktail or some snacks. We will definitely be back here next time! Thank you John and your incredible staff for making this stay, our best ever in Manhattan!
Regards from Vienna!
Ellen S.

title: Great, hidden gem in the city
text: This place had everything one would need on a trip into the city. IT felt more like a personalized, curated boutique hotel than a large parent company portfolio hotel. The staff was free helpfully and friendly, the restaurant was sexy and the roof top bar was a highlight. Standard Room was big for NYC. We will definitely be back again

title: Family visit
text: The hotel was nicer than expected. New York rooms are small but this felt less cramped than other places we’ve stayed nearby. The service was good and the staff was friendly. I would’ve like to have a mini fridge but appreciated the fresh, cold water always available in the lobby and free coffee in the restaurant.

title: Good solid Hotel in excellent location
text: This is the third time I have stayed at this hotel. For unknown reasons, I received a tiny room with a tiny bathtub this time looking against a wall. The location is excellent. You can almost walk to all the places to visit in Manhattan.  However, I did notice that time has left its scars on the interior, and therefore a refurbishment should be planned.

title: Awesome hotel
text: I had a great experience, this hotel had excellent customer service, from the moment I arrived. The room I stayed in was very clean and spacious. It is also located in a very convenient location. Food from the restaurant downstairs  was great, possibly the best burger I’ve had. I will definitely be back and highly recommend to anyone staying in New York.

title: Favorite place to stay in NYC!
text: We have been staying at Park South Hotel for years and have had a consistent experience each time. Great location, personable staff, small mid-town feel, and excellent intentional care! Highly recommend and we will be back!

title: Stay here for a business trip
text: There was construction going on the outside of the property but that didn't change my experience of the stay.  The front desk staff was helpful and apologetic even though they couldn't upgrade me to a King size bed because they had no availability.  Once of the staff member was sick and they couldn't serve breakfast as a result but was will to reimbursed my breakfast from Bagels and Schmeers

title: one inght in NYC
text: excellent place to stay, expensive but delivers expectations. good rooms, warm welcome, good service, good location, small attentions in the rooms, a bottel of wine, worth going there for a week end in NY downtown?

title: Pleasant and Enjoyable Stay at the Park South Hotel
text: I thoroughly enjoyed my experience while staying at the Park South Hotel. Every staff member I came in contact with was extremely kind and helpful, from the concierge to the cleaning staff and the bellmen. Park South Hotel has the convenience of two restaurants connected to the hotel and a very nice selection of options for breakfast. The hotel room was clean and elegant. I would definitely return to this hotel in the future.

title: The only hotel I stay at when I visit NYC.
text: Not only is the onsite restaurant Sweetbriar a 5-star spot, the hotel itself is beautiful. The rooms are quiet, well-appointed and always clean and the doorman is always quick to offer an umbrella when it's raining. These little things always make my stay at Park South so pleasant.

title: My new fave NYC hotel
text:
This hotel is wonderful. Great staff, comfortable rooms, its VERY clean and well maintained. Lovely neighborhood.
i was there a Sunday and Monday so SweetBriar wasnt open, and i didnt get to try rooftop due to weather but they looked amazing too. Im definitely staying again!

title: College Move In Visit
text: Had a wonderful experience staying at Park South Hotel while moving my daughter into college ! Great location, clean rooms and wonderful and helpful staff, especially Alex at the front desk who went above and beyond to make a hectic move in weekend run smoothly by helping us with storing extra packages and luggages needed for my daughter’s dorm move in. A hidden gem of a hotel with exceptional customer service!

title: Great staff and nice vibe
text: Very nice hotel with tons of activities and food/drink choice :).  We decided to come back to run a few business discussion after checking out.  Plenty of gathering areas, very welcoming and warm feeling.

title: Effortless
text: The hotel is absolutely lovely. The gentleman who checked me (unfortunately I cannot remember his name) , the bellman and other staff all great. Loved it. Beautiful hotel. If you go and don’t visit the rooftop you are making a mistake.

title: UNGA
text: Good location. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Loved the restaurant recommendations given at the front desk and meeting Chuck. Enjoyed the personal touch to welcome guests and the Grab and Go breakfast. Plus the fresh bagels. Complimentary drinks and breakfast too. The rooftop was also very lively.

title: NY Business Trip
text: This hotel was excellent...centrally located, clean, excellent staff and the food/beverage on-site was outstanding. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is travel for pleasure or bsuiness!

title: Excellent customer service!!! the staff is fantastic! 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟
text:
The staff is incredibly attentive! Barbara, Alex, Shajah, Brad and Chuck!  I would like to hire all of them.  The room was  gorgeous and very spacious. The location is perfect.  I was able to walk to all my meetings, lunches and dinners.  Even upper east/west side.   I cannot recommend this hotel enough.  I  am in NY 2-4+ times per year and have stayed all over town, now I will never stay anywhere else.  Bravi!!! 
thank you for a wonderful stay and I look forward to seeing you again! 
🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

title: Optimale Lage, sehr freundliches Personal
text:
Unser erster Eindruck war leider eine kleine, etwas dunkle Lobby. Lassen Sie sich davon nicht irritieren!
Das Hotel besitzt sehr saubere große helle Zimmer mit angenehmen Betten. Hoher Schlafkomfort!
Die Zimmerreinigung erfolgte dann, wenn wir es wünschten (grünes Licht). Auch haben wir von der Straße bei geschlossenem Fenster nichts gehört. 
Das Restaurant haben wir nicht getestet, aber die Dachterrasse The Roof: tolles Ambiente, gut besucht (reservieren, v.a. am Wochenende!), typische NY Speisen, Cocktails. Kinder sind erlaubt.
Die Lage ist phantastisch: etwa 20m zur U-Bahn-Linie 6, in 2 Stationen sind Sie am Grand Central, von da eine weitere zum Times Square. Nach Süden etwa 12 Minuten zur Brooklyn Bridge.
Wir haben alles, such die Fahrt vom und zum Flughafen, mit der U-Bahn (und dem Air Train) gemacht. Das ist unkompliziert und spart gutes Geld.
Wir kommen gerne wieder.

title: DO NOT STAY HERE.
text: Diego at the front desk was possibly the most demeaning, condescending person I’ve met in my 30 years of life. To the point that he made me cry. The room looks like a prison cell. Nothing like the photos at all. I really want to help prevent anyone else from making this mistake. There are so many hotels to choose from. Do not ruin your trip by picking this one.

title: Always a pleasant stay at the Park South
text: The Park South is by far my favorite hotel in New York.  I have stayed there for nearly 20 years and always have a pleasant, safe, clean and enjoyable experience.  The staff is welcoming and accommodating and the location is perfect, central and right on a subway line.

title: Nice clean boutique type hotel
text: This was not your typical Hyatt hotel. It was more of a European style boutique. There were no issues. The hotel was clean the staff was very friendly every time you walked in and out the front door.  They did give me a drink coupon but the bar was closed during my stay. Otherwise everything was OK.

title: Comodità e cortesia
text:
Ottima posizione per raggiungere qualsiasi punto nella zona East della città e molti luoghi sono raggiungibili a piedi, con una bella passeggiata, come ad esempio Chelsea Market a West e la Highline.
Nella zona molti ristoranti, il Flat Iron building e con una bella passeggiata anche l’Empire State Building. Con la metro n.6 si raggiunge velocemente Soho.
Le camere sono un po’ piccole e molti servizi con compresi ma a richiesta come il bollitore, mini frigo e ghiaccio.
Il personale è molto gentile, in particolare Shajal, Barbara, Alex, Chuck, tutti molto disponibili e gentili ma avviso che nessuno parla italiano.

title: Hyatts Park South Hotel 👍🏻
text: Beautiful hotel. Perfect location for the places we were going. Staff, especially Mohamed at the front door could not have been more helpful. Second day there one of our dirty towels in bathroom was not replaced with a new fresh towel. But the hotel immediately got us fresh ones. In the future I would just ask for lots of extra fresh towels up front to avoid this happening again. We are at one of their 3 restaurants for dinner (SWEETBRIAR NYC) and it was amazing.

title: Work trip done right
text: My boss recommended this hotel and very glad he did. My stay here was excellent and I will stay here in the future and recommend to coworkers. Everything was clean and the staff was very friendly. The roof top bar is a major bonus.

title: Stay
text:
Very helpful and friendly staff. The hotel room was very clean and comfortable.
We had a lot of luggage as we were here to drop our daughter off at college. The staff helped us with storing it. Made a stressful time easy for us.
Would highly recommend this Hotel.

title: A gem in midtown!
text: I stayed 3 days and hosted a client event. My room, the Sweetbriar restaurant, and the rooftop are all exceptional! Service is very attentive and personalized. My 2 hour client event turned into 4, our guests enjoyed the experience so much. Everything about this place is special, and the team truly cares about the guest experience. Love love love the Park South Hotel, Rooftop and staff!

title: Beautiful boutique hotel experience with excellent restaurants onsite
text: Beautiful rooms. Convenient location. Sweetbriar and GG Tokyo on the ground floor was a treat!!!! Two excellent restaurants with no need to commute. The rooftop bar also fantastic. The view was amazing and so fun & lively. Will return and do the same all over again.

title: Lots of restaurant options
text: Great staff, great location, close to the 6 subway line, the rooftop is great with fun slushy flavors for the summer. Close to midtown but not in all the chaos, we really enjoyed our stay as a couple with one teenager.

title: Silencioso y acogedor hotel
text:
La habitación era muy silenciosa, y moderna. Pasamos una estadía muy tranquila. Además la ubicación del hotel es excelente, caminando puedes llegar tanto al Edge, como el times square, sin problemas. La atención de los recepcionista y del bellman fue muy buena. Fuimos de luna de miel, y nos recibieron con 1 vino y chocolates en la habitación, muchas gracias. 

Punto a mejorar: La atención por whatsapp, ya que se demoraron en responder, y además el horario de cierre de la cocina, es muy temprano, la última noche fue a las 10:30pm.
Última recomendacion: Actualizar las tarjetas con los QR qué te dan en el check out, ya que no funcionan.

title: Sisters Trip
text:
The hotel is in a great location and walkable to SOHO, Little Italy, China Town, Union Square and more. Staff was super friendly and went above and beyond call of duty. Our room was spacious and comfortable. However, lacking a small fridge and the "city view" option is a bit deceiving because the only view is the back of old buildings.
Roof Top restaurant wasn’t that great. My sister and I ordered a glass of red wine and beer and both drinks were super warm as if they were sitting next to stovetop and appetizer was very greasy. We ended up going to a different restaurant for dinner.

title: Great staff.  Clean nice rooms!!
text:
Really nice hotel! Amazing staff. This was our first visit and we really enjoyed the stay.  The room was clean and nice. The beds were very comfortable.  

Luis, Shajal, Crystal, Chucky, and the entire staff were awesome.  They were friendly, and so helpful.  From helping with directions to holding our bags and just chatting and sharing helpful hints.  We really enjoyed our visit.

title: Great hotel and great location
text: This is a very well located hotel with great service. My wife and I have stayed here multiple times and really like pretty much everything about this hotel. It's located close to Park Ave and to most places that we enjoy.

title: Great stay in NYC!
text: This hotel was picked given its proximity to the Murray Hill area...we will stay here again as we now have a child living in the area. Great hotel, value given, of course, its New York. We loved the neighborhood and the staff were very pleasant and helpful.

title: Park Yourself Here
text: Great central location with rooftop bar and (2) dining options. Rooms are NYC-size (small) and lack a mini-fridge, but are nicely appointed otherwise. Staff was super nice and accommodating every step of the way. The 6 subway is at the corner, so that is super convenient getting around town and to and from airport(s). Would stay here again.

title: Excellent hôtel parfaitement bien situé
text: Chambre impeccable, personnel très agréable et professionnel. Situé en plein centre de Manhattan, idéal pour les visites et métro à 50 mètres. Rien à dire sur la globalité du séjour (8 nuits). Climatisation redoutable qui rend bien service en juillet/août!

title: Amazing Hotel with great restaurants and greater staff.
text: My family and I recently stayed at the Park South Hotel.  The service and staff were exceptional.  Muhammad the doorman, the front desk staff, and the maids were terrific and addressed our every need.  The food and staff at GG Tokyo and Sweetbriar were amazing!  The hostess and sushi chef at GG Tokyo were awesome.  The salad with the grilled cucumber and avocado mousse at Sweetbriar was like nothing we’ve ever had before.  Again a special thank you to Muhammad who really went above and beyond for us.

title: Great NYC hotel
text:
I stayed here for 3 days for a work trip and was greeted by Chuck the doorman. I felt so fancy never having to touch a door handle since the doors were opened for me each time I arrived and left!  He was very friendly and helpful and had my bags ready to go when I dropped them off for early check in & came back. 

The hotel room is nice and beautifully decorated. The room was cleaned each day and all hotel staff was super friendly.  The location is perfect- and super walkable. I would 100% suggest this place if you're looking for a stay in NYC.

title: Good location
text: This is a decent hotel in a great location. It is a tiny room which is fine for one, but two would be cramped. While the bed is comfortable and the room is clean, the AC is annoyingly loud. Additionally, the only settings are on or off with no temperature control. That, plus the extremely thin walls made for the 3 star review.

title: Outstanding Hotel and Staff
text:
This was my first time staying at the Park South Hotel in NYC.  I was blown away by the staff and their excellence toward customer service.  I didn't encounter any problems while staying at the hotel, but if I had, I know that they would have been handled in the best way possible.  

Extremely friendly staff - some of the best I have ever had while traveling.

title: A Special Boutique Hotel
text: One of the best smaller hotels in NYC - renovated, clean, amazing staff, special touches like wine tastings and covid packs, one of the best rooftop restaurants - beautiful retreat. For work, city visit, with family, or whatever - great place to stay.

title: Park South Rocks
text: We were in the city for a wedding and the newlyweds booked a block of rooms. Every hotel staff member went above and beyond to make sure our stay was pleasurable. The room was extremely comfortable. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Treated like a welcomed guest, not just an occupant!
text: My daughter and I were welcomed with every appearance (going/coming). The staff was warm and courteous on every turn from the cleaning staff to the front desk to the bellhop. The hotel is located in a good distance to everything that I wanted to partake in (Union Square, Madison Square, Times Square, the Empire States building, the iconic NY Library from "Day After Tomorrow", and the triangle building from "John Wick". It was also mere blocks from the college that my daughter will attend. I think I have found my home away from home. Did I mention that each room even had doorbells and there is a chic rooftop bar that overlooked the NY skyline?! Sexy after dawn!!

title: Well positioned, good hotel
text:
4 night stay in July for two adults and two teenagers. Check in was easy and Reception staff were lovely!  The room which contained 2 x Queen sized beds was small for a family of 4, but it was clean and pleasant.  The bathroom was also small.  There was a safe in the room, but no fridge (not helpful when so many NY restaurants offer takeaway boxes!!).  Locally there are plenty of good restaurants, places for brunch and supermarkets for snacks.
Roof top bar was pleasant and the staff were lovely.  Restaurant on the ground floor had a wood fired pizza oven so offered pizzas as well as a good menu.  Food was good.  Overall a lovely stay, just a couple of things that would have helped it score a 5!

title: Clean comfortable and quiet
text: Tried this hotel on a whim and was very pleased with the result. The room condition was very clean and well maintained.  We had many interactions with the staff and they were all superb! Without question , we recommend this site anyone.

title: Good hotel with a nice rooftop. Perfect for your spring/summer weekend.
text: Great position. Good standard and with a good rooftop. Roms are small but effective. Cleanliness is good. Review must be at least 200 characters Review must be at least 200 characters Review must be..

title: Great location. Great Staff
text: A friend and I just returned from our trip to NYC. Park South was conveniently located to the subways and we were able to get around quickly to everything we wanted to do. The room was very clean  and the staff was incredibly welcoming. I would highly recommend this hotel and location.

title: Friendly Staff, Clean, and Convenient location
text: Mohamed at the front was so kind and helpful the moment we stepped up to the door until the moment we drove away.  Location was convenient to subways and easy to access with ride share.  We ended up booking the Brownstone Executive Suite.  Room was clean and well designed.  There's a delicious cafe just below - Bagels & Schmear.  Don't miss it.

title: Incredible stay!
text: Had an incredible stay at this gorgeous hotel! Everything was 5 stars, from location to  beautiful building and room, and super clean! But what set it apart for me was the level of friendly and attentive service from all staff members from beginning to end of my stay, truly a wonderful overall experience!

title: Amazing Experience
text: It’s amazing that the staff remembered me after my first visit at the hotel. I’ve never been able to laugh and joke with a staff the way I do with them. I feel very comfortable in this hotel and honestly, wouldn’t stay anywhere else when I come to town.

title: Excellent Service at Every Level
text: We stayed on the 7th floor for two nights in early June. Although the room was small (but to be expected in NYC) - it very clean and modern; it had everything we needed for our stay. Every member of the staff was extremely helpful and pleasant - whether we were just getting onto the elevator, sitting in the lobby or asking for directions. Chris and Chuck, the two doormen (and everything else they did) always went out of their way to ensure we had what we needed, and then some. They made the stay fantastic.  The only reason not giving 5 stars is that the room is a little small.

title: Unbelievable Staff and Stay
text: I cannot say enough good things about the staff at this hotel. They were arguably one of the best I have experienced at any hotel. The doormen Chuck and Chris were simply amazing. Chuck was very helpful and attentive to helping us arrange a ride to the airport and made things very easy for us upon departure. The front desk staff were equal in the service they provided as well. The room was clean and nothing bad to report. The shower head was really nice and very soothing after a long day of walking. I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: small room with bare minium
text:
Stayed at this hotel two times.  The first time attending a conference in Oct of 2021. Booked a king room.  It was very noise.  After I complained, they moved me a few floors higher and it was much nicer.
The second time was a two double bed room in June of 2022.  The room is very small, less than 250ft?a tiny window and a bare wall.  I felt like living in a prison cell.  I asked to move and they gave me a queen room.  It was a little nicer, but still small with a tiny window.  The USB plug was damaged and there were not much in the bathroom.  The front desk is just a bar behind the shield, no foyer.  It was a disappointment from my experience staying at other Hyatt hotels.  I checked out after one night.  It is a cheaper hotel in the midtown but honestly if you are willing to pay a little more, there are much pleasant hotels in the same area.  I will not recommend to stay here.

title: Great Staff; Subpar Rooms
text: The staff is truly marvelous, and are the reason the stay was tolerable. The room was very, very small and dark and felt...cell-like. The hotel was clean and convenient to the work I was doing. I can't say it was terrible by any means, but it was not an overall positively memorable experience.

title: Great hotel at a great location
text: We spend a week in the Park South and were very happy with the friendlyness of the people, especially the doormen. The rooms are not big, well, it's New York. We had bad luck with a very noisy room (bar sounds) that we couldn't sleep, then some adjacent room that had like a party going on, so the room was never quiet to relax. But two subways, a nice neighborhood and a great roof top bar make the hotel a great place to be, and as the say: location location location - it's a good starting point to explore.

title: Good, but not great!
text:
Location -  GREAT - Within walking distance to the subway, Flatiron area. Lots of great food options nearby. Pharmacy around the corner. Coffee shops on every block. 

Rooms - GREAT - The Brownstone Junior Suite was cozy & comfortable, but not by any means luxurious. Bed was comfortable. Pillows not quite and I did ask for different pillows and was told that all of their pillows are the same. 

Cleanliness - AVERAGE - Some parts of the rooms obviously weren’t cleaned which makes you think what else wasn’t!

Bathroom - AVERAGE - Tiny & cheap single-use toiletries. No counter space. Bathtub was nice.

Service - GREAT - Everybody was friendly especially the doorman the day we arrived. He assisted with the luggage, offered us umbrella when it rained, complimented on my perfume lol

Gym - AVERAGE - In the basement. Tiny

Building - AVERAGE - Old. Dark. Dingy

title: Mohamed
text: Mohamed in bell services went above and beyond to help us secure our bags, and get us a car to the airport.  He was friendly and definitely a positive representation on the hotel. He enjoys his job and it shows.

title: Great service, central location, beware room is very small.
text: The hotel is in a central location for restaurants and subway. The rooftop bar was fun but got loud and crowded with locals. The shopping is not great in this area so we found ourselves wishing we would have stayed closer to 5th Ave or Chelsea. The best thing about our stay was the staff, they were very friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is a little run down and the rooms are so small. We were on a girls trip 2 of us and had to use the desk in the bedroom as a vanity with very little light (one very small window) because there is no countertop space in the bathroom. There is not enough storage or hooks throughout for a small compact room. The ac was loud and disturbed us throughout the night but fortunately we were in a room facing the back of the hotel so we didn't have much street noise. Beds were decent. I would suggest paying a little more for a larger room that is a little less run down if that is an option for you, if not this is a decent option for the price.

title: Perfect short stay
text: Only stayed for one night, but really enjoyed it. We were able to leave our luggage there and enjoy the day until our check in time. Room was small but very clean. The staff at the front desk were very nice. Easy walk to and from metro.

title: Great place to stay
text: This is a very clean and comfortable hotel in a very convenient location. The staff is very much into customer service and make the hotel very welcoming. The rooms are very clean with ample space, particularly for a mid-town hotel.

title: Fabulous hotel
text: The park south hotel was fabulous. Very clean, modern, spacious rooms. The maid service was excellent. The reception and door staff were extremely helpful. Wonderful place to stay from beginning to end.

title: Superior  Service!
text:
My husband and I stayed at this hotel to treat our daughter to a NY weekend for her 13th birthday…very family friendly hotel.   The location was perfect,  the hotel  was very clean and quiet,..it was exactly what we needed and exceeded our expectations.
Of particular note was the superb service and assistance provided by Mr. Chris Ortiz, the bellman on duty during the length of our stay.  He went above and beyond the typical duties expected and was more than available and quick to assist.  Park South Hotel is fortunate to have Chris Ortiz as part of their front line staff.
We’ll be returning!

title: Chris Ortiz
text: Chris is the man! Always providing the best service. Made our stay so much more enjoyable and provided recommendations on places to go! I would definitely come back to park south Hyatt just because of the experiences Chris made!

title: Great visit
text: My fiancé and I stayed at the Park South Hotel and had a wonderful experience. The staff was wonderful and extremely accommodating. We particularly liked Chris Ortiz as he was able to answer and questions for us and gave us great recommendations around the city. We will definitely be coming back!

title: Amazing stay at this hotel!
text: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting New York City. The staff manager was very accommodating in letting me check in early. Great location, great amenities, and amazing staff! The room was spotless and pristine! Could not have stayed in a better room than this!

title: Great location, clean and friendly
text: Would highly recommend.  Great location, clean and staff went above and beyond to give us a great experience in New York.  Greeted promptly by staff and always gave great recommendations for things to do and places to eat!  Food is really good in this area.

title: Great Stay in NYC
text: Enjoyed my stay at the Park South hotel.  Staff was friendly and room was clean and comfortable.  I was only in for 1 night but everything was great with my stay and I would recommend the Park South for anyone traveling on business or pleasure.  Wish I could have enjoyed the rooftop bar, but didn't have time.

title: We loved this hotel!
text: Park South Hotel was phenomenal! They were very accommodating when we needed to check in early. The staff was very attentive and personable, especially Louis at the front desk and Mohammed the bellhop. I also appreciated the discount given to healthcare workers through Hyatt. In the last few years, it has meant a lot to see businesses appreciate our sacrifices and hard work. I will definitely be staying at the Park South Hotel again!

title: NYC favorite
text: Great location with roof top bar, clean and friendly staff.  Chris Ortiz, Doorman was exceptional.  Willing to help with everything. Perfect for weekend trip, close to attractions but far enough from major crowds.  Great bagel place next door

title: Highly reccomended, great price
text: We stayed at park south for 4 nights and each night was great. It was clean & quiet. The room was simple and small but got the job done for my husband and I, as we planned just to be in our room for sleep. The location is a great spot, and the subway is a two minute walk away. We went up to the rooftop bar and enjoyed a cocktail and some appitizers but there are many options for food within the hotel if you're interested. All staff we interacted with were very welcoming and pleasant. We would reccommend staying at park south.

title: Good hotel, but small room
text:
My room was small which was a disappointment. Apart from that, the Japanese and American restaurants were both really nice and had a great ambiance. 
The whatsapp room service was helpful but sometimes a bit slow. 
Good location, although a bit too south for my liking! 
Overall, I’d still recommend the hotel if you enjoy being midtown and want a nice rooftop!

title: Chris was wonderful!
text: Chris Ortiz was the best bellhop anyone could ask for! He was so helpful the whole trip and called us a car for when we were leaving. I had a wonderful experience staying here, and would totally stay here again. Five stars!

title: Very good hotel in a convenient location
text: Very good hotel from the Hyatt family, conveniently located.  Modern interior, "king room with city view" was quite spacious for NYC with very comfortable bed.  Rooftop terrace is great for late night drink and some food.

title: Chris Ortiz was so welcoming and helpful!
text: I loved staying at this hotel, but Chris Ortiz really set the visit apart! His kindness and helpfulness was over and beyond. He helped get us a car, took care of our baggie while we waited and always greeted us with a smiling face!! He definitely made the hotel experience better!

title: 5 star doorman support!
text: We were blown away by the support from Chris. He kept us calm and well taken care of. He helped call a private car for transport to the airport, which meant a comfortable journey - it was lovely for a guest with us that was having travel anxiety. Chris also provided us regularly with cold water coming in from the heatwave. Thank you Chris for being so attentive!

title: Super hôtel
text:
Super close to the subway rooms spacious. Rooftop super super cool. The restaurant: a gourmet very good
We will be back for sure
The restaurant Penelope a good one to do
The bagels close the hotel a must!!

title: Great Location - Great Staff - OK Accommodations
text:
Stayed here for four nights. I would call this a typical NYC boutique hotel with small rooms and limited amenities. We upgraded our room to a larger floor plan with a view, however we just looked at the building across from the hotel with no view to speak of, so don't waste your money. You probably won't spend much time in your room anyways.

The breakfast consisted of a continental pastries, juice and fruit. A croissant was the only hot food available. Skip breakfast here. There is a busy bagel joint next door. 

At night there is a very popular rooftop bar. Kitchen closes early (10pm), so if you are hungry after a night out, stop at the New York Pizza Company on the corner. They are open to midnight. 

The best part about this place is the staff. Friendly, accommodating and anxious to help you with directions or catching a cab. Location is ideal if you like to walk. Close to subways, the Empire State Building, Chelsea Market and hundreds of restaurants.

title: My new home away from home
text: This hotel is in a perfect location, less than a block from the #6 subway, and an easy walk to beautiful Madison Square Park. The staff are warm and helpful, lovely front desk agents and bellmen. A very well-managed, clean, and high-functioning place. Thank you, thank you, thank you all. Chris Ortiz, thanks for your courteous service in getting my things to and from the car and room. I will stay here again this coming Fall. My only request is that the hotel adds a set of shelves in the closet for folded clothes and personal items, and also a spot to put my carry-on-sized roller bag away and out of sight, so I can unpack and stay awhile without looking at luggage!

title: Chris was amazing
text: Chris was amazing! Such great energy !!!!!!! Chris helped us booking a car to the airport. And welcomes us every time we left and entered the hotel. We couldn’t have had a better person helping us . Chris was the best

title: Amazing staff
text: Cannot say enough about the staff , they were all very friendly and will do their best to help you with your requests. Our room was very clean and had all the basic amenities albeit a little on the small side.

title: Loved our trip and especially Chris Ortiz the bellman
text: Had a great time at Park South. Beautiful place in a great location. Chris Ortiz, the bellman, was great. He was super helpful and so polite. Great room and great beds. Thank you to Chris and everyone at Park South

title: Bellman
text: Chris Ortiz - Most courteous and caring bellman we ever met ! If wasn't for him we would be walking soaked and wet last week ! It was raining at the time we were going out, he quickly and kindly got us 2 big umbrellas to save our site strolling !

title: Gave away my reservation.
text: My flight was cancelled so I had to take a red-eye to NY. My travel agent informed Park South the day before I arrived that I’d be checking in in the morning but they still gave my room away and cancelled the rest of my reservation. It took multiple phone calls and finally 4 hours later I had a room. Lame.

title: Perfect Home Away from Home
text: My family and I recently stayed at the Park South Hotel while visiting NYC to (finally) celebrate my 2020 graduation.  Our room was clean, spacious, and private.  It provided the perfect place to relax and recharge after enjoying the hustle and bustle of city life (and the hustle and bustle of graduation events).  The hotel's shared spaces - including the lobby, lounge, main floor bathrooms, and rooftop - were also all beautiful, and the hotel's location was very central to everything we wanted to visit (Central Park, Washington Square Park, Bryant Park, etc. were all a reasonable walk or quick ride away).  What really made the Park South Hotel stand out, however, was its excellent staff.  Everyone we met was friendly, engaged, and genuinely eager to help us have the best trip possible.  Especially awesome was Chris Ortiz, who was always there to enthusiastically welcome us back to the hotel, help us manage all our luggage (and all my commencement attire), assist us with calling rides and figuring out how best to navigate the city, and just check in and see how we were doing on any given day - even as he was juggling many other things for many other happy guests.  Chris and the rest of the staff at the Park South Hotel are excellent at what they do and truly made my family and I feel at home in New York City.  We are all excited to visit New York, the Park South Hotel, and all the great people we met there again as soon as possible!

title: Clean Rooms and Great rooftop bar.
text: Easy and quick access out the hotel.  Bell hop (chris O) very helpful and very welcoming to guests.  The rooms are small (like all NY) but thoughtfully designed. There are numerous great restaurant options in the vicinity. Bagel store next to hotel is convenient.

title: Very friendly staff
text: Excellent hotel, very clean, rooms neat and tidy and well maintained. Rooms are small, as all NYC hotel rooms are. But it was well taken care of. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The roof top bar was awesome. Didn’t eat there but what an awesome space. The breakfast in the hotel restaurant was not much. So many dining options in the neighborhood, it was hard to choose one favorite.

title: Chris Ortiz Is The Best
text: Chris Ortiz the Doorman at the Park South NYC is a tremendous asset to your company. He could easily be a concierge for any hotel establishment. He was so friendly and professional. He is very knowledgeable about the hotel and the NYC area. I really felt in good hands with Chris. He added something extra special and unexpected during our stay. Chris thanks you so much.

title: Great stay!
text: Hotel was great, clean, and location was awesome. Cost was super reasonable. Lots of great stuff within walking distance and rooftop bar was great. Special shout out to the bellmen Christopher  who was incredibly helpful and nice 🤙 !!!

title: Hospitality isn’t dead!
text:
This hotel kicks ass but not just because of the great location and stellar amenities but because of the STAFF! Everyone is super nice, friendly, just trying to make sure you’re comfortable. 

Special shout to Christopher Ortiz! Made sure our bags got where they needed and took care w our equipment. Will definitely stay here again next time I’m in New York.

title: Weekend girls trip!
text: We stayed at Park South for our girls trip and really enjoyed the hotel. We were able to check in early, the bar was great for a drink and the room was surprisingly spacious. Chris the bellman was probably one of the nicest people I’ve ever met. He made us feel very welcome! All staff members we ran into were very kind. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Wedding anniversary trip
text: Incredibly friendly and helpful staff and excellent room with great location especially with the coffee and bagel place two doors down. Would highly recommend. Looking forward to visiting the rooftop patio when it opens for the season.

title: Wonderful staff, quiet rooms, everything functioned properly
text: This hotel is excellent. It exceeded my expectations. From the second I checked in (extraordinarily early - 5.30am), I felt well taken care of. From check in to check out and everything in between, the staff at this hotel made for a relaxing and ideal experience. Everything worked as expected in my room. Housekeeping was excellent. The gentleman at breakfast seemed extremely busy but stayed positive and friendly in spite of juggling a ton of customers. Chris Ortiz in the front of house was a gem! He really made me feel welcome and like I was at a special hotel who cared about their guests. He and the other staff make this hotel one I will look forward to returning to.

title: Great place to stay, bellman Chris was the best!
text: Super clean, surprisingly spacious rooms and in a great neighborhood. Loved our stay and bellman Chris was awesome!  So friendly, helpful and made us feel taken care of! Will definitely stay here again!

title: Basic rooms excellent staff.
text: Just stayed at Park South, 2 rooms for 2 nights, and while the rooms are very small, had no views, and were basic, they have everything you need and the beds were very comfortable. The hotel has a restaurant attached and there is a bar in it, but that is what would be considered their lobby bar. The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful, particularly Chris Ortiz the Bellman. He was always available to help with luggage, transportation services, and did it with a smile and compliments. What a great way to be greeted!

title: Very safe and convenient location but amenities need updating
text: This was a great location, near subway, safe, and close to restaurants and landmarks. Room was clean but air conditioning system was antiquated, missing adjustment knob. Hotel construction was in progress so the front was not very appealing.  Street was a little noisy.

title: Excellent place to stay
text: Friendly staff, super clean, cozy library area, easy on to subway and fantastic, family owned, bagelshop next door for a quick breakfast or lunch called Bagel and Schmear. We were a group of 4 Grandmothers with our 12 yr old Grands, we were always greeted by the staff and they more than once helped make arrangements for our itinerary. We definitely would stay here again.

title: No complaints - Excellent experience
text:
I stayed at this hotel for over a week for a touristic trip first time in NYC. The hotel location was ideal, within walking distance to most landmarks and with a subway station a literal 30 second walk away. The rooms were reasonably sized, clean and there was housekeeping every day and replenishing off toiletries. The staff at the front desk were always very polite, friendly and kind. They have an online whatsapp system to contact which is very useful - I needed extra towels and they sent them up within 5 minutes of my request. 
The doormen both Chuck and Chris were lovely and very friendly and offered great advice - they even organised my transport to the airport at the end of my stay and helped me with my luggage. 
The hotel itself is very close to a great pizza place, a great bagel place and an amazing coffee cafe (787 coffee), and the locals to the area were friendly. There is also a nearby convenience store that is open late. 
I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it! 
Thank you so much to the staff who made us feel so welcome and comfortable!
