title: Good location, good price, friendly staff
text: The location with a subway stop and walking distance to theater district were perfect for us. Great service and a good price. No breakfast when we were there, room are ok but not great. For the price, we were satisfied

title: Perfect Hotel !
text: Fantastic hotel! Very nice and quiet, with comfortable beds! Location is perfect, close to subway. We highly recommend this hotel. We had great vacation and Chuck took very good care of us, always welcoming and willing to help! Looking forward to coming back soon 😁

title: Valerie
text: We had a wonderful stay.  Everyone we encountered were friendly and pleasant.  Chuck greeted us every day with a smile and there to help us with anything we needed for our stay.  We would definitely return on our next trip to NYC.

title: Disappointing
text:
Very small room & bathroom. Had to request a coffee machine and then additional pods each day. No breakfast available. Hotel covered in scaffolding. AC unit was noisy.
Otherwise clean rooms and helpful staff. Good access to subway and a great deli next door.

title: Friendly and comfortable
text: Our family of 4 stayed for a long weekend. The hotel was clean (if a bit older), with comfortable beds and a convenient location. We appreciated the friendly staff, especially Chris Ortiz, one of the doormen. His enthusiasm and helpfulness added a personal touch to our stay!

title: 5 stars!
text:
Great experience! Chris Ortiz was especially kind, professional, and so very helpful. Would recommend.
The location was perfect for all of our needs. Good restaurants and shops nearby. When we return, we will definitely be staying at the Park South Hotel again.

title: Excellent visit and warm, caring and attentive staff
text: One of the best hotel stays and by far the most attentive, caring, warm and personable team. Thanks for a great stay,  Chuck Norris, Chris Carl, and the easy and early check-in, Krystal! An A+ team and can’t wait to come me back. Very convenient and clean.

title: Overall Good Experience
text:
We recently stayed at the hotel for four nights.  The room is smaller than expected, and the location is decent.  
Staff is friendly.  Special shout out to Chris Ortiz at the front door who always greets his guests with smiles.

title: Our stay at park south hotel
text: Everything was outstanding from beginning to end. Our check in process was fast and easy, and we were greeted with a gift upon arrival to our room. We also had dinner at Sweetbriar with our daughter and her friends. Our stay, the dining experience, and communal areas are all amazing and we will be recommending this location to all of our friends.

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text: Great location and very comfortable and clean. Staff is friendly and accommodating, especially Krystal at the desk and Chris Ortiz at the door. Both went out of their way to make sure my son and I were having a good time and looked after. They were extremely professional and are an asset to the property!

title: Great hotel in good location with friendly staff
text:
Location is ideal for a mix of uptown and downtown visits and is also just a few steps from the subway. 5th Av & Broadway are a short walk away too meaning you’ll have an ideal base to start from and a painless journey back when you’ve had a long day. 
Hotel is spotlessly clean and inviting, room sizes fair for the area and staff are all friendly and helpful. 
Typical of America, you’re likely buying just a room without breakfast included but there’s an excellent bagel shop just outside, 2 cafes just a block away and a McDonalds for morning coffee next to the subway. 
The restaurant behind the lobby does some lovely food and a good choice of wine too. 
A special mention goes to Bellman Chris Ortiz who was the most helpful and pleasant guy you could ever wish to meet. A genuine pleasure to meet you Chris and the team at Park South, we’ll be back for sure.

title: Convenient to subway
text: This small hotel is very convenient to the subway's green line.  Customer service was good.  Doorman was helpful. Our room and bathroom were a little small.  Great coffee around the corner at 787.   Breakfast service was not available while we were there.

title: Great experience
text: Everything was great except we were unlucky in having scaffolding outside our window so no view at all. I came here just to say that the service was outstanding all around but if you need anything at all then Chris Ortiz is an exceptionally good bellman. He was friendly, knowledgeable, and willing to do whatever we needed to make our trip better.

title: College visit
text: This was the perfect spot for my daughter and me from which to see the city and tour colleges.  Major shout out to the staff, especially Chris Ortiz in helping us choose restaurants and transportation back to the airport.  He was wonderful!  And the desk staff Diego and crystal were so patient and welcoming with our late and delayed check-in.  Definitely will stay here again when we come back.

title: Great Experience
text: We had a fantastic experience at Park South Hotel. Great location, kind and responsive staff, and 3rd floor street-facing room was clean and quiet.  Special shout-outs to Crystal at the front desk and Chris at the door. You both took great care of us and made us feel so welcome.  This little gem is our new go-to hotel in the city.

title: Park South Hotel
text:
Excellent value for a wonderful hotel. The staff were exceptional and the hotel and bar were exactly what you’d want from a hotel. 

The location was also very convenient. It’s on the same block as a subway stop.

title: Top notch doorman!!
text: Chris Ortiz, who works the front door of the Park South Hotel in NYC, is the most friendly, sincerely genuine, helpful person on the planet. I hope that his positive contribution to the Park South Hotel experience is recognized by hotel management. Knowing that Chris is on-the-job makes me want to revisit the hotel again and again.

title: Great Stay
text:
I had a great stay at this hotel. I am from LA and took my daughter for a college tour trip during her Spring break and found the hotel to be in a perfect location for our NY colleges trips and close to the Penn Station and Grand Central Station which we used to go to the tours in New Haven for Yale and to New Jersey for Princeton. The staff was friendly and efficient from the staff greeting you at the front desk to the door man. 
I want to give a special shout out to Chris Ortiz at the door who was very helpful assisting with transportation and bags without prompting and always had a great attitude and smile. The rooms are a bit small but have all you need. This was a great value hotel for us.

title: great staff
text: Crystal at the front desk is amazing and the whole management team make sure you're taken care of.  A great location in Manhattan. Surrounded by great restaurants and easy to walk to anywhere in the city.

title: Chris Ortiz
text: Chris was awesome! So helpful and kind. Thank you Chris for all of your help! He always went out of his way to make sure we had everything we needed. He over heard us trying to figure out transportation to the airport and immediately jumped in to solve our problem.

title: Chris Ortiz
text: The doorman Christ Ortiz went out of his way to make our stay enjoyable. He was always friendly with a smile on his face, ready to help us with anything we needed. Thank you Chris Ortiz for your hospitality!

title: Great Service!
text: The service and the employees were fantastic. Specifically Chris Ortiz, was always so helpful and kind. He assisted us with ordering a ride to the airport and recommended places to eat. He also made us smile everyday! Would highly recommend!

title: Hotel Gem
text: This hotel is a sweet gem in an ideal location. The best staff do all they can for you. About 15 minutes walk from Grand Central Station. There are great restaurants all around you. The rooms are small which I consider good. The rooftop restaurant is an added plus.

title: Great value in great location
text: Park South Hotel is tucked away just off Park Ave.  It's small, quiet, clean and comfortable.  A great value for such a great location.  The staff were very friendly and accommodating.  I would definitely look to stay here again the next time I'm in town.

title: Very Nice Hotel Excellent Staff
text:
Staff was excellent, Hotel was nice and clean.  location was good, easy to access the subway.
I would definitely stay here again. The staff was so helpful, professional and friendly. This is our first trip to New York. The driver who picked us up from the airport, the concierge's the door service gentleman treated us like family!

title: Park South Hotel
text: Love this little gem of a boutique hotel. Staff is friendly and warm and we adore the restaurant Sweetbriar which is at the back. It is our go to place to stay in NYC. The location is also good. Close enough to get to mid-town easily but not in the heart of Times Square.

title: Good location, great staff, needs improvement
text: Location was terrific. The check in staff were friendly, efficient and helpful. When a problem arose, they took care of it immediately.  However, the housekeeping needs considerable improvement: there were fingerprints on the bathroom and full length mirror, strands of hair on the inside of the bathroom door, very dusty carpet (especially around the bed) and insufficient bath supplies (one small tube of bath soap for two people).  The heating/ac was noisy and moved from very hot to very cold.  The sheets did not fit the king size bed (used a queen), so they constantly shifted when sleeping.

title: Wonderful vibe. One of the best hotel experiences.
text: Just a really clean hotel with a wonderful vibe. The fireplace in the lounge was a wonderful place to debrief and relax after a full NY day. The staff was friendly and helpful. Was there a week, and I really didn't want to leave!

title: Stay at the Park South Hotel in NYC
text: Execellent staff who are very friendly and helpful.  The restaurant was very good.  I also enjoyed the exercise facilities.  The location of the Hotel is very central to many goo d restuarants and other venues in the city.  I was able to walk most places.

title: Nice Hotel
text: Clean rooms , all the expected amenities, friendly staff. It's a hidden gem right in midtown east. The rooms in the back are very quiet. Due to the location, some of the surrounding restaurants are closed on the weekends so you might have to venture a little farther to eat.

title: Nice vacation
text: Top, every time again. We have been there several times in history. We come always again there. Nice hotel and staff. Area around ist beautiful. Metro-Station is nearby. Coffee-Shop steps away. Good and central in big city.

title: Clean, great service, but small.
text: Great staff. Great location - central to everything in Manhattan - subway stop right down the street. No dining options in the hotel, but NYC gives you all the options you need.  Rooms are tiny, but has everything you need.  Good for one.  Not enough room for a couple or family.

title: Great location, fabulous staff and really nice hotel!
text: What a fabulous hotel! Great location, nice rooms (a bit small, as expected in NYC), and amazing staff that go the extra mile! Barbara at the front desk gave fabulous restaurant recommendations and the bellman was always around to help with logistics questions and a friendly greeting! The wine tasting for guests was a pleasant surprise! We had a fabulous vacation and plan to stay again! Thank you!

title: Amazing hotel, location, & staff
text: My husband and 2 kids stayed in this hotel for one night. We had 2 double beds. Despite our room being next to the elevator, we heard nothing. The temperature in the room was ready to control. The beds were very comfortable. The location was excellent. Restaurants across the street on Lexington and an entrance to the 6 subway less than a block away. Would definitely stay here again!

title: Okay experience
text: The hotel is old. I paid $90 extra to get a renovated room but it was nothing special. The bathroom was small and the carpet dingy. Nothing wowed me. There was some construction going on outside and used to be very noisy from 7 am onwards. The entrance doors were heavy and for a disabled person who has a tough time walking without a cane, it was hard to open doors and get down to the ground level when the doorman was not there. Overall, meh experience.

title: Park South Hotel - NYC
text: Very nicely equipped hotel in the heart of NYC. Plenty of amenities and a very good restaurant and soon to open sushi bar round out a good hotel. The rooms are typical size for New York hotels, very clean. Kind and attentive staff.

title: Amazing trip to NY. Loved it.
text: Every single staff member we encountered was beyond phenomenal and helpful. My main man the door man Chris Ortiz was beyond phenomenal. Always with a pleasant smile and a kind word. EVERY TIME. True breathe of fresh air. My wife and are so glad we stayed here. Already planning our next vacation and will be staying with you as well. Thank you

title: Great place to stay!
text: Great service all around. Loved the location and everyone at the front desk was very helpful. Chris Ortiz the bellhop was extremely helpful! I would definitely recommend and would definitely stay here again!

title: Great Service
text: I recently stayed at the Hyatt Park South Hotel. Check-in time is normally at 4pm, but I arrived at 12pm. I assumed I would have to store my luggage and come back for check-in at 4pm, but the front desk was able to find me a room that was available and I checked in early. The room was very clean and modern and the bed was comfortable. I was also given free drink vouchers for happy hour at the restaurant inside the hotel.

title: LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!
text:
This is a long overdue review from a 7 day trip I took to NYC in December 2021. After taking a red eye flight from California, I was just looking to get to the Park South Hotel, put my bags away, and take a rest. Chris Ortiz, the bellman greeted me at the front door, and he couldn't have been more welcoming or willing to make me feel comfortable, offering to get me anything I needed .  The hotel itself was 5 stars in every way; location, cleanliness, service.
I've never stayed at the Park South Hotel before, but I hope the next time I visit, Chris is there with his big smile, and gracious demeanor. I even missed seeing him on the days he wasn't working...what an excellent asset he is to this hotel.

title: Good Stay
text: Stayed for 1 night and it was great! The room was clean and check-in process was quick. The location is great. It's surrounded by several restaurants and cafes. They gave a credit for their restaurant but I arrived late so I didn't get to try it.

title: Extremely friendly and helpful staff
text: Great visit - can’t wait to go back again.  Staff were very friendly and helpful.  They gave great suggestions for the surrounding area.  Neighborhood felt safe.  The room was clean and everything was in working order.

title: Great secret gem in NoMad
text: This hotel is amazing. Staff is the best in NYC. I have stayed in a huge variety of hotels in NYC over the years, and this is now my “Go-To”…no reason to search any further. The room is a generous size, especially for NYC. I’ll be back!

title: A gem of a hotel!  Great option for NYC.
text:
We had a lovely stay and much of that had to do with the exceptional service we received.  From the moment I called to verify some details before check on with Krystal, followed by arrival for check in, and upon check out we felt so welcome.  I can't compliment Krystal enough.  She was a wonderful person to have working at the front desk and exceeded all of our expectations.  Everyone else we met during our stay were all great as well, but Krystal was a real stand out.  Thank you!

The rooms are small as most NYC hotel rooms are but the layout was cozy and I recommend a city view.  We are globalist and the breakfast open with Butler is great!

title: Comfortable bed but that’s where it ends.
text: Just not good enough. No water in some of our rooms, old and tired hotel with no amenities. Just inconsistent and cheap. The heating / air conditioning unit was so loud that couldn’t stay in the room let alone sleep. A nice mattress does not a hotel make unfortunately.

title: great boutique hotel near 6 train (27th St)
text: great hotel: clean, friendly staff, accommodating, early check-in availability, great location. if you’re an indian food fan the strip on lexington ave is perfect for late night snacks! value is good for area and quality of hotel. i will be staying here often as my daughter is moving into neighborhood.

title: Hits the sweet spot for Midtown accommodation
text:
I'm usually pessimistic about Midtown hotels - they're typically of poor value for pricing, the rooms are small and unkept, and staff & hospitality is usually brash and unwelcoming. 

So I'm really pleased that I've found a respite to this with Park South Hotel! It punches way above its mid-range boutique class. Received an upgrade as a Globalist to a high floor King Room with City View; while its square footage is pretty standard for a superior room, it's especially well laid out; furniture is tasteful and well maintained. Bed was comfortable and I loved the bathroom with its rainhead shower & a towel warmer.

The hotel staff was exceptionally friendly (this is a rarity in NYC hospitality, even with flagship hotels!). They took great care of me during my stay and handled requests exceptionally. Housekeeping was thorough as well.

The only weak point was breakfast - the benefit is currently outsourced to Butler - unfortunately this service has issues with its order system, and always delivered later than the quoted 45 minute time. However, this isn't an issue exclusive to this hotel and I totally understand the situation the hotel is operating in at the moment.

This was a refreshingly delightful Midtown stay. Looking forward to my next booking!

title: Stay here, not there
text: Lovely personal and nearly boutique hotel in the NOMAD (North of Madison Square). Used to live in the area and loved the neighborhood, which you don't need to leave for best restaurants. If you must, subway is half a block nearby and buses also close.

title: Solid hotel choice in NY
text: Excellent staff. Clean and comfortable place. The hotel met and exceeded my expectations.  The room was comfortable, the bedding was comfortable, the bathroom was clean and with the necessities. Definite winner.

title: Excellent customer service and quiet room
text: We couldn't be happier with the hotel staff at this hotel. And although the rooms were very close together, we could barely hear next door, which made for a restful stay. The location is in "Curry Hill" and away from the hustle and bustle of the touristy areas, and thus centrally located if you wanted to head uptown or downtown. These attributes helped make up for the tiny room and rusty sink/vanity area. Also I am particularly unhappy with the Hyatt redemption - despite 30,000 points, I had still paid $500 for 3 nights - crazy! The Sweet Briar restaurant on premise (but not run by the hotel) is convenient, but not terribly kid-friendly. Avoid the breakfast butler/room service at all costs. Our breakfast of pancakes and avocado toast arrived with no utensils, no syrup for the pancakes and 1 hour and 18 minutes after ordering. Also given there is no room for a table to eat on, that just added salt to the wound. Not sure we would stay again, if not the for exceptional hotel staff!

title: Decepción
text: Me ha parecido un hotel normal en general… las zonas comunes están bastante bien pero las habitaciones me han parecido incomodas y bastante antiguas … el baño sobre todo…. Ni siquiera pudimos guardar nuestra ropa, éramos 4 personas y nos llevamos 13 días con las maletas hechas … la limpieza cada 3 días … el agua si no la pedias no te la daban … y si te daban 4 botellitas te advertían de que no había más ese día… en ocasiones hicimos algunas preguntas sobre dudas y no se molestaban es que entendiéramos algo… simplemente soltaban su discurso en inglés a toda velocidad … al marchas nos hicieron dos cargos de casi $400… que hemos reclamado obviamente .. en fin … Decepción con el hotel… lo único bueno la ubicación …

title: Des hauts et des bas
text: Troisième séjour dans cet hôtel. Les choses ont bien changé. Plus de petit déjeuner ( ni en buffet ni en chambre).Partenaire choisi pour la livraison médiocre ( Buttler). Par contre emplacement idéal de l’hôtel pour visiter et personnel au top

title: Great People, Great Location
text: Park South Hotel is small but mighty. The location was great - CVS, McDonald's, a breakfast/lunch place and a bodega on the same block, and the subway was a stone's throw from the front door. The rooms were small but well-appointed with great storage and organization. The 'library' room was a great place to unwind and they even hosted a wine tasting while we were there. The staff was super friendly with great recommendations and tips. Would stay there again in a heartbeat.

title: Great hotel, great location, friendly staff
text:
We enjoyed our stay! As a new World of Hyatt loyalty member (Discoverist at the time), I was excited to try out my first JDV property.

We had a street-facing room on a higher floor with a city view, didn’t have any issues with noise (but we are used to urban environments). Room was clean, and we were surprised with a bottle of champagne to celebrate our anniversary! The staff was very helpful and friendly; we had a quick and easy check in, and they were able to hold our bags for a few hours when we checked out. 

We enjoyed a voucher for happy hour drinks at the restaurant, and the bagels a few doors down were fantastic (expect a line!). I enjoyed walking around the neighborhood and trying out some great restaurants nearby, and it was conveniently located for a walk to Midtown or to the subway.

I’d love to stay here again on my next trip to New York!

title: The best service with superior staff
text: I and my party of 10 had the best experience. We received amazing customer service from Carl. He answered questions, provided tips on dining and gave excellent directions for local businesses. My family and I were treated extremely well from check in to check out. We received water and complimentary cookies.

title: Vacances fin d’année
text:
Hôtel super bien situé pour tout visiter et à 2 pas du métro 
Très propre et personnel très gentil 
Seul hic on a eu froid car le chauffage est défectueux dans certaines chambres, nous avons changé 2 fois pendant la semaine. Dégât du Covid pas de petit déjeuner proposé.

title: Basics are ok, but not a luxury (or quiet) building.
text: Basic needs were met.  Some trash was left behind from prior occupant, and overall the building is very noisy internally.  I could hear thumps and noises from rooms next to and above me.  I would choose a different property next time.

title: Recommend
text: Park South is a well kept property, nice lounge area.  Didn't try the happy hour or restaurant as we had dinner reservations, but both were offered.  Very clean and friendly staff. Convenient location to subway.  I recommend the bagel shop on the block.  Will visit again.

title: Very good midtown hotel
text: We were very pleased with our stay at Park South Hotel. The location is ideal for access to the subway and there are many good restaurants etc in the local area including a superb sandwich bar next door. The staff are very helpful and recommend many good places to visit. I would use the restaurant in the hotel the next time I stay as the door looked great and there is live music some nights

title: Great Botique Hotel in the heart of Midtown Manhattan.
text:
The crew of Park South Hotel are amazing. 
The room was very clean, beds are very comfortable and great shower.
The Sweet Briar bar/restaurant downstairs has fantastic food and drinks. Their hospitality is impeccable. Geraldo will make you feel like you’re family.
The hotel is practically a walking distance to everywhere.

title: Amazing!
text: The staff was excellent! Everyone was extremely helpful all the time. Carl even pulled off a wonderful birthday surprise for my significant other! Love the quaint atmosphere! We will be back for sure!!

title: Great Location!
text: Great location!  Short distance to subway and the flatiron district.  Great service from the doorman (Chuck Norris-seriously) and the front desk.  Great restaurant and bar area.  For the price we got we would definitely stay again.

title: My daughters 21st pressie a trip to New York !
text:
This was such a memorable visit for us ! We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights and had The Best time in every way , comfort , friendliness and facilities .
Would definitely recommend this hotel and the staff were amazing , especially Krystal and Chuck ! Thank you for making our visit so special💜 xx

title: Friendly, Convenient, Clean
text: The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was more than we were expecting in size and amenities. It is located in a very convenient location being less than a block from the subway station. We cannot express how great the staff was. We will definitely stay here again.

title: Excelente Hotel
text: Muy lindas instalaciones, todo nuevo. La ubicacion genial, a cuadras del Timesquare y Rockefeller center. El personal fue extra amable, servicial, ayudaron con los regalos de navidad de los ninos, nos dejaron dejar las maletas en el hotel pasada la hora del checkout, ya que teniamos en vuelo a la noche. Una experiencia unica!!

title: Stay Here
text: Great place to stay within walking distance of all Xmas sites in NYC. Very comfortable clean hotel with large bathrooms, great bed and linen and quiet!! Contactless check in and out, alert when room is ready.  Great bar/lounge with HH daily and excellent, outgoing and helpful staff. Easy to park

title: Great experience
text: Great rooms, great customer service, great location… and for a reasonable price. Receptionist even let us check in super early and we got free drinks at the bar next door. Highly recommend this hotel!

title: Xmas trip to NYC--fabulous!
text: This was my teen daughter's first trip to NYC and we couldn't have chosen a more perfect place to stay! She literally has been talking about this trip for two years (thanks Covid!), so I wanted it to be perfect for her. The rooftop bar was closed during the winter and we didn't get to experience the restaurant due to other plans, but the whole staff was so incredibly nice and helpful. I have never seen a staff who seemed genuinely happy to be at their jobs. Chris and the other bellmen made a fantastic first impression and Melvin, Carl, Krystal (?) carried that through at the front desk. While in the lobby, we saw return guests being hugged by the staff and overheard another guest tell the staff that this had been the best hotel experience they'd ever had in NYC. We hope to make this NYC trip an annual event and, of course, will never stay anywhere else. Kudos to everyone!

title: Amazing staff !
text: The entire staff at this location was focused on ensuring customer satisfaction.  Great location if you want to visit the sites but don’t want all the chaos of Times Square.   We will absolutely stay again and recommend to others looking for the same!

title: Cozy gem of a hotel with super friendly staff
text: Recently stayed for a 3-day business trip. But I can't say enough about how friendly and inviting the staff were. Provided amazing dinner reservations, offered bottles of water when returning, called my room to remind me to link my rewards account. My room was nothing special but clean and well laid out to maximize the small footprint typical of NYC hotel rooms. One of my coworkers thought his room was a little run down but mine was fine. The attached bar is a beautiful (though pricey) spot to have a cocktail. Bartenders were friendly and made things right after a miscommunication lead to them accidentally serving a coworker a much more expensive tequila than she thought she ordered.

title: Chris Ortiz / Fiz
text: Both bellman were fantastic. Always in great spirits and very helpful throughout the duration of the trip. As soon as we got to the door we were greeted, offered refreshments, and given helpful information about our stay. We appreciated their service very much. Certainly worthy of the 5 star rating.

title: Park South Hotel
text: The staff at this hotel  are top rate. The front desk staff were very friendly and accommodating. Chris Ortiz goes way above and beyond to be helpful and has great attention to detail. Great restaurant and bar. Bar tenders were top notch. Our stay was an absolute pleasure!

title: business trip
text:
very clean, very small room with double beds.  the staff was helpful.  Would have liked to have a refrigerator in the room
parking not included and had to park across the street.  However, parking was convenient

title: Park South Hotel
text: An excellent hotel. I travel often and the staff here went above and beyond. We could not be more impressed. Particularly with Chris the bellman and Krystal at the front desk. Sue and Lisa from housekeeping were also an absolute pleasure. I look very forward to our next stay at the Park South.

title: Chris Ortiz from Park South Hotel
text: Very accommodating, bright smile, warm and welcoming, and a beautiful personality. A shout out to Chris for his exceptional care of the customers!  He is always attentive to customers' needs, whether it be a warm greetings, finding an umbrella or a coffee, assisting in transportation, or whatever requested recommendation. He gives 100% to the clients. Thank you, Chris!

title: Just  a Short Subway Ride to Anywhere
text: We were in New York City this past weekend and stayed at the Park South Hotel.  I liked everything about this property.  Perhaps the highlight of our stay was Chris Ortiz.  I have never seen a young man in this business who was so positive and helpful as Chris.  I felt that our family had our own personal assistant.  We were not the only family at this property, but he made us feel as if we were family.  I would like to give him a major "SHOUT OUT" and recommend this property when you visit NYC!

title: December trip to New York
text: We had a wonderful stay at Park South. This hotel was an excellent choice, perfect for us. The staff went out of their way to be helpful and friendly. Would stay at this hotel again without hesitation. Highly recommended.

title: Great choice if visiting New York
text: Stayed here in December and had a wonderful time. Our room came with two double beds, and a desk and it was still spacious. The bathroom was clean and comfortable. The people at the front desk were very gracious and accommodating. Our bellman Chris Ortiz was especially pleasant and helpful. This is definitely my go to place anytime I visit New York and will seek out more Hyatt hotels when I trave

title: Tiny rooms but the service and location make up for it.
text: This hotel,  the neighborhood and the friendly people in it made my trip the bomb. Situated close to midtown and time's square without the noise and crowd. The on site restaurant's food AND hand crafted cocktails were amaze balls!

title: Great Stay at Park South
text: We came to New York to visit friends, and this hotel was a great place to do it. We had a lovely stay and were very well taken care of by the staff (especially Chris!). Will stay here again for our next visit.

title: Great Hospitality!
text: Chris Ortiz, the bellman made our trip to NYC! Helped with directions and made sure we have the best experience! Thank you Chris! Great location, thank you to all for recommending Bagels & Schemer next door! Amazing!

title: Exceptional customer service!
text: Exceptional customer service especially from Chris Ortiz & Carl Smith-Hudson. Their energy is unmatched & both went above & beyond to allow my sisters & me a comfortable stay at their wonderful hotel. Chris & Carl were kind, warm, hospitable, upbeat & smiling every time we saw them. Highly recommend!!

title: Pretty good hotel, fantastic staff
text:
The hotel rooms were mostly great. The only real problem was that we could basically hear every sound that was made in the neighboring rooms.

The staff at the hotel was phenomenal. Chris Ortiz greeted us immediately as we approached the door to the hotel and was extremely helpful during our week-long stay. The entire check-in process was painless with great communication.

One of the better hotel experiences I've had in this area (near my company's office)

title: Great service, great bellhop
text:
Nice hotel. Staff is great, room is nice, good restaurant and bar on site.

From the time we pulled up Chris Ortiz was attentive and extremely pleasant. Had the bags from the car and to the lobby, knowledgeable of the area, and very nice to talk to. He made the stay extra special. He can arrange many things for you during your stay.

We would recommend this hotel and we would stay again.

title: Nice staff better than others.  Special mention to Krystal front desk, Restaurant crew and Chris Ortiz  the best bellman
text:
The rooms and staff was great, we had a blast of experience with all!

The bellman (Chris Ortiz) was incredible and very helpful. Everyday a nice gesture & attention  from  him . The food for the bar was ok, but the drinks better.
Hostess, mixologist we’re awesome.

The only minimal complain was the noise on the rooms, you literally can  hear how guests  breath

☺️

Anyway I may be back somehow

title: NYC Trip
text: This hotel was a great boutique hotel with a wonderful staff from the front desk to the housekeeping. Everything we asked for was delivered with a smile and with efficiency.  The doorman was extremely helpful.

title: A pleasant stay at the Park South Hotel
text: The Park South Hotel is a very clean and pleasant property with an attractive lobby.  The staff are extremely friendly and helpful, and the beds are very comfortable.  The location is great, in an interesting neighborhood with lots of restaurants, a subway stop half a block away, and easy access to all parts of the city.  My only complaint is that there is no coffee in the lobby.

title: Perfect location
text: This hotel is in a perfect location, lots of restaurants and shopping walking distance. Chris Ortiz was the absolute best concierge we could ask for. He went of his way to be sure we had a great experience.

title: Staff was so great
text: Front desk staff and bell staff were great.  Krystal and Chris were so pleasant and accommodating.  They helped to make my stay so pleasant.  Looking forward to my next stay, when the weather will be a bit warmer and roof deck will be open.

title: Great last minute booking while in NYC
text: My wife and I absolutely love seeking out a good boutique hotel when traveling. Located right in the heart of Midtown, this hip spot is walkable to so many notable destinations in the big apple. Service was top notch from the second we were greeted at the door to the moment we checked out and left. Big ups to Chris Ortiz for such a stellar experience. 10/10 will definitely be back again!

title: Best hotel ever
text: I cannot say enough about this hotel. This hotel is now the only hotel I stay at when I visit NYC. From the door person, to the front desk to the bartenders and beyond. This hotel is top notch service, clean, trendy, and everything you want from a nyc hotel. The new restaurant Sweetbriar is unbelievable!! And they also have a gorgeous rooftop bar and restaurant which is great in the beautiful spring summer and fall. The rooms are so nice, extremely clean, the beds are sooo comfortable! Stay here, you will never ever be disappointed!

title: GREAT STAY
text: Loved staying here. Hotel is super nice and clean. Great staff working there. Especially Chris (the bellman) did a great job in taking care of our luggage and organizing our taxi. Always friendly! Lii ok cation is great and still quiet at night.

title: Hotel
text: Chris Ortiz is amazing! He truly provides the best customer service I have ever experience and made me feel super welcomed the minute I stepped foot out of the taxi. 5 stars for Chris! Woo! Will definitely be back.

title: So Disappointed They Are Sold Out For Our Next Visit to NYC
text:
Our entire stay at Park South was fabulous.  From the minute we arrived the staff, particularly the doorman (Chris Ortiz),  were helpful and friendly.  Check in was fast and the friendly ambiance continued throughout the weekend.  The lobby is inviting for waiting and chatting with other guests and staff.  Located near some great restaurants and bars the location is ideal.  Much to my dismay the hotel is sold out for our next visit to NYC.  I will stay again as we visit our daughter in the neighborhood often.  

The hotel does not provide daily maid service. Therefore,  you have to make your own bed. This is somewhat annoying as you expect maid service when staying away from home.  Hopefully this is only a temporary policy due to covid.

The NYC taxes and fees make the hotel expensive.

title: Great hotel
text:
Incredibly friendly staff at this boutique nyc hotel. From the doormen to the front desk and maid, everyone was very nice. Especially doorman Chris Ortiz who went above and beyond with his hospitality. We’ll be back. 

Thanks

title: Wonderful Stay!
text:
My family of four stayed at Park South over Thanksgiving weekend.  It's a wonderful property--an old building beautifully renovated and maintained.  More impressive than the building, however, is the staff.  All Front Desk personnel we encountered could not have been nicer or more welcoming.  I had previously read about the amazing doorman (Chris Ortiz)--and he was in fact just as advertised.  What an impressive, humble, and nice guy--and what a fantastic representative of the hotel.

Room size is typical for New York, but very well designed and maintained--subtle elegance is a good descriptor.  The hallways are quite nice as there are windows (and outside light) which is a welcome touch.

The location is fantastic--we all love to walk, so Park South is quite convenient to the Theater District, Union Square, and even Central Park.

In sum, this is an excellent hotel--and if you are a member of World of Hyatt, it's a terrific option to earn/use points at a boutique property which looks/feels very different than your typical Hyatt.

title: Convenient, clean and comfortable!
text: Easy check-in, comfortable beds, great location to subway and walking around city.  Staff was friendly and knowledgeable about things to do in the City.  Rooms are small, but clean.  COVID protocols were maintained.

title: Awesome experience!
text: The front desk staff were very helpful and amazing. They upgraded me to another room based on my request.  They were very patient. The  hotel was very clean. I. would recommend the hotel to others based on my stay.

title: Great location and neighborhood for a visit to NYC
text: I enjoyed my stay at the Park South Hotel and the convenient location in NYC. Just a couple of blocks to the closest Starbucks and subway stop. I would not hesitate to return. I would have given a higher rating if the restaurant in the hotel was open, coffee was served to guests in the morning and a fridge was provided in the room. The comfort of the room was superior and I would stay again.

title: Charming stay in the heart of NYC
text:
Hotel is in a great location and just off the 6 Line of the subway. Makes getting around town a breeze. Also in a quiet neighborhood.

Staff is very friendly. It was great to see a familiar face from a prior trip- Chris Ortiz who happily greeted us in the lobby and helped us with all of our plans.

title: Chris Ortiz
text: Chris Michael Ortiz is the embodiment of perfect service. This man greeted us with the warmest of arms, treating us, these random strangers, as if we were long time good friends. His recommendations for local spots were spot on; all of the places we visited thanks to him were amazing. Would 100% recommend visiting the Park South just for Chris.

title: Chris was amazing
text:
Chris greeted us when we first arrived and checked with us throughout our week stay to ensure that we had everything we needed. He was pleasant and very helpful. He arranged our rides as well

Renete W.

title: Quiet little gem
text: Stayed here on business and was so impressed. The hotel was quiet (rare for NYC) and the room was larger than I expected. Location was perfect, Service was great as well. I will definitely be coming back.

title: Guest
text: Chris Ortiz is by far the best doorman in NYC. Great hotel but if it wasn’t for Chris wouldn’t have been the same experience. He truly bent over backwards to show me and my friend a really good time and experience. NY is back baby.

title: Friendly and Helpful Staff
text: The staff was very friendly and helpful when it came to food options in the area. There is no restaurant in the hotel, but several great options nearby.  The hotel was modern and clean. Very much enjoyed my stay.

title: A great place to stay!
text: I was really blown away by the staff at this hotel! They were so friendly and caring! They make you feel at home! I would recommend staying here and I will definitely be back! It’s a great location and offers valet parking which is key in NYC!

title: Hospital visit for daughter
text: Our trip was primarily to bring our daughter to NYU Langone Children's hospital.  The hotel assisted us with a room because our original hotel cancelled.  The Park South honored or original room price and the staff was extremely helpful and pleasant

title: Come for the outstanding staff!
text: Park South Hyatt fit our needs on this trip.  Rooms are very small but we only slept there.  Was happy my party of 3 all took our own rooms.  It is really perfect and the only reason for the lesser star is I would like to have breakfast and fresh coffee available.  I think it is still coming back from COVID restrictions so I’m sure it will get there.  The restaurant on site is open later in day and open late.  The staff. There was amazing.  Geraldo and staff allowed us to grab some hot tea and sit in restaurant as they cleaned up and shut down for night.  Best cup of tea!  I would come back to property and Sweetbriar restaurant.  One if our party got room service dinner and it was excellent.  I heard they were adding breakfast soon.  The restaurant was super energetic and busy.  They were just opened so it was good to see the support.  Great location if you need to be in NoMad and even for us who walk it was fine.  We walked up to the upper east and west side.  We also walked back from the lower east side.

title: Wonderful hotel and location!
text: Great hotel in a great location! Staff is so helpful and we loved the central location. The rooms are stylish and comfortable and nicely sized given what you normally get in NYC. We would stay here again.

title: Wonderful Stay
text: Great customer service,  staff was very friendly, accommodating and attentive to our needs. Room was super clean and bed was very comfortable. just an amazing weekend stay and we will absolutely be returning.

title: Beautiful Property
text: Highly recommend this hotel. Perfect location with very attentive staff. The room was beautiful and equip with everything we needed for a weekend getaway. Chris at the front door was amazing and so helpful, gave great recommendations and helped us at every turn. Definitely will be coming back.

title: Clean hotel and friendly staff!
text: Chris Ortiz is an outstanding bellman. He is helpful, friendly and truthful. He went out of his way to help me with my car which made things less complicated when I left while the NY marathon was going on.  The staff at the front desk were also very friendly. The rooms and bathrooms are very clean. Location is ideal as well. I look forward to more future stays.

title: Location, accommodations, staff!!!!
text:
This place is legit!!
Would 100% recommended.
It's small, so not overcrowded.
Walking distance (15-20 minute walk) to all mayor (times square, empire state building, central terminal) attractions.
Clean, and comfortable. The rooftop bar is beautiful as is the bistro downstairs.
Staff were amazing!!!! Super attentive and courteous. 
Shout-out to Chris at the entrance, he is the smiling person who will greet you upon arrival. Always with great neighborhood and food recommendations and willing to give you directions to the best things to do. Chris is an absolute gem, always making sure we're enjoying our stay and that every thing in to our liking!
10/10 i would come back here next time.

title: Great Visit
text: Perfect location and a rooftop bar with city views. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Chris the bellhop is the MVP for sure. From the moment we arrived he went out of his way to make our stay enjoyable. Thanks for a great stay!

title: Low stress stay in a NYC hotel
text: This hotel has very friendly staff.  They were willing to accommodate unusual requests like needing a fan different than the HVAC system.  It has a great rooftop bar with a skyline view (but it is not open in Winter). The restaurant was clearly very popular.

title: Clean, chic and comfortable
text: Great place to stay in a central location.  Room was very clean and bed very comfortable.  Rooftop bar has a great view and good cocktail selection.  Highly recommend as a weekend getaway when you don't want to have to walk too much.

title: This hotel was so disappointing in so many ways.
text:
Stayed at this hotel for business and was totally unimpressed.. The most major issue was the cleanliness. I grabbed a towel after a shower and luckily I flipped it over to catch the brown stains (ew) before touching it to my body. The hotel was quick to replace it, but disgusting. The next morning I ordered coffee and a large water bottle via room service. ( I ordered at 6:32 am, right after they open.) It took them over an hour to bring coffee and a smaller sized water bottle. 

The rooms are also ridiculously small. I paid for a larger room and could barely walk around ( I’m not a large person.) Also note, there are no fridges and no ice machines on the floors. So many great options in the city— just stay elsewhere. ( Pics are of the dirty towels that I almost touched to my face!! 😭😭 Why was this $450??)

title: Can’t wait to return, made us fall in love with NYC all over again.
text: Small boutique hotel. Booked a City View room 705. Wide open view with half of Chrysler Building. Large room, very clean, beautiful chandelier and furniture, lots of storage. Beautifully decorated, it all (including bathroom) looked new. After first night ac/heat didn’t work, engineer came said it was fixed, management gave us a bottle of wine for our patience. Found out middle of night it was not fixed. We had to change rooms which is extremely inconvenient but they offered to move us (we wanted to do it ourselves) deducted destination fee from our bill which we appreciated. Next room was slightly smaller with full view of Chrysler Building. Beautiful bathrooms, comfy beds, beautifully soft linens. Very nice woman at front desk in mornings, very nice doorman (he was tall, sorry I don’t have names). Roof, the rooftop bar on 8th floor has exquisite views, two fireplaces, delicious drinks and small bites. Very nice people there also. They have a night-time restaurant and library on first floor. Great location, half block away from #6 train, short walk to great restaurants, bagel store next door, Pret Manger half block away for take-out breakfast, etc. We loved this hotel, the staff, we will definitely stay here again.

title: OUTSTANDING!
text: The hotel was clean and comfortable. The staff in the hotel and restaurants were friendly, helpful, efficient and knowledgeable. The food at the new Sweetbriar Restaurant was amazing. Great food and drinks with beautiful skyline views at The Roof.

title: Terrible
text:
Rooms were dirty and small and had no amenities. I requested a coffee machine when I booked the hotel and none were there. Completely overpriced for the quality of the stay.
I called the front desk for coffee and a nice lady brought one, but the coffee that came with it was disgusting, I could not drink it.   There were dead bugs in the shower, finger prints all over the mirrors, the sheets were dirty.

title: Hidden Gem
text: Off the beaten path but in close proximity to everything you need to look at this hotel.  Upon our arrival and throughout our stay we were greeted with Friendly, Courteous and professional staff.  That is everyone from the doorman, front desk, cleaning and we got to speak with the GM.  The rooms are clean.  I would recommend asking for a quiet interior room.  They are opening a new restaurant and the the food we had was delicious.  Also, on a clear night the roof top bar is a nice way to start the evening or finish it.  Finally, we felt safe the entire time. Check it out and decide for yourself when you make your plans.  I would stay here again!

title: The Best Staff
text: If you ever find yourself in the need for a hotel in NYC, Park South is THE BEST option and value for your money. The rooms are great and very clean, the location is amazing and the best part for us is the staff. They are so lovely and helpful! We were amazed by how much they were able to help us out always with the brightest smile on their faces. Barbara by far is the best employee here! Never let her go, she is truly great!

title: Top Notch
text: One of the best hotel experiences I've had in NYC. Staff was incredibly friendly and quick to respond to any of my needs, the room was clean and cleaned regularly, the bed was very comfortable, and the roof top restaurant was beautiful with great atmosphere and delicious food. Would highly recommend and would stay here again without hesitation.

title: not the best
text: For an appx. $450 per night for a 2 double bed room- the room had a small window, no coffee maker, the shower was running slow on water and also slow heating, the AC didn't seem to work consistently. In short, the room was a dingy little congested room for 4 to the extent it felt claustrophobic. Although the women's bathroom in the lobby was fancier, the censors in the faucets would not work unless we had one hand close to the censor to keep the water going. The Rooftop bar was definitely a plus, and the drinks were really good. but for a stay, will never come back to this hotel. Do not recommend it at all.

title: The best. Truly.
text: There’s no place like New York and no hotel like this one. Charming, elegant, quiet, tucked away in a fabulous location and a superb staff. Truly it is a joy in this age and time to find such kindness and courtesy and genuine desire to be of service and enhance a guest’s experience. I feel so fortunate to have found this hotel and give it my highest recommendation.

title: Park South Hotel a little Gem!
text: This hotel sits in just the right location, with  easy access to public transportation and eateries. My first trip with my husband to experience NYC and what a time we had. The staff at this location was wonderful and attentive. I was pleasantly surprised at how quiet the hotel was and you have to check out the roof top bar in the evening! Oh and did I say shopping and more eating.. You guys definitely won me over I will be back....

title: Frequent stays -love the hotel -need to work on the room service
text: I have stayed at the Park South for most of hte travel to NYC for business purposes during 8/10-9/21. Enjoyed the stay so much, had a colleague stay at the hotel when they also traveled to NYC - due to the location and the overall service.

title: Anniversary stay
text: Loved this hotel. Room was clean, big, and nicely appointed. Bed was very comfortable. Service was excellent. Plenty of eateries in the vicinity and a garage directly across the street. Highly recommend.

title: Great hotel
text: We recently stayed at the Park South Hotel for a weekend while moving our daughter into her apartment in NY. It was very clean, very spacious and had nice amenities. We will definitely stay there again.

title: Convenient and comfortable
text: My room (1 queen-sized bed) was clean and comfortable with ample space. The hotel is conveniently located near a subway stop which made travel to uptown or downtown quick and easy. Landmarks within a short walking distance include the Flatiron Building, the Empire State Building, and Madison Square Park. There’s also a fantastic bagel shop only a few steps away from the hotel. I would definitely choose to stay here again.

title: NYC trip for daughter's Sweet 16 and visit with friends
text: The hotel is very comfortable and clean. Rooms are well appointed and modern. Bathrooms a little small but that is expected in NYC. Staff are very friendly and knowledgeable.  Great location in midtown!

title: Exceptional Service
text: I love Park South Hotel becasue of the PEOPLE they are very friendly and give exceptional service.  Chuck is the main reason we return.  His professional service and ability to connect with his clients is great.  He always goes above and beyond his duties to make us feel at home.

title: Family friendly
text: Helpful staff. Very comfortable and quiet. Great area. Family friendly. Beautiful upper deck. Hyatt hotel is taking care of health care workers! Thank you! We very much appreciate the break from patients during the recent delta surge.

title: Better than expected
text: This is our first trip out to NY and we had the best time. From check-in to check out the staff was amazing. We were celebrating a Birthday and Anniversary and the Front Desk dropped off Champagne and Biscuits. Upon check out the manager came out gave us and the kids chocolates. The room was very clean. Housekeeping service is every other day. We checked out the roof top restaurant for drinks and apps. The hotel is conveniently located to everything. We were central to all the places that we wanted to see. We highly recommend this hotel when visiting NY. Thank you all for a wonderful time. We'll definitely stay here when we come again. :)

title: Great staff, clean, reasonably priced
text: First time at this property. Front desk staff was friendly. Rooms typically small, but clean and comfortable. AC worked well. I wish they had an ice machine. But front desk gives you water bottles and ice if requested.

title: Spacious NYC option
text: Room was bigger than most in the area. Hotel is convenient for lower east side. Hotel is clean and well kept. As is common nowadays, housekeeping was optional. "Destination fee" of $28 was applied, which is silly.

title: Friendly staff, comfortable beds, well appointed rooms
text:
The staff at the Roof top bar made me feel very welcome as a guest which was an unexpected perk.
Rooms were very clean and well appointed. Heard very little noise from the street even though I was on third floor. Only issue is the construction on the street.

title: Unexpected Perfection!!!
text: We were unexpectedly in New York for two weeks.  We didn't know how long we were going to be staying until the day we left.  The hotel managers and staff accommodated us in every way.  They did everything possible to keep us in the same room the entire time, we only switched one time.  If you know what it's like to try to do this at a busy hotel, that was a feat in its self!  The entire staff prayed for us and our family, they were supportive, they listened and they hugged us.  Our room, the hallways, elevators, lobby and public restrooms were spotless and they followed all COVID protoco.  The restaurant on the roof, called Roof was just as perfect!  The food was delicious but more importantly the staff was kind, professional and accommodating.  They always made room for us.  We commend Park South Hotel to all of our friends, our family and to you!  We will be back!!!  A HUGE THANK YOU TO RACHEL, BARBARA, KRISTEN, YASIN, CHUCK, LUIS, MELVIN at the hotel and A HUGE THANK YOU TO TIFFANY, SALON, ALEXA AND MATTHEW at the Roof restaurant!!!

title: Business trips
text: Great location, clean rooms, friendly an attentive staff. The roof top bar is a plus.  Lots of great sights and restaurants in the area.  I stay here a lot and am never disappointed.  Recommend this hotel for sight seers and business travelers.

title: Great Spot and Awesome Staff
text: All and all I would highly recommend this place. Had my doubts first, but honestly I am beyond satisfied from my stay. The staff is extremely helpful. Had an issue in the middle of the night and within minutes someone came in to help us. Within close proximity to most areas we were intending to see without being too close to Time Square and the loudness and dirtiness of it. 10/10 and would recommend to anyone visiting the city.

title: Great hotel. Great Location
text: Great location. Great Staff. A slightly larger than average room for NYC. Will definitely stay here again. Certainly felt like a good value for the price and was quiet. I really prefer the smaller boutique hotel. Rooftop restaurant was fun, but there's better food in NYC.

title: Great NY experience
text: The people who work here are pleasant and helpful.  They seem happy and sincere which is unusual during these times of crowds and staff shortage. The property is nice and clean.  The rooms with 2 beds is larger than a single king. Perfect for 2 people sharing a room but not a bed. Location is very convenient, neighbor safe, and not noisy relative to the fact it is a city.

title: A Welcome Back
text: We have been coming to Park South since 2012 because it was the closest, most affordable location to be near our daughter who was having her first baby.  Those are not the only reasons we have continued to come back.  When the pandemic hit among all the serious concerns for everyone's health, we were concerned for our Park South family.  I emailed my concerns and hoped all would be safe. We have been waiting to visit our daughter for 17 months, like everyone.  We are so grateful that we and Park South made it through and we are back with our "friends," the comfort and service we have come to expect and enjoy at 124 East 24th Street, NY, NY,

title: Visit with the family to New York
text: We had the privilege to travel this year and we made it to USA starting with New York where we spent 5 nights. We had a personal challenge and the staff of the Park South Hotel went beyond their call of duties to ensure we are supported. I was so impressed with Barbara’s patience and persistence to ensure we were looked after. Barbara’s support was a crucial element in the family having a memorable positive experience in New York- thank you.

title: Beautiful Hotel and such a great location.
text: Folks at this Hotel were terrific.  They were so helpful in a range of areas.  Restaurant reservations, transportation, planning a great visit to NYC must include staying at the Hyatt Park South Hotel.  We had a great time and are already planning another visit.

title: 4th of July
text: Our room was quite nice, but it is the staff that was exemplary!  I chose this hotel for July 4th because of their rooftop bar accesss to the fireworks display.  They were unsure of how it was going to work because of Covid.  I called a few times to inquire and spoke with Melvin and acquired a new best friend.  Melvin was beyond solicitous, and when he realized he had some new information for me, he called me on his day off!  He told me to also seek out Rachel if he was unavailable and she too, was phenomenal.  I can't wait to go back and see them both again soon!

title: Exceptional hotel
text: This hotel was perfect! Rooms were clean and updated. Most importantly the staff were kind, empathetic and helpful. I stayed while my husband was recovering at NYU.  Staff was helpful with everything including local eats and they always asked how we were doing! Will definitely go back for a fun trip!

title: Boutique hotel with class
text: I have been going to Park South Hotel for 14+ years now. It is located near where I used to live in NYC...so it is nice to be back in the neighborhood. I highly recommend it for a personal experience with class. Crystal and Rachel are always congenial and willing to accommodate. The rooftop bar is a nice touch.

title: Lovely Hotel - No Frills
text: Great hotel for location needs.  Front desk staff cordial, young lady Barbara was the friendliest and helpful!  Did one evening at the rooftop bar and prices were insane for a drink - $17 for a drink and it wasn’t great, service was nonexistent.  We ended up ordering direct from the bar instead of waiting for a server at our table.   Room was on par, 2 doubles but we made it work for 3 of us.  Bathroom was tight but always had hot water!  No breakfast on site and restaurant was closed.  Overall clean and comfortable.

title: All-around wonderful hotel
text: Stayed here with our 13 year old grandson. The location was perfect (breakfast spot and subway on the same block, and great restaurants nearby).  Our room was lovely, clean, modern, well-designed with all the amenities we needed. Last, but not least, we loved the staff. All of them went out of their way to advise and assist in any way possible. Lovely little boutique hotel with a lively roof bar!

title: So good to be back
text: It was so good to be back in nyc at my favorite Hotel. Everything was better than I remembered. It was So good to see the friendly front desk staff again. The rooms looked great we immediately dropped our bags and went to the roof for cocktails and delicious Bites. We can’t wait to our next trip back.

title: Friendliest and Most Classy Staff
text: I cannot complain about anything at this hotel. The staff was friendly and catered to my every need in astonishing quick manner. Rooms were clean and AC was a life saver. Rooftop bar is a must when staying here at Park South.

title: Another great stay at the Park South
text:
Very clean, well appointed and reasonably priced rooms. Very good valet service for my car.
And the roof bar/restaurant is excellent! A new favorite of my daughter and her friends who live nearby in Murray Hill.

title: Great Hotel
text: Very clean and the staff was very helpful. It was my family’s first time to visit NY and they made us feel welcome.  We drove in and parked the car at the hotel. It was $60 extra per night. There is a cheaper option across the street for about half the cost but they are not affiliated with the hotel.  The hotel was close to a subway station.  We used it to get around the city.  There  is a great bar on the roof.  You can access it from inside the hotel or from 27th street.  I would definitely stay there again.

title: A gem on Park Ave. South
text: I really enjoyed my stay at the Park South Hotel. Melvin at the front desk was very accommodating and hospitable. The room was clean and comfortable and felt very luxurious. Highly recommended hotel!!

title: Always perfect!
text: I am so glad this hotel has re-opened. I have been coming here for years and am so happy that the pre-pandemic staff is still here and still wonderful. The room was clean, the lobby was lovely, and the people who work here are so welcoming.

title: Best customer service!!!
text: The manager, Melvin, is a true ambassador of the brand and his customer are the best I have encountered. The room was spotless, and the bed was very comfortable!  All staff members that we encoured from time of check in to time of check out were very accommodating and friendly with safety always in mind!

title: Nice place on 30th and 3rd East side
text: This is a clean hotel on 30th near 3rd avenue in a convenient location on east side of manhattan.  It is small and tight but otherwise a pleasant spot.  The HVAC is old and noisy. The amenities and cleanliness are excellent.

title: Service, location and amenities are perfect!
text: This hotel is located in the perfect area - right by the 28th street subway station that can take you anywhere in minutes. The hotel staff was very helpful, kind and caring. The rooms are small but clean and well taken care of. I was provided a kettle upon request. The internet was fast and reliable and I had no issue working from my room. The food options around the hotel are awesome and you can find anything you want to eat within minutes. There's a CVS and a Walgreens conveniently located so you can buy water and snacks there as well. The staff at the hotel made my stay the highlight as they checked in on me and made sure I was comfortable. 10/10

title: Impecable charm, location and service
text:
The park south hotel is my home away from home.
The ambiance, is charming, the rooms very comfortable , the staff super helpful , sweet and impecable 
The location is perfect for short o long trip in the city 
I highly recommend the Park South Hotel to anybody coming to NY as a family, solo or with friends 
Thank you Tom ,thank you hotel staff , for always making my stay a memorable one and making me feel at home 
Andrea
Jume 2021

title: Service was very good.
text: I especially was thankful for the help of Barbara and Rachel.  The hotel is conveniently located with shopping and amenities in abundance.  Rooms are unusually quiet for New York which is wonderful.  Thank you.

title: Amazing and friendly staff
text: The staff was beyond friendly. When checking in the woman even got all my directions for me. Write them down and explained what train I should take since I am unfamiliar with the subway system. Checking out staff once again was great Amin assisting in our needs for bandages.

title: Just not worth it :(
text: As someone who lived in NYC for four years, I don't see a need to stay at this hotel. First, the location isn't ideal. You really only have the 6 train nearby, and the area itself is very quiet. There's not much in terms of food/drink anywhere. The 'JDV' brand is supposed to specialize it making you feel like your a local at Park Ave, and personally I felt this to be missing. It was quite mundane. There was nothing about the hotel that stands out. Nothing memorable. I feel you can stay at a considerable amount of other hotels in the area and get a much better experience, and you'll likely pay less. Also, I stayed at other 'JDV's,' such as the one in Chinatown at 50 Bowery. They do an exceptional job there. As for Hyatt, the Herald Square Hyatt around the corner is considerably better. I would avoid this hotel. No frills.

title: Terrific stay
text: The Park South Hotel was an excellent choice. The staff are incredibly amenable and made sure every need was met. The location was perfect and I particularly enjoyed the proximity to Madison Square Park. I will 100% stay again and look forward to it

title: Great Service
text:
I stayed here May 2021. 
*The room: Clean and a nice size & the beds were comfortable. 
*The front desk employees were very professional, helpful and attentive once we arrived.
*The reason I chose this hotel was because when I called to ask questions before booking, the employee who answered the phone was very helpful and took his time giving me honest info.
*A big plus is that they allowed us to check in early. 
*Parking was easy. You can valet with the hotel or you can park across the street in the lot. 
 I would certainly stay here again and next time I hope I can try the restaurant once open.

title: Corona virus beginning
text: Loved everything about the hotel just bad timing to thoroughly enjoy. The bar and the people working it were super nice and upbeat. Loved all the sitting areas in the lobby, so comfotable. The front workers were extremely helpful and accomodating.

title: Great Hotel in Midtown with Excellent Service
text: Hotel was comfortable and clean. Staff was extremely nice and accommodating. Attached restaurant Covina had great food and drink and the bartenders provided great service. Overall my wife and I had a great experience and would definitely stay here again on future trips to NYC.

title: Pleasantly thrilled!
text: Very classy place, with character and full service. Awesome restaurants and great staff. Room was very comfortable and the bed heavenly!  I was near the elevator so that was heard a little bit. The staff truly cares about their customers.

title: Beyond Professional
text: I loved coming into Park South and having to deal with great competent people who knew what they were doing. I had a torn ACL and needed a fridge for my ice pack. Within 5 minutes I received a fridge and a bucket of ice to my room. This made me incredibly happy and of course comfortable. q

title: One Night Stay at Park South Hotel
text: We stayed for 1 night, Saturday to Sunday, and we arrived at 9:30am on Saturday. We needed to attend a wedding at the hotel restaurant at 11am. They let us check in right when we arrived and were able to shower and get ready for wedding without having to stress or use a family members room. It was so helpful and we appreciated it immensely. All of the staff were kind, pleasant and helpful. We stayed in a King bed room and it was spacious for a NYC hotel and the bed was comfortable. It was a great space and we would definitely stay here again.

title: Ausgesprochen kompetentes und freundliches Personal beim Front desk
text:
Super Hotel mit sehr gutem Preis / Leistung Verhältnis, Ausgesprochen kompetentes und freundliches Personal beim Front desk. Frühstück perfekt, gutes und kompetentes Personal, Bar ist top.
Kostenloses Getränk Bier oder wein zu Happy Hour:)

title: Safe bet
text: I have come to rely on Park South for a clean, friendly, neighborhood experience in midtown Manhattan. Restaurants and bars are a little expensive, but it is Manhattan. Food and beverages are always on point and the staff is a friendly pleasure.

title: Surprise little oasis
text:
Stayed her on Hyatt points. It is nestled in mid-town and you could almost walk right by it without even knowing. Hotel is quiet and staff helpful and knowledgable. The rooms are small in size which I guess is the norm for Manhattan. I did have one issue on one of my three trips to their restaurant/bar. I own a restaurant so wanted to let them know about the issue as I would want to know. 

They handled it great. The front desk clerk notified the manager who brought out the restaurant manager. He and I visited about the issue and issues more generally about owning/managing a restaurant. They handled it greatly and I actually learned a bit about customer service from them. Customer's issues are often our best opportunity to show great service and that is just what they did. I wanted to get in touch with the general manager but wasn't sure how to do it so I am writing here. 

They then went above and beyond to show their concern which really wasn't necessary. Nice job.

title: Nice hotel!
text:
We enjoyed our short stay at Park South Hotel! Nice library/meeting area off lobby.
Staff was very friendly. Rooms on the small side, but perfect for a NY trip! I would definitely recommend this hotel!

title: Gem in the heart of NYC
text: This is a lovely boutique property located off 28th street, near subway, GCT, and lots of great eats and more. The restaurant located in the hotel is superb, the staff are warm and friendly, and the atmosphere is very nice. Service oriented to be sure.

title: Hate "hidden fees"
text: Everything was as expected, clean, nice staff, small room and bed (queen) but comfortable. However, when hotels add hidden fees such as "destination fee" of $27 per night, it is beyond frustrating and makes comparison shopping impossible. Just tell us the real price without trying to add in extras that aren't included in the main price!

title: NYC Visit.
text:
Super hotel with wonderful staff and also a great ambience too.Be careful though with the destination fee which is $25 per day and is always in small print on the travel sites.

I would highly recommend this hotel for business or pleasure.

title: Another Success
text: People who read this will start to think we are related to the staff or have a great deal of stock in this hotel as there is little I can say about Melvin, Rachel, Barbara, Rochelle, Chrystal, Louis, Neiti, Shejal, Chris, Diego, Brad, Mario, Jason, and the incomparable Chuck, that I haven't said before.  The fact that we take the time to know these names should be an indication of how much we appreciate these young people's efforts to make our stay a wonderful one. Kudos to the management for their hiring practices and, in a period of change, recognizing the quality of their personnel and keeping them on staff.

title: Great staff and location
text: The hotel and bar staff were super friendly and helpful. The location is great. There was construction going on in front of the hotel and around the area so knowing this would have been nice along with a reduced rate. Overall, we enjoyed our stay.

title: travel bliss
text: The Park South is the place to stay for a real New York Experience. It is perfectly situated and the staff really appreciate your business. There are a number of little things they everyone working at the Hotel strives to provide which makes your stay problem free and enjoyable.

title: NYC business trip
text: Another great stay at Park South Hotel.  Desk clerk Barbara was terrific and welcoming.  Chuck the dorrman is always the best at helpiong with luggage and transportation.  Food and serive at Covina restaurant excellent again.  Can't wait to see the renovations completed

title: Great Hotel Great Location
text: This was a perfect experience in a NYC hotel. The rooms are gorgeous - Jonathon Adler designed - the bed was beyond comfortable and the staff is super friendly. I can’t wait to stay there again. The hotel was recommended by a business colleague and she was spot on!

title: Still spectacular.
text: I have been here many times, and I have never been disappointed. From the reservations staff to the front desk to housekeeping, everything was perfect yet again. We also enjoy the in-house restaurant Covina — what a gem. Love it here.

title: Business Travel
text: This property did a great job maximizing space in the expected tight New York style room. Lots of shelf space and ironing board cleverly folded up. Cozy soft bed and very quiet rooms, got great sleep. We stopped by the hotel bar as well, excellent mixologists!🍸🥃🥂No coffee/tea in room but Starbucks is 1 block away in two directions.

title: Nice for the price
text: Hotel is very clean and modern however both times I stayed my request for a refrigerator in the room for dietary restrictions was not met even though my company submitted the request in advance and received confirmation from the hotel both times that it would be in the room at check-in.

title: Small but nice room with excellent staff
text: The rooms in this hotel are small but completely usable, and the staff is extremely friendly, quick, and helpful.  I stayed there because it's within a block of the workplace I was visiting, and I was very pleased with the experience.  I'll definitely stay there again.

title: Stayed prior to going to NYU hospital.
text:
Great stay. The staff were upbeat and engaging. They really set the tone for our stay. Louis at the front desk was the best. 

The room was the quietest hotel room I have ever stayed in. Bed was very comfortable. 

Ate at the hotel restaurant and had a very good meal. Service and atmosphere were great.

title: Park South - great vibe and location!
text: I stayed here for a work trip last week. The location is great, it's quiet yet close to so many things. I was able to walk to work easily and enjoyed many meals at Covina, the hotel restaurant. I will be back!

title: EXCELLENT ALL AROUND SERVICE!
text: Front desk workers Chris and Luis, were EXTREMELY helpful with anything I needed and made sure my stay was going to be wonderful! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone in the area. So far... best service from a NYC hotel I had stayed in thus far!

title: Won’t stay anywhere else!
text: Park South is an exceptional boutique hotel that feels like home. It’s conveniently located on the 6 train stop and surrounded by many restaurants and coffee shops. The staff is friendly and attentive, the restaurant is cozy and welcoming. The rooms are trendy yet warm, after 6 years I’ve never had a bad stay!

title: Clean Hotel and Exceptional Staff
text: I stayed here over the MLK holiday weekend. The staff really won me over with friendly and responsive customer service. The room was also very clean. This is a good alternative if you are looking for a reasonable hotel outside of congestion of midtown. However it is not a full service hotel and does not offer room service if that’s important to you. There is one on-site restaurant with decent food. However if you eat vegan the options are limited. Hence no oatmeal or alternatives to the traditional egg centered breakfasts. The gramercy park area does include some great dining options near the hotel. Free wine is served from 3pm to 6pm in the lounge,

title: Exceeded my expectations
text: My husband and I usually stay at five star/diamond hotels. I must say the staff here were superior and genuine (Crystal especially was very accommodating) to any 5 star we have stayed at. Location was great!  Breakfast excellent! i would definitely return to this hotel!

title: Good aesthetic - clean & comfortable. Recommend
text: I would stay at Park South again. My room was clean, comfortable and a decent size for NYC. The common areas and Covina have a good vibe.  Neighborhood has plenty of options to grab food or a drink.  (If you want to venture out of the hotel.) 28th Street subway station is on the corner to get uptown/downtown.

title: More affordable, but noisy
text: Nice clean small hotel. Modern design. Friendly staff. Noisy neighbours (it can happen) but also noisy air conditioner/ heater and whizzing noise in the central space all day long (on 7th floor). Take your ear plugs.

title: Fine place for a weekend stay
text: Stayed here on a Sat night for personal visit to NYC.  Staff very friendly from door greeter to check-in (not sure how some reviews critiqued that aspect - everyone was great in my opinion).  The room might be tight for two, but hey that's NYC...this ain't the 'burbs!  It was perfectly comfortable and adequate for a solo traveler with clever things like hidden ironing board, directionable reading lights, etc.  All clean and organized.  Bed was great.  Gramercy area is cool, had never walked around here before, very neighborhood-y.  Many food options nearby.  Did not try the restaurant but it looked very busy when I walked through, which says something.  Very good value for the room rate and would def. stay here again.

title: Great place!
text: We love to stay here when we come to the city.  The location is great! It’s not in the touristy part of town but has easy access to public transportation.  The hotel is small but very clean and updated. The staff is excellent! Very helpful and knowledgeable for recommendations of activities or food.

title: Great Service and great room!
text: Recommend the hotel for anyone staying in the New York! Great for business people, with decent internet speed that allows for video and emails! Within walking distance to great properties that allows for easy travel among the busy scene of New York.
