title: A great Gem in a Big City
text:
The Park South Hotel is a wonderful little hotel just off of Park Ave. in Manhattan. There are so many hotels in NYC I am glad I found this one. A “brisk” walk to Union Square or Macy’s, The Park South Hotel is on a quiet street but accessible to shopping on all the sights. 

The rooms are wonderful! Comfortable, stylish, and of ample size. There are plenty of outlets, mirrors and lights!

The onsite restaurant; Covina is a cozy, chic and tasty serving breakfast, lunch, dinner and weekend brunch.

The main thing that sets this hotel apart is its people!!!
From Brian at the front door to Carl, or Rachel or Barbara at the front desk (there were a few more that were EQUALLY as great!) All the staff including Housekeeping always greeting me with a smile. They were all professional, helpful, friendly and attentive!

The Park South Hotel is a wonderful hotel in the Big City!!! I would TOTALLY recommend it!

title: Soggiorno piacevole, ottima la posizione.
text:
La struttura è molto accogliente, il personale molto gentile e disponibile per qualsiasi evenienza. La hall è molto moderna, mentre le stanze sono come ci si aspetterebbe. La nostra era piuttosto piccola, ma tutto sommato comoda. Il letto soprattutto, aveva un materasso praticamente perfetto. Unica pecca è l'assenza di un frigorifero, ma per il resto non ci si può lamentare di nulla.
Alla reception trattengono una cauzione dalla carta di credito che viene restituita al check-out, in parte utilizzata per il pagamento della tassa di soggiorno.
La struttura è vicinissima alla metro, a varie caffetterie e a due passi dalle attrazioni più importanti di NY. (pochi minuti dall'Empire e dalla 34 strada!).

title: Joie de Vivre Hotel
text: Friendly staff that let me feel being @ home. Cosy room for a single person.         Nearby the NY Medical University and easy connection with the subway to shop around and to discover the inner cycle of New York City.  A place I will certainly return in the future.

title: Great location
text:
Great location with subway station at end of block, easy walking distance to numerous attractions, shopping and restaurants. The hotel staff were extremely welcoming and friendly. Our room was clean however it was looking a little tired in comparison to the refurbished lobby and restaurant.  We did have to ask for our bedding to be changed rather than just the bed being made as our stay was for over a week and this request was actioned immediately. A coffee machine in the room would have been a good feature so you could have a drink before going downstairs for breakfast. 

Do not use the car service set up by the hotel as the cost was much higher than the hotel quoted.  We used this service twice as we were assured the first occasion was down to 'miscommunication' however the same driver charged more yet again on our journey to the airport to leave for the U.K.  Unfortunately this ended our fantastic trip on a sour note!

title: Good location
text:
Pros: good location ( easy to get around as next to a subway station and walkable to mid town attractions), lots of good restaurants in area (next to Curry Hill and Koreatown), and comfortable bed
Cons: no coffee in room (I dislike having to get dressed for my first cup of joe!) and overwhelming scent in the lobby. I don’t have a particularly strong sense of smell and wear perfume, but the smell was so strong as to be nauseating and caused coughing for about 10 minutes when I had to wait in the lobby. This is something Hyatt seems to be doing, which is something I don’t like about the chain; would avoid this place if you have scent allergies

title: Excellent hotel in Manhattan
text: The staff was very friendly and treated us in the best way.  The hotel has an excellent location near all the points of tourist interest in Manhanttan as well as being a very elegant site.  It has very good restaurants and there are a variety of restaurants of different types of food nearby.

title: Great quiet room
text: So pleased to get a room with two double beds—hard to find in NYC. Room and hall were very quiet. The staff was welcoming, smiley, friendly and overall just really really nice. The only negative was not having a way to make that morning cup of coffee.

title: Excellent urban boutique hotel
text: It was delightful to stay at the Park South. We got it in a package through Expedia, so a lucky pick. It was immaculately clean, great atmosphere, excellent internet and especially the very nice staff.

title: Friendly little hotel in between lower and midtown Manhattan.
text: Very friendly staff, well-appointed and reasonably priced. We got the reservation packaged with a flight. I would return in a heartbeat. Convenience location for getting around New York City, yet quiet and cozy.

title: Fantástico
text: Cada detalle estaba cuidado. El ambiente, la amabilidad de todo el personal, la ubicación...no puedo poner una pega. El desyuno era variado y rico. La habitación muy limpia y las zonas comunes cuidadas y agradables

title: Christmas visit
text: We had a wonderful stay at the Park South as always. The hotel is great and in an awesome location. The staff is second to none!!! They are extremely accommodating, very professional, and sincerely friendly. We would not stay anywhere else.

title: Nice but small rooms
text: Overall very nice hotel. We were a family of four and rooms are very small so was a squeeze.  Staff very friendly. Very clean and well designed. Only complaint is they pipe into the lobby a strong cologne smell that I found overwhelming.

title: Fantastic hotel in a great location
text: We found the hotel to be a fantastic base for a long weekend in New York. The location is very convenient with plenty of interesting restaurants around and it is relatively close to Subway and train stations (28th St Station very close by, Penn Station a decent walk away). There are interesting sights in the neighbourhood, including the wonderful "Curry Hill" area and flower and plant traders. The hotel is well appointed with very friendly staff. We enjoyed a very wholesome breakfast each morning in Covinda restaurant.

title: Lovely hotel, quaint and centrally located to all attractions
text:
This is a lovely set out hotel central to most attractions and close to lots of bars and restaurants. Shame there was building work next door going on next door, which did start early. 
Would recommend as lovely boutique hotel, staff very attentive, slight issue with maid service not replenishing drinks or setting bed down neatly, but overall lovely experience.

title: Something Different (In a Very Good Way!)
text:
When visiting NYC for pleasure, we typically stay anywhere from Times Square up to Central Park. Staying at the Park South got us into an area of the city that we don't usually see. We used the location to access SOHO, Chinatown and Little Italy via a comfortable walk. The Tenement Museum is a must see. We also used it to access the theater district to see 2 shows. It proved to be quick by car from there (39th St to 8th Ave. to 44th St.) and a comfortable walk (as long as you weren't wearing heels). 
The hotel itself was very clean, modern and cozy. The room was not big, but was certainly comfortable. Access in front of the hotel was one of the best I've ever experienced in NYC, probably because it is in a little quieter part of town. We pulled right up to the front door and when we left our car came quickly from the valet. I do want to note that the 2 bartenders were cocktail crafters of the highest order. I can say that I would go there for a drink (or food) even if I wasn't staying there, and I rarely say that about hotel food and beverage operations. 
Speaking with the doorman/bellman as he was loading our luggage into the car at departure, he indicated that many of their guests are repeat customers. We will be, too!

title: Great stay while in town for business!
text: I'm in NYC every month or so for work and have stayed at tons of hotels but have never found my place. Stayed here on a whim the week before Christmas because of its proximity to my office and was very impressed! The hotel is small and personable. Staff is very friendly. My room, while not huge, was very comfortable and quiet. The shower is awesome! Also love the Jonathan Adler bath products. Will definitely stay here again. There is also a great restaurant attached called Covina which was packed while I was there. Great food. The one thing missing for me was access to a smart tv to watch Netflix/Hulu but I just ended up using my laptop which was fine.

title: A quiet night in NYC?
text: Sounds impossible but not at Park South. Far enough away from the police sirens but still close enough to capture the essence of the city. Small boutique type hotel, clean, great service and QUIET. Also great restaurants and bars.

title: Park South Hotel - As Good As Advertised
text: We stayed at the Park South Hotel for two nights, Friday and Saturday.  The hotel is as advertised.  Very clean and great contemporary interior design.  The room was bigger than expected for a New York hotel.  Again, very clean and nicely designed.  The staff was exceptionally friendly and accommodating.  The location is great.  We arrived later than expected so we opted to dine at Covina on Friday night.  We were able to get a table.  It has a cool atmosphere and standard American hotel fare.  Definitely a convenient option.  Overall, I had a great experience at this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

title: ParkSouth Hotel
text: Great location, clean rooms although a bit small, infused water available in the lobby, friendly front desk, nice and helpful staff promptly sent up extra towels and always opening the door when you enter or exit. It would be nice if they would have coffee available in the lobby in the morning.

title: Suprising find!
text: As a Hyatt member, I had not heard of this hotel. I was so impressed with it! It definitely has small rooms, and is a bit pricey- but as a New Yorker, these things do not suprise me. The quality fo the experience was amazing. The rooms, though small, were lovely. It felt like a solid hotel, unlke some other boutique hotels that feel cheap, and thin walls. The restaurant, Covina, is incredible!!!! I went wtth my children 12 and 14 and it was great for us. However, it would depend on family and how much time you spend out of the room if the size would work. Double beds- not queens and not a lot of closet/drawer space. I also love that area of New York.

title: Not for families or guests with special needs
text: This hotel was not the right product for my family.  My son has special needs. I was told when making the reservations that they could accommodate his needs but when I got there it was an entirely different story.  Because of his needs, we travel heavy and the rooms were smaller than expected (even by NYC standards).

title: Great Hotel!
text: Great property and the hotel team Great property in a great location! The hotel team made me feel so welcome and catered to my every need. My first time staying at this hotel and the location was perfect for me! Thank you I will be back!

title: Great stay, boutique feel
text: My room was spotless, bed is comfortable. Small-ish, but totally expected for NYC. Non-tourist area of the city, great eateries all around. No coffee or tea in room. but I asked and the front desk sent up a Keurig and supplies within 10 minutes.

title: Our favorite hotel in Manhattan
text: Our family has stayed at the Park South many times over the past decade. Each time, we have been struck by the excellence of the facilities (now including Covina - the truffle fries are to die for!) and the genuine friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. We wouldn't stay anywhere else in the city. The fact that the subway is right on the corner is also very convenient.

title: Recent stay at Park South Hotel.
text: Over the years I’ve stayed at Park South several times. The hotel is always clean, the staff friendly and helpful and the food in the restaurant good. What else could you ask for? In fact, my daughter in-law and granddaughter are coming to NYC soon and I’ll pay for them to stay here.

title: Recommend.
text: Sound insulation could be better and shower could have a bit more pressure. Staff is extremely friendly every single interaction and go the extra mile to support and help in whatever need you may have.

title: Great stay
text: Great accommodations and friendly staff. Clean, well decorated, and well stocked. Tea pot, etc. available upon request and right away. Convenient location to good restaurants in area. Walking distance to most thoroughfares.

title: Great stay!
text: My family and I stayed at the Park South Hotel for thanksgiving. The accommodations were excellent. Room was clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. Would stay again. Food at Covina was excellent especially the pizza and truffle fries.

title: A real gem and welcome member to the Hyatt family
text:
Stayed for nine nights- actually changed my reservation to extend my stay here instead of going to another hyatt property.

the hotel is really a hidden gem- what makes it stand out are the people there. the primary reason we stayed for so long was the GM, Justin, who really made the stay out of this world.

completely approachable, always willing to help, always really concerned about whether we had the best stay possible. if hyatt has a management program for GMs for their hotels, they really need to get Justin to speak and lecture in that program. everything that a hyatt GM should be (or any GM for that matter) was present in all of our interactions with Justin.

If you are staying at the PSH -- I would highly encourage you to speak to him whenever you can-- and you will see what i mean.

a really great stay- no faults-- looking forward to my next stay there.

title: Spacious and beautiful
text: We stayed here Friday-Sunday with no issues. Booking was easy, check in was easy, everyone was so pleasant and wished us good days, the rooms, hallways, bathrooms, common spaces were impeccably clean, doorman was always helpful and friendly. we were overall very happy and would stay here again. Quick walk to everything we needed, restaurant downstairs had a great breakfast.

title: Well located, well priced and great service
text: We stayed here recently for  nights  We were primarily in town for basketball at MSG so it was well located for that.  And it was off the main activity zones in mid town so it was more quiet.  We were able to get around easily throughout NYC with quick access to the 6 Train.  The restaurant is great for breakfast and the one dinner we had.  They also gave us recommendations for other restaurants in the area.  All in all a great prices for a very good hotel  Would come back.

title: Average hotel, Great Staff
text:
Recently returned from a 3 night stay at Park South. Upon arrival we were greeted by a very friendly employee who checked us in without incident.

We stayed in room 209 and noticed it was small, but cozy, just enough space for smaller luggage, with a cabinet/armoire to hang clothes and a few drawers. I was immediately "offput" by the floor. Strangely it was uneven and appeared the carpet was applied over an unlevel subfloor. I'm not sure if this was isolated to room 209, but odd for a JDV/Hyatt hotel. 

There was no coffee maker in the room, but enough cabinet/shelf space to accommodate one. This would have been nice, as we also did not notice complimentary coffee/tea in the lobby area. (I know that I will get a reply from hotel management informing a coffee maker might be available upon request, but....If there is space for a coffee maker in the room, then it should be in the room and not requested). It's kind of the standard now.

There was no compact fridge/cooler in the room, but doubtful the size of the room could accommodate one.(hotel management, yes, you can reply that one might be available upon request....this I understand).

The bathroom shower head water flow was very low. It was the adjustable type from shower/massage etc., which after adjustments, still did not improve the water flow. Not sure if the was isolated to our room (209).

The "seasonal" roof top bar was closed, perhaps due to the cold. Although we did visit another outdoor venue in the area which utilized "podium" and overhead heaters to accommodate patrons. I've yet to visit Park South's roof top bar, so I am unsure if they have these types of accommodations.

We did not visit the Hotel's restaurants (Covina and o ya). The prices were higher than some of the other NYC restaurants we have dined in and further....the hotel's restaurants were rated considerably lower on Tripadvisor. 

In summary, the Park South Hotel is average compared to other NYC hotels we have visited....but the staff really shined. On several occasions we interacted with almost all of them....they were always helpful, friendly and courteous.

title: נהדר
text:
מיקום מעולה, שרות נהדר.
קיבלנו את החדר מוקדם. הצוות בקבלה עם תודעת שרות גבוהה.
לקחנו חדר ללא ארוחת בוקר, מסביב מקומות נחמדים לארוחת בוקר קלה. מסביב מסעדות הודיות נחמדות.
ביקשו וקיבלנו  קומקום עם כוסות לשתיה חמה
בהחלט נחזור שוב.

title: My home away from home in NYC
text: I ALWAYS stay at Park South. The staff is extremely accommodating and kind. They make every stay as comfortable as possible and go out of their way to make it a great experience. I recommend thiis hotel to all my friends and coworkers.

title: Very nice stay
text: Great little hotel.  My room was super quiet.  The location was perfect for me.  The staff were all wonderful.  I would love to have seen the rooftop bar but it apparently closes for the season at the end of October, so maybe next time.  I would definitely stay again.

title: Excellent experience
text:
Good location
Excellent atmosphere at the bar and restorant
Quite expensive but the value for money is good.....I suggest
Good location close to the metro and 5th avenue
I'll visit agan to test the expereience on the top bar

title: Lovely little hotel
text: Such a sweet little gem in NoMad. I stayed here on a short trip to NY. Got a very pretty little room, quiet and on 7th floor. The decorative scheme is simple and uplifting. Reminds me of nicer hotel rooms in Paris. Covina is an excellent restaurant. Tucked away in the back of the hotel, it features a bustling bar at night. I had avocado toast for breakfast, absolutely perfect. Capuccino awesome too. Just the way I prefer. Luis at front desk is amazing, other staff very courteous.  The hotel cheerfully brought me a fridge late at night upon request. Great addition to the Hyatt chain for NYC travelers. I will probably be back to the restaurant for lunch tomorrow!

title: Love this place
text: I’ve stayed at this hotel four times and will continue to do so.  The combination of location, price, service and cleanliness is exactly what I need when I’m in New York.  The rooms are on the small side as well as the bathrooms, but up to date and super clean.  Very nice staff.  See you soon!

title: Nice
text: Park South is a great boutique hotel, with four fantastic food/dining options.  Staff go above and beyond, rooms are super comfortable, and the lobby SMELLS amazing. For the right price (under $200/night in this case), it’s an outstanding value in this neighborhood.

title: Lovely hotel. Problems with Hyatt as a chain.
text:
Beautiful hotel and rooms with super friendly front desk and bellman staff.  I stayed in a single queen bed room with a "courtyard view".  My view was buildings so I'm not sure where the courtyard was but I didn't care.  The room was Great for one person but a little tight if you are thinking you could squeeze in two.  The room was immaculate.  You could not hear any street noise and rarely could you hear other guests.  A good night sleep!    On the negative side, there was no refrigerator or coffee machine and my bathroom shampoos were never replenished during the stay.  

I knocked the rating down a star for a couple of reasons.  First was price.  I secured a pricer much lower than the Hyatt website offered at the time of booking.  Hyatt has a lower price guarantee where they are supposed to drop their price by an additional 20%.  The Hyatt customer service personnel did not honor that saying you must book on their website before they would consider reducing the price.  Additionally, I learned that even if I had booked directly through Hyatt, they would not have honored the lower rate guarantee because I used my AAA website which they consider a "paid membership".  So don't be fooled by Hyatt's guarantee and get stuck at a higher rate thinking they will help you out.  

My reservation also was supposed to be "paid in full" to include breakfast and loyalty points, which they did not honor when I arrived.  This could be a AAA problem in how they transferred the data to Hyatt, but buying breakfast in NYC adds $30 a day to the cost of the room.  Finally on price, at checkout, I was surprised with an additional "destination fee" and associated taxes per day.  My room rate was $297 per night, but by the time all was done, the rate was over $400 per night.  Booking and rate issues would have me think twice about staying here again.

title: Great hotel
text: Great location with subway station at end of block,easy walking distance to numerous attractions, shopping and restaurants. We checked out their restaurant Covina, great food,drinks and service. Happy hour was a nice touch.Cozy, lovely space as was their fireplaced library.Our room was comfortable and very clean. Staff were very pleasant and doorman always welcomed us back. Parking lot immediately across street, an added bonus!

title: great hotel
text: Great hotel in a central location. Staff were very helpful but also not in your face so had a very relaxed stay. good size rooms and very clean. staff made the hotel experience very pleasant. i have already recommended it to friends. will stay next time in NYC

title: Park South Hotel Review
text: Fantastic hotel with service that went above and beyond. Great location near subway. Parking garage the next block over. Room was amazing- clean, modern, spacious (for NYC). Love the rooftop bar. Will stay here again!

title: Work trip
text: Had a room with a queen size bed and compared to Hyatt hotels in GA, this NY room was very small. They allowed a late checkout of 1 PM which was nice. Restaurant food was pricey and selection of food is limited. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful with directions around NY city.

title: Nice rooms and location,  and great services
text: I had very nice 4  nights at the Park South Hotel.  I liked the central location, the room and the on-site restaurant,  and the rooftop bar with a great view of Manhattan.   I especially appreciate the room service people and the front front desk team, specifically Rachel, Chrystal, and Luis, who made a great effort to make my stay even more enjoyable by assisting me with finding the right room for my needs and other small additions to the room.  Thank you to all of the hotel employees, including those whose names I did not mention here, who really made me feel at home at their hotel.

title: Teenage daughters birthday trip!
text: This hotel was excellent! Perfect boutique hotel! It was in an excellent location, room was beautiful and immaculately clean! Beds were super comfy! Staff left a handwritten happy birthday card and cookies for my daughters! I would recommend to everyone!

title: Great weekend
text: Wonderful location, welcoming, friendly staff, clean rooms. Love the rooftop bar and happy hour.  Couple of complaints...we booked a city view. Our room was on the 2nd floor. It was very noisy at night; there was a line of taxi's parked directly across the street from the hotel. The drivers stood outside talking loudly to each other, still going on at 2:00 AM. Both mornings, at 6:30 AM, we were awakened to a man yelling outside the lobby entrance.  Had the sense he's a regular that time of the  day. Didn't want to wake up that early and certainly not to that. The hotel can't control this so I would suggest booking a room on a higher floor. Also, wouldn't use the car service set up by the hotel. Requested a taxi and they set up a ride with the car service they recommended. Cost was much higher than what the hotel quoted. Will use a taxi next time.

title: Always a pleasure at this hotel
text: Clean, comfy, cozy feeling. Great location with everything right there, CVS, McDonalds, tons of restaurants and subway entrance. The Rooftop bar is the best, views are amazing, a must whenever I stay at Park South.

title: Unique Experience
text: I travel regularly on business so I am not easily impressed by hotels.  I loved the unique decor of the hotel lobby, which is definitely not run of the mill.  My room was excellent and the hotel staff were friendly and helpful.  I had a great experience, both during my business trip and during my weekend stay.

title: Pretty good.
text: The hotel is quaint - the bedroom and bathroom could use a deep cleaning for sure. My duvet was dirty with clean sheets on either side (which was kind of gross). The Bellmen were Fantastic! They helped point us in the right direction, stored our bags safely, arranged airport transportation and were so friendly!

title: A room without a view - except for massive construction
text:
I would stay elsewhere when in NYC.  This property is lacking hospitality - from the staff, to the rooms, to the lack of a view.  If you visit the website for this property they will lead you to believe every room has a city view of the chrysler building.  Believe me this is false advertisement, I was able to look into 4 rooms before settling in one.  Also, there is currently massive construction going on next door.  I am telling you because the staff will say you can barely hear it.  Baloney. They will never warn a guest about the construction before the stay and then you are stuck. I was shown a room with 3 construction workers on the balcony, no joke.  The woman showing the room could only laugh.  It probably is funny if it isn't your vacation and you get to go and sleep somewhere else. I prepaid for this hotel and there was ZERO chance of getting my money back, so I stayed.  I suffered thru the rudeness of the staff, the snarky comments and the lack if information given to us regarding the building and the surrounding area.
One pro to this property is the roof top bar.  I do not think it is hotel staff,  they were actually nice to us. I would go back there but stay elsewhere next time.

title: Quality hotel in the heart of Manhattan
text: Small, friendly hotel right in the middle of lower Manhattan.  Checkin was a breeze, front desk was extremely friendly, room was adequate, restaurant was very good and accommodating and check out was easy.  Valet was available

title: Enjoyed our stay! Incredible customer service!
text:
We arrived from a red eye flight, early in the morning and asked them to let us know as soon as a room became available, expecting that we'd probably have to wait until at least noon or check in time at 3pm. Barbara was an absolute legend though, we were waiting in the lobby just relaxing and she was working really hard to get us a room as quick as possible and found us a room after about an hour which we are so thankful for! She also gave us a really nice room, obviously can't expect this for every occasion but she was so helpful and came over to update us on the progress of the room often and we could not be more grateful as we were questioning our choice to take a night flight, but with Barbara's help we were able to get in a lovely nap, then enjoy our afternoon in the city. Thank you again!

As for the hotel itself, we enjoyed the restaurant and rooftop bar, we felt that our room was very high quality, as it was recently renovated and very clean. 
The hotel is right next to the 28th St. Subway station which was super convenient. 

Also want to say thank you to the super friendly doormen who opened the doors for us every single time and were so nice. The hotel restaurant staff was also extremely friendly. Sunday night, some folks had left a bit of a mess with drinks and such in the library, but a young man from the restaurant quickly helped bus the tables and get us drinks and such. 

Anyway, we've been to New York four times and I can happily say this is the best hospitality and overall stay that we've had. 

Yes the hotel is a bit pricey but it's NYC and this is a very nice hotel so it's understandable. 

Shout out to Barbara and all the staff! 

Thank you for a great trip!

title: Good for the price
text:
I travel to NY frequently for business.  The Park South has become one of my go-to hotels.  It is convenient to the subway, in a neighborhood with a lot of good restaurants, and is clean and comfortable. 

Note that the rooms are extremely small.  But this is something you have to expect in NY unless you are paying a lot more for your room than you'll pay at the Park South.  The front desk staff is friendly and efficient.  There is a doorman to help with your luggage (you have to go down a few stairs to get to the check-in desk and the elevators.  

In my stays the room and bathroom have been clean and housekeeping has been good.  The bed is comfortable and the complimentary toiletries are nice.  The towels could be more luxurious, but they are fine.  

I will continue to stay at the Park South whenever rooms are available at the permissible rates for my business.

title: Central location, nice rooms.
text: Stayed at the Park South Hotel with friends the week of Labor Day.  I have other preferred hotels in this part of lower midtown, but wanted to try something new on this visit.  Park South does have double-bedded rooms, which is not always the case in boutique hotels in NYC, so that was a prime reason for staying here.  The rooms are lovely and of decent size for NYC.  The bathrooms are serviceable but nothing special.  The decor is simple, modern and refreshing.  The views are mainly of other building facades, not a true city view as described, but that is very standard in this part of the city.  This is not the place to stay if you are wanting sweeping views of iconic buildings.  But the location is hard to beat, with a subway stop (4/5/6 line) and a pharmacy at the corner and many tourist-friendly things within walking distance.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating throughout the stay.  We received free drink tokens for the bar when we arrived and the bar staff was friendly and attentive.  There is a rooftop bar, I believe, but we never made it up to that one.  The only thing I did not like was the pushiness of the valet staff regarding transport to the airport.  They will try to coerce you to use their car service (or whoever they contract with) when it is far cheaper to take a cab (particularly to La Guardia).  Don't fall for it!  I had to push back quite a bit as he would not let up on trying to get us to use the service.  This is not unique to this hotel, though, and you will find that many bell staff in midtown hotels do the same thing.  Otherwise, the stay was good and the staff was generally attentive and pleasant.

title: Small rooms, fantastic staff
text: Small and simple rooms with no real view (my views on both stays were of a dorm like building next door).  Very clean hotel, especially for being older. Absolutely fantastic and friendly staff-front desk and doormen really made me feel welcome each visit.

title: Great Hotel in Manhattan
text: The hotel is very well situated. Close to a subway station. The rooms are very nicely decorated and very clean. The staff was very friendly and gentle.They even organised the transfert to the airport. The breakfast was just great. I sure would love to stay there again soon!

title: Great Hotel
text:
We really love this hotel.
All of the staff is very friendly.  They did a great job on the very recent remodel. I would highly recommend this to anyone.

we stayed in a handicap accessible room with a roll-in shower. It worked out very well and accommodating me in my wheelchair.

title: A Hidden gem
text: Third night (and final) for my Brand Explorer challenge in NYC: stay at Park South Hotel, New York, New York. I’m blown away by this little gem boutique property by Joie de Vivre. With 132 rooms, this is a classy and beautiful hotel in a quieter area but still close to everything (28 and Lexington). The hotel was renovated three years ago and looks fresh. Service is top notch. GOH status acknowledged, Suite upgrade granted and breakfast included at Covina with limited options menu. The room was perfect - see pictures. Rooftop area very cozy. 20k for this stay was a steal. My go to hotel in NYC from now on!

title: Amazing Hotel!!!!!
text:
We’ve just got back from this amazing hotel!! We stayed there from the 30th of September to the 4th October. 
We had a room with two double beds, with loads of space and a lovely shower room. The staff are so lovely and friendly and this includes the staff in the Covina restaurant and The Roof bar, both of which were also amazing with great food and lovely atmosphere. It made our stay in New York even more special.

title: Good location and quiet
text: Stayed for two nights.  Convenient for 28th street subway, friendly staff, quiet room non-view room.  Rooms are small but work well.  Lower midtown location makes it easy to explore.  Great Indian food round the corner.  Recommend.

title: Amazing!
text: Room was spacious and beautiful. Location was perfect - within a minute walk to the 28th Ave substation and lots of food options and stores nearby. Food on property is great - Rooftop is beautiful. Will definitely come back!

title: I love Park South Hotel
text: The staff is absolutely amazing - everyone is so friendly, welcoming and helpful. The sympatic guy at the door always has a smile and a nice greeting on his lips when you leaving / returning. The room (316) with 2 queen beds is great... and the beds are incredible cozy. We slept like babies. The food at Covina is so good... as well as the restaurant staff. If you can afford it, you should definitely book this hotel!

title: Well-situated & cozy stay in NYC!
text: I enjoyed my stay at Park South very much. The service was excellent, from pick-up at the airport to help with all of the logistics of travel on a long weekend. The hotel was perfectly located for my needs: within ten minutes walking to my sibling's apartment, one block from the subway (the 6), which I took multiple times into the Bowery and Soho during a glorious, sunny weekend. I also partook in the Indian restaurants on Lexington Avenue and ate well-- some incredibly tasty dosas! The money I saved by staying in this location went towards meals and shopping (of course, it's New York!), and I honestly loved every minute of the trip. The room colors were not to my taste-- dark shades with splashes of white-- but that was fine. As an avid traveler, I've learned that location, safety and service are really the keys to a wonderful stay. And the design of the lobby-- sunken, low couches built into the walls, a few steps down into the space, etc, made me feel as if I was in an apartment building vs. a hotel. I will (gladly) return!

title: Great Place To Stay
text: Attentive, friendly, welcoming staff. Chuck and the front desk team are the best. Clean, quiet, comfortable room with great bed mattress. Great east side location. Terrific Happy Hour in the bar area. Wonderful breakfast in their Covina restaurant, including the best bacon I have ever had.

title: Very disappointed
text: Well below expectations for the price and that this is a Hyatt: a) small room; b) no fridge; c) no coffee maker.  Also mattress very uncomfortable.  For the price and the name Hyatt, the hotel does not meet expectations.

title: Love this hotel
text: The staff knowing your name and welcoming you to their warm and comforting hotel is worth every penny! Chuck and the check in team are always engaging and service oriented.  The restaruarnt is also quite charming with great food and hip interior.

title: Another Amazing Weekend at the Park South!
text: My Friends,  We have been coming to the Park South Hotel for i would say over 10 years now.  It is by far our favorite hotel in the city and we would stay at no other.  Once again our stay was  fantastic.  Thanks to all of you and especially Samoya for taking such great care of me everytime i call.  See you guys in May as my Check ups were moved from 6 months to 8 months.

title: NY business trip
text: I really live staying at Park South. It had been my go to for business travel for the past year. Atmosphere and service is excellent. I especially love the roof top bar. I will be back again for sure.

title: Our favorite hotel in Manhattan.
text: Whenever any of our friends asks for a recommendation for a hotel in Manhattan, Park South is always our response.  Great location, cool vibe, excellent service, great restaurants attached to the hotel.

title: Great Boutique Hotel
text: Older hotel that well maintained to keep that type of feel but still be clean/ updated. Roof top bar is a nice place for a fall evening to wind down. Only negative is that the bar is open later into the evening and if your room is on the upper floors, near that side, you'll hear the music every night. Not a huge deal, but definitely a bit annoying a few nights after a long day at work.

title: Excellence Achieved at the Park South!
text: I stayed for a two-night business trip.  Once inside the hotel, I felt transported from the streets of NYC into the clouds.  From the staff to the amenities to the ambiance, true excellence across the board.

title: Right in the Heart of Real New York While Still Close Enough to the Tourist Traps
text:
Park South Hotel is a little gem in many ways.  While it's located in a great central location to the local neighborhoods restaurants and attractions, it's also central enough of a location to commute to midtown or downtown should you need to get there.  Considering the affordable (and I say that in terms of other New York City hotels), this is a solid choice for either a work or holiday stay.

As a lifelong New Yorker, I really enjoy this part of the city that has lots of options in terms of restaurants and bars, is very close to Madison Square park and surround shops but also has more of a local neighborhood feel just a street or two east.  It should be noted that this hotel's location on a side street is both a pro and a con - a pro because it's very quiet despite being in the heart of a busy area but also a con because the block can feel a bit isolated/seedy depending upon who is loitering a few doors down and/or what kind of construction is going on. That said, I know the area well so I never felt unsafe or uncomfortable.

Because the hotel is small and unassuming, it almost feels as if you are entering a doorman apartment building rather than a hotel. The front door/desk staff are friendly in that same familiar way rather than the type of welcome you would expect at a more upscale property.  

The room itself is adequate.  A reasonably comfortable bed with white unfussy linens. About average in size, it was more than enough space for one person.  The towels were on the small and scratchy side but nothing too terrible.  I appreciated the good selection of television channels available. The décor choices were pleasing if even a little on the traditional side. Mostly importantly, the room was very clean.

In terms of things that could be improved:
-The air conditioner was quite loud and (I realized this as I was packing up so it wasn't a huge deal for my one night stay but might have been if I had been there for longer) leaked onto the carpet during my stay.  I did not notice any smell of mold or mildew but if someone had a more sensitive allergy to mold, this could be an issue.
-Partially because of the above note but also partially just my personal preference, this room would be much cleaner/nicer with hardwood floors instead of carpet.
-Larger and a few more towels would be appreciated.  I was just one person staying alone and used all of the towels provided.
-There is no door on the bathroom AND the mirror on the closet reflected the toilet so even if you weren't standing by the door, the view of the "throne" is plain for all to see.  Fine for me staying alone but would be awkward to stay with anyone else.
- Would be nice to have a way to stream or cast Netflix in the room.

Overall a good option for someone looking for a moderately priced hotel in NYC.

title: Great place, convenient location and friendly staff
text: I booked a stay in this hotel when I was working long hours and had to stay in the city. The staff was very friendly and accommodating even at 3 AM. The rooms are clean and well equipped.  It is conveniently located off Park Avenue with various eateries and attractions. It is also next to the 28th Street Subway station which makes commuting to places in the city easy.

title: Awesome all around
text:
4 stars for location, friendly service, clean rooms and facility, and value. 
Located in the Gramercy area, this place is one mile away from Times Square and 5 miles away from the Wall Street area. Away from the busy Times Square but nestled between tons of restaurants and bars. Lots of pizza options from low to high end. 
The room was New York style with very smart use of space with all kinds of nooks and crannys. There’s a restaurant on site and a rooftop bar. The beds were comfy and the room was generally clean. The best part was the front desk was super helpful in getting us an early check in and late check out. 
I will most definitely stay here again!

title: Highly recommended
text: Great boutique hotel in New York. Spacious rooms at a great place and fantastic staff. Concierge was extremely helpful offering recommendations for restaurants and local spots. I only wish they had room service!

title: Spouse vacation
text: We were in a prime area close everything we wanted to see. The hotel staff was kind and accommodating. The room was clean, quiet and up kept well. We had a wonderful experience and will be staying at this hotel on our next trip to NYC!

title: Neighborly Staty
text: Great location and neighborhood.  Close to subway and many restaurants.  Small hotel with friendly and helpful staff.  Rooms are clean and comfortable.  Major construction beside hotel.  Good value with two sitting areas--one in lobby and one library area with fireplace.  Variety of dining options within the hotel--Oh Ya, Covina, Covina Cafe and Rooftop Bar.

title: Vacanza indimenticabile
text: Posizione strategica per visitare tutta Manhattan,  personale gentile e accogliente. Colazione deliziosa anche se, come tutto il cibo buono a New York, un po’ cara. Lo consiglio a tutti, soprattutto alle famiglie, si trova a pochissimi metri dalla metropolitana.

title: Great little hotel!
text:
Stayed here for three nights. Small, comfy and nice hotel. Staff was very professional and helpful rooms was OK size and very well appointed.
The breakfast was very nice and the good atmosphere.
Highly recommended!!

title: The Worst Customer Service
text:
I went to NY for the US Open and reserved a room with two double beds and when I arrived I received a room with one bed. After arriving in my room I called down to the front desk and was immediately then transferred to  customer service. I was told they could move me to New Jersey if I wanted a double bed. There were no other hotels available so unfortunately I was not able to change hotels.
There were two employees who worked for the hotel who had wonderful customer service. They were both doorman.

title: Great little boutique hotel
text: This hotel was everything we wished for. Boutique style, perfect roo, comfortable bed, awesome location, tasty a la carte breakfast and excellent staff! I stayed in a lot of hotels in New York, but experience was so great. I will definitely come back. Great value for money :-)

title: Hotel cosy excellent pour visiter Manhattan et NYC
text: Cet hôtel très cosy offre d'excellentes conditions, propre et calm, très bien situé pour visiter Manhattan, à 10 minutes à pied de Empire State Building. Nous y sommes restés 10 jours avec nos enfants pré-adolescents et nous avons pu visiter tout Manhattan pratiquement à pied et profiter à fond de la vie à NYC. Le personnel est très agréable et s'implique pour apporter les meilleurs solutions aux clients, surtout Luis qui nous a même aidés à choisir les meilleurs solutions pour nous rendre à Boston. Il y a un restaurant aussi et la possibilité de prendre un petit déjeuner copieux, mais tout autour il y a des boulangeries et de bons petits restaurants.

title: Park South
text: Great location and access to two subway lines within a couple of blocks. Good breakfast included. Rooftop bar is a nice place to end your evening. Staff friendly and efficient. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Great stay!
text: Would highly recommend this Hotel to both the business and leisure traveller. Great location, great spacious rooms for Manhattan and friendly staff. The bar and restaurant were also excellent. No problem on a late check out.

title: I wanted to love this hotel
text:
I just returned from a 6 night stay at the Park South. It was a great location near one daughter’s apartment and the subway to the other daughter’s. Check in was smooth and I was given an interior room as requested. The room was small but efficient and nicely updated. It was behind the elevator which was not much of an issue as long as the a/c was running. What was an issue was having to get my room rekeyed every single night I was there. The desk staff couldn’t have been nicer but offered a different excuse every time for why my key did not work. When I was getting my key fixed on my last evening I mentioned that I’d be checking out at 5am. The bellman on duty suggested that he should call me a cab because one might be hard to come by at that hour on a weekend. When I got downstairs the next morning there was a very nice suburban waiting for me and I’m informed that it would be $65 plus tip for the 20 minute ride to LGA. Why on earth there was such a large car for 1 passenger is beyond me. Ultimately the driver charged me $50 and I did tip because it was not his fault that I felt like I’d been scammed. 
I explained when I checked in that I visit NYC frequently as my daughters and grandchildren live there. I was hoping to get the kind of service that would make me want to return to Park South but unfortunately that was not the case.

title: BEST STAFF EVER
text: For my husband and myself the quality of the staff, personal care, efficiency and knowledge of the area are the most important part of what makes a stay enjoyable.  The fact that so many of ParkSouth’s people have been with us since we started coming 7 years ago is a testimony to their efforts and the intelligence of their management.

title: Great atmosphere, nice rooftop location
text: It’s not obvious from the ground that it exists but it’s certainly a nice venue to enjoy rooftop drinks and food in Manhattan. The margaritas were made very well and the wagyu burger was really tasty! It wasn’t busy when we visited on a weekday evening but I imagine on a weekend the atmosphere would be great. Thanks!

title: Hôtel restaurant assez bien situé au coeur de  Middle Town près du Flatiron building, plein centre de Manhattan.
text:
Séjour agréable avec 3 nuits passées dans cet hôtel restaurant au centre de Manhattan. Staff sympa et accueillant: Thank you à Viz, Mat et José du restaurant, à krystal, Luis, Carl au Front Desk, à Chirs, Chuck et Bellman lthe doorkeepers.
Ils ont été disponibles et patients notamment le staff.
bref, on recommande

title: Great hotel in good location
text: We got there early but we were able to check in to our rooms. Rooms were clean and updated. Rooftop bar was busy but has a nice view. Location is great. Close to transit. Everyone was very pleasant and helpful. Would stay here again and would recommend to anyone else

title: Not as nice as I expected
text: I was very much looking forward to my stay at the Park South. However, I found the room to be a bit dismal and narrow, and the courtyard view was that of an airshaft. The restaurant was lovely, but the service was poor. For these reasons, I doubt I'd stay there again.

title: Would highly recommend
text: This was my second stay with ParkSouth and was just as enjoyable this time as the first.  The location is great and within walking distance of things we wanted to do.  The staff really sets this property apart.  Every single person you come into contact with is friendly and helpful.  Huge Kudos to their management team for finding and retaining excellent employees.

title: Agréable petit hôtel au coeur de Manhattan
text:
Vacances "été" pour 9 jours réservées en janvier 2019 : 
Cet hôtel d'un aspect extérieur joli est situé à proximité du Flatiron Building, les stations de métro sont situées dans cette 28ème street. L'intérieur est parfait. 
Le personnel travaillant à l'accueil est chaleureux et tentent de répondre aux questions posées (un bon anglais ou Google traduction s'avèrent très utiles). 
La chambre n° 219 est spacieuse et apparement récemment rénovée. La salle de bain ne manque de rien et est équipée d'une douche à l'italienne, ce qui nous convient parfaitement. 
Les points négatifs liés à  cette chambre : la climatisation est bruyante. Cette chambre est situé au premier étage juste au dessus de l'accès des fourneurs et autres, donc le réveil est  à 05.30 hr du matin, le bruit des déchargements ou  chargements est désagréable, on y entend le téléphone et j'en passe, ayant réservé cette chambre en janvier, nous nous attendions à  beaucoup mieux. 
Le petit déjeuner est compris dans le séjour : la qualité est présente mais le problème est l'incompréhension sur le contenu de ce repas. Il nous sera expliqué que nous avons droit qu'à un plat et une seule boisson (un jus ou un bon café) ainsi que de l'eau plate à volonté et du café hyper léger (pas très bon). La chambre équipée d'une machine à café compensait ce manque lol.
Néanmoins, cet établissement est agréable et point positif pour l'ensemble du personnel.

title: My expirience
text: The hotel was fantastic. The only thing that could be better is the size of the room, it was too littel for 3 persons. But the rest was perfect, and the breakfas was faboulous. For sure I would recomend it to my friends and family.

title: Great hotel, great food & service
text: Great hotel in a central manhattan location. Great food and drinks (rooftopbar), great breakfast entrees (in stead of breakfast). Great service by nice hotel staff. Only minus are the NY sized rooms (ie small) and quite small beds.

title: Great Location, Good All-Around Hotel
text: Clean, casual comfortable decor.  Business class type hotel.  Friendly, efficient staff.  The citrus/herbal ice water in the lobby was refreshing.  Located near a Walgreen's, Bagel Shop, fruit/vegetable stand, McDonald's, and subway station.  Easy to access much of NYC from here.  Close to Empire State building and Flatiron building.  Moderately priced, good restaurants in the area.

title: Great Location/Modern Hotel
text: The hotel was amazing, the room was beautiful but small, that’s expected in NYC. The location was perfect, walking distance to wonderful restaurants. Trains are also nearby if you don’t want to walk. Would definitely stay here again

title: Great boutique hotel
text: We stayed in a double room in early August. There were 3 of us in the room and it was just enough space without feeling cramped- the high ceilings helped a lot. Decor was beautiful, very modern and relaxing. Standard amenities were all there as well as nice touches like robes, safe and mini fridge. Would definitely return if the price is right!

title: Flatiron District Gem
text: This was my second visit to the Park South. I enjoyed it a number of years ago and enjoyed the boutique hotel atmosphere even more this time. The standard room I had was perfect for one person (might be a tad cozy for two, but they have larger rooms).  The furnishings were tasteful and modern and the room was clean, comfortable and quiet. I enjoyed the coffee shop in the morning and the rooftop bar for drinks later. Best of all was the hotel staff! They could not have been nicer and more accommodating. They will make you feel at home.

title: Great hotel for a weekend adventure near Madison Square Garden
text: Location is important. Choose a hotel that you can walk back and forth from different events. This is one of those hotels! We had a great room, free breakfast that was more than a buffet. Check in was a breeze.

title: New York Honeymoon
text: Spent 3 days in New York on Honeymoon. The Park South is in an excellent location, next to the subway and a short stroll to ESB. Rooms were clean and functional, Air con worked well as NYC was super hot in July

title: Great stay, perfect location
text:
We had an amazing stay for 3 nights for our anniversary. My wife and I were able to use the hotel as our base for exploring the city and it was perfect. The staff stored our bags because we got in early the first morning and then they had our room ready early. The room (queen) is the perfect size for 2 and was very clean. We heard no street noise and just the occasional noise from the hall. The we had drinks in the restaurant and coffee one morning in the coffee shop. 

There is a 6 train stop very close and Citibikes are on the same block. We discovered the bikes and put in about 20 miles of exploring on them, I would highly suggest getting a day pass, just pay attention to your time limit for each ride. NYC has biking down pat with awesome bike lanes and google maps even uses them if you choose biking. 

Overall the hotel was great and met or exceeded all of our expectations! We will be back.

title: Absolutely Perfect
text: The hotel was centrally located, so friendly and accommodating, and a terrific value.  We were thrilled with our week there!  The rooms were a good size, the prices very reasonable, and all of the staff were so helpful.  My family and I found it perfect for us.

title: Great experience
text: Staff were friendly and made us feel welcome our whole stay. Facility was clean, places to hang out, and room was clean! Location was perfect for our visit, in the middle of everything (walking distance to Soho, 5th Ave, Penn Station, Subway, etc.)

title: The place to stay in Manhattan
text: As a self declared hotel snob, I have to stay Park South met all of my expectations and then some.  My room was immaculate, comfortable and quiet.  All of the staff were pleasant and accommodating.  I highly recommend.

title: Nice Hotel, Missing Ammentites and TINY rooms
text:
The Park South Hotel room we were given was very VERY small. No fridge, very few electrical outlets. I mean tiny!. Usually we stay at Marriott hotels but this time tried elsewhere. The bed was on the soft side, which both of us do NOT like. As a result, the next day we were both feeling the effects of this soft bed all day long. When I checked in, the BIG POSITIVE note was the bell man. Christopher Ortiz. This fine man saved us $42.95 + tax (for 1 x 24 hour period) to park  (Fri 7pm to Mon 7AM is free) Thank you Christopher!

The Park South has a roof top bar (you cannot smoke) even though you are in OPEN space with no roof. Yeah really REALLY F--KING stupid. The TV had FOX issues. That is, the audio did not work for FOX NEWS/BUSINESS  channels ( we don't watch FAKE news like CNN). Quality of service..   when I called front desk reporting the issue with FOX NEWS/BUSINESS they had the 'engineer' up in our room in < 10 minutes. Once the 'engineer' reported back that in fact the audio was not working, they put us in another room right away. NOW THAT IS TRULY EXCELLENT SERVICE!

It's a very nice BOUTIQUE Hotel. Very friendly staff, and Christopher Ortiz, will make YOU feel like you're royalty!

I just wish the rooms were at least as big as Marriott but they are about 40% smaller than the average Marriott.  
The COVINA restaurant in the Park South Hotel is EXCELLENT! Food is delicious!
Would I stay here again? NO. Why? Room is too small with no conveniences.

title: A gem in NYC
text: This was such a lovely hotel. It was away from the mayhem of times sq. The staff were wonderful. The rooms and bathrooms were spotless. The breakfast was really good too. Would happily stay again when in NY.

title: My home in the big apple
text:
As a frequent business traveler to NYC, this is a perfect place to start and end your day.

The service and staff is warm and accommodating. The food at the restaurant and coffee shop is delicious.

We look forward to our return every time.

title: Tolle Lage, freundliches Personal, sauber, einfach
text: Wir waren mit der Familie für vier Nächte in diesem Hotel. Die Lage ist prima. Es ist sauber. Das Personal ist freundlich. Es gibt ein sehr gutes Restaurant, welches dem Hotel angeschlossen ist mit dachbar Punkt insgesamt gutes 3 Sterne Stadthotel

title: A lovely stay
text: Highly recommended the Park, its a hidden gem in the middle of it all! I would recommend breakfast and dinner at Covina, their wood burn pizza is to die for and their breakfast is delicious. Its easy as it is in the hotel already.

title: Bar
text: We had little time before our departure to grab a quick bite to eat at the bar in Covina.  This was the only experience that was well below our expectation. We really felt like a bother to the bar staff.  Three times we had to request water, we were not drinking anything else, and we had to request our check. Although not rude, very inattentive.

title: Midtown Gem
text: I had a great experience here at Park South. It was close to everything I needed. The room served my needs. I typically need a good internet connection and comfortable bed. The mattress could use some updates. Overall, it was good experience. The front staff are just great people.

title: Business trip
text: Rooms were small but clean, when I first went to my room it was not ready, had to call down to front desk to let them know.  For a boutique type hotel, cute and beds were comfortable.  Waited in line for the roof top bar but were not able to get in, went to a different roof top bar instead. Drink onsite was expensive. I could hear music and people from rooftop bar in my room when I was trying to get to sleep, alot of noise from the room next door too.

title: Park South Hotel
text: Never disappointed when I stay at Park South Hotel.  The hotel staff is very friendly and accommodating.  Additionally the rooms are always clean.  Look forward to staying at Park South whenever I go to NYC.  Very good on site restaurant and rooftop bar.

title: Great hotel in the City!
text: We just got back from a weekend getaway in the city and stayed at the Park South Hotel.  What a great place!  The staff are super friendly an hotel is very clean.  It is in a great location, with a subway entrance on the same block and a Duane Reade around the corner if you should need any snacks for the room plus any toiletries you may have forgotten.  There are many restaurants and bars in the area. We had dinner in Covina one night and went to the roof bar both nights.  We had burgers in Covina which were really good.  The drinks at the roof bar are good but pricey.  They are normal prices for NYC but any drinks over ice, are sucked down in a few sips.  I watched one of my glasses sit on the bar when I was done with it.  The ice melted and it filled the glass 3/4 full with water.  The rooms are small, (standard for NYC) but clean.  The beds are really comfy and we never heard noise.  We were lucky to find street parking both days, so I can't speak @ the parking but the front desk told me it would be $55 for valet during a 24 period.  There is a parking lot right across the street as well.  I would definitely stay here again if we are coming back to this area.

title: Absolute must-go
text:
The only place I want to go when I am in New York: the location of the hotel is georgious, an oasis of quietness and calm in busy and noisy New York. The breakfast room with view on Central Park and the high quality of the breakfast buffet ( even the filter coffee passes my European taste test).
Recommended without restriction

title: Loved it!
text: We stayed here for 4 nights in July, room was compact but as we expected for New York. All staff were fantastic and very helpful at all times. Rooftop bar was very busy and closed for private functions for 2 of our 4 nights and also due to bad weather so we only managed one quick visit but happy hour in the hotel bar was great, reasonable prices and a good atmosphere. Hotel is in a really good location for getting around the city, lots of nice restaurants/bars in the area and the deli next door bagels and schmear was excellent for a takeaway breakfast.

title: Always a top spot for Mid-town
text: I have stayed here 40+ times and having had to try others (due to availability) I can attest that this is the best hotel in the area. The location is ideal, the staff (who stay for years, attesting to the great atmosphere) are fantastic, and there is a range of room sizes all fairly priced.

title: A Complete Gem in Midtown
text: Loved, loved this hotel. The room was a great size and the bathroom was heavenly. The subway was literally a few minutes away - and it was on the 6 line so it went everywhere. The breakfast options were varied and so delicious - huge, too! There was always ice-cold water in the lobby which was perfect since it was hot when we visited. Such a cozy, inviting hotel. And spotless!

title: GREAT LOCATION, GREAT SERVICE, SMALL ROOMS!!!!!!!!!!
text: The first time we walked in to this hotel, which was in a superb location, the bell boy slung a huge suitcase on to his shoulder, picked up another and got two cases on to one arm! The service was very quick and in no time we were in our room. Our room was small but lovely with a coffee machine and a huge TV, moreover, soft, comfy double beds. When we went out in to the city the House Keeping was amazing (except the time when they didn't come because we left the do not disturb on).

title: Awesome
text: It is a nice hotel, comfortable & the staff is amazing. From the greeter to the cleaner they all were awesome. The room was amazing, they also upgraded my stay because of my Hyatt status, i loved that.

title: GREAT LOCATION AND FANTASTIC STAFF
text: Very Nice Hotel in a quiet area of Manhattan but still only 15 minutes walk from the Empire State Building and 30 minutes walk from times square and other interesting sites, it's also closer to The Statue Of Liberty and downtown Manhattan so for us it was perfect. We stayed for 6 nights, the rooms are quite small (very narrow) but clean. There were no complimentary coffee making facility in the room and I was disappointed regards the Garden top bar, the view from it may be unobstructed but the buildings you do see are pretty shabby and you cant see over them probably because the hotel is not a very tall building. That said the restaurant food was excellent and reasonably priced but what made it for us was the exceptionally friendly staff, everyone off them were polite, friendly and would do anything for you. I would definitely stay here again and can recommend it as a good all round place to stay while visiting New York.

title: Clean and Welcoming
text: This hotel was a great find.  It is clean and is up to date.  The rooms are small, but this is NYC.  The location is not near the hustle and bustle of Times Square or the Financial District.  However, I loved that it was away from the chaos.  The staff at the hotel was wonderful.  They were warm, welcoming, professional, and would go the extra mile.  We had especially good service from Rochelle (front desk) and Chris (held our bags).  I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Superbe séjour. Très bien situé. A. recommander
text:
Séjour à New-york dans ce magnifique hôtel idéalement situé.
En plein Manhattan, près de park avenue à 2 pas de l'empire state building et à 15 minutes à pied de Time square et de Broadway.
accueil sympathique, belle décoration, très propre.
Magnifique roof top pendant la période estivale.
Restaurant Covina attenant à 'hôtel vous proposant des repas de grandes qualités. du petit déjeuner au diner , tout est excellent.

title: Great mid-priced hotel
text: This is a well run mid-priced hotel with friendly staff, good facilities and a great location in Midtown Manhatten.  I was in NY on business and didn't have time to try the rooftop bar but the Covina restaurant is surprisingly good.  Rooms are small but the bed is very comfortable.  It could be improved with tea and coffee making facilities in the room and availability of room service.

title: Cute Park Ave Hotel
text: I decided to try out a new Hyatt property since I was only staying one night in the city. It is a very cute boutique type hotel. Decor was very hollywood glam. Rooms are spacious and include a Keurig. Clean room and bathroom. The rooftop bar had great food and drinks.

title: Visita a New York en pareja
text:
ParkSouth es un buen hotel para visitar New York, especialmente para visitar a pie todos los puntos importantes de Manhattan.

Tiene la ventaja de estar cerca del centro de la ciudad pero, aún así, está en una zona tranquila que te permite descansar confortablemente.

Tiene todos los servicios de un hotel de su categoría y, además, aporta un valor añadido importante sobre todo para el verano, que es el disponer de una RoofTop (Terraza) en la planta 8, donde se puede tomar una bebida e incluso algo de comida, tiene unas vistas muy buenas y te permite relajarte después de una jornada de visitas por la ciudad.
Por ponerle algún pero, sería recomendable mejorar la limpieza de las habitaciones y que el aire acondicionado no hiciera tanto ruido.
Por lo demás, todo perfecto, incluyendo el servicio WiFi que en algunas informaciones que aparecen del hotel dicen no disponer de este servicio y, el servicio existe y tiene cobertura tanto en las habitaciones como en el resto del hotel.
La cama de la habitación era supergrande (2x2 aprox.) y muy cómoda (Habitación superior).
El desayuno en el restaurante COVINA es muy bueno, aportando productos hechos a mano en la cocina del restaurante.

title: Park South hotel
text: The staff is very attentive, professional and kind.  The rooms are very clean with a good bathroom.  Maybe if you can choose for a king-size bed.  The normal restaurant is delicious,  certainly for the breakfast.  Go there and ask to Diego to help you for tips

title: Simply charming
text:
This hotel has so much charm, the decor is that of a great boutique hotel. 
Staff are all really friendly and so helpful and the small touches like the great toiletries made the stay so comfortable and we would come back here to stay anytime.  We had best wedding anniversary here !!!  Thank you.

title: Great hotel, could not fault the service or accommodation.
text:
The hotel is modern, clean and comfortable. Staff are welcoming and friendly, we felt valued as were greeted each day by reception staff and the doorman. Champagne and chocolates were in our room to help us to celebrate our special event which was lovely.
It is a bit of a hike to Times Square which gets a bit tiring after a long day sightseeing, but as a result there was no noise from the street. The room was very clean and comfortable, but sadly no exciting view from our window. The roof top bar was fun for cocktails and this closes at 12 so no noise after this time.

title: Perfect location for NYC Getaway
text: We've now stayed at the Park South twice with our children and love the hotel. It's a convenient location, the rooms are beautiful and quiet, and the staff is incredibly friendly. Rachel and Carl were so nice to our children, and they remembered them from several months ago. We'll be back!

title: No complaints but no high praise
text: Spent one night at this hotel and it was fine. The room was small but normal for New York City.  The staff was friendly but not exceptional. I wish I had more time to explore the neighborhood and many Indian restaurants.

title: absolutely lovely stay!
text: Loved the hotel -  I have told all my coworkers about it and plan to return! hotel was much nicer than I expected from booking and the price, the hotel staff was lovelly and the food at covina was surprisingly delish!

title: Perfect Girls’s Getaway
text: My friend and and I recently stayed at the Park South for a girl’s getaway to NYC. Based on the reviews and rooftop bar, I suggested we give this boutique hotel a try. I am so glad we did. It checks off all the boxes on a traveler’s needs. First and foremost, the staff were all extremely friendly and helpful. They seemed to really enjoy working there, from the doorman to the registration staff to the bartenders in the restaurant. We were always greeted with a huge smile and were treated like family. The owners are so lucky to have these dedicated people on their staff. The room was modern and oh so clean. Not a speck of dirt anywhere. The beds and pillows were so comfortable that we didn’t want to get up in the morning. My friend had warned me that she snores, but I never heard a thing. There is a refrigerator in the room to keep water cold (they give complimentary water) and they leave chocolates in the room. The subway stop is on the corner about 500 feet from the hotel, so it’s convenient to get places. There are also good restaurants within walking distance and a grocery store on the corner as well. You can turn on a light to indicate if you want housekeeping or not (don’t forget to turn off the do not disturb button before you leave for a day of sightseeing). The only thing that makes it not perfect is the little counter space in the bathroom, and I wish there was a makeup mirror in the bath area, but it’s NYC, and rooms aren’t big. I will definitely stay at the Park South next time I visit NYC. It was a great spot away from the huge crowds. I felt more like a New Yorker coming home than a tourist entering a hotel. Love it. Oh, and the pizza is excellent in the attached restaurant. You can’t go wrong with this hotel. Say hello to the staff from me.

title: Tucked away gem in the middle of Manhattan
text:
Great location and handsome design. Clean rooms. Jonathan Adler bath amenities.
Great roof deck bar/restaurant with view of Empire State bldg and Covina restaurant also very good.
Quiet block, rooms did not have the greatest views mostly internal locations btn bldgs, North side best views towards Empire State.

title: Perfect !!!
text: Je suis très heureuse de mon séjour  de cinq jours dans cet hôtel : tout a été vraiment parfait, la localisation,  les chambres ( place et propreté) et le personnel; je recommanderai cet hôtel volontiers .   J’espère pouvoir revenir vite .

title: Hotel's Accommodations Didn't Measure Up
text: The staff at the hotel couldn't have been nicer, and they responded to my service requests promptly and with grace and good humor.  However, the room I stayed in was poorly designed - no shelving or chest of drawers, and worst of all, the toilet paper holder was located on the wall opposite the toilet, making it necessary to get up from the toilet if you needed to retrieve a piece of toilet paper.  This was most bizarre and just plain bad design.

title: Dirty, broken, don’t care
text: The soaking tub was dirty when I got there. Also the drain didn’t work - it didn’t hold water. Literally didn’t close. The woman at front desk when I cked in left me standing there for 5 minutes “after telling me to wait” while she opened packages totally unrelated to cking me in. I could never reach anyone from my phone to tell them about issues with the room. No one would pick up. Last, they didn’t tell me my room was down a flight of stairs from the elevator; I had lots of bags and had to negotiate the stairs when I got to my floor. They could have offered to help me, or at least tell me so I could have changed rooms as this did NOT make my experience comfortable. Last, the bed was old and sunken in the middle. Horrible.

title: Great Stay in the Flat Iron District
text:
A hidden gem of a hotel located within walking distance to Madison Park(home of the original Shake Shack), Trader Joe’s, Whole Foods, etc Shirt walk to the subway. And of course 2 restaurants on site as well as many in the neighborhood.
The hotel Has an intimate feel with modern decor. The staff was friendly, the rooms conveniently laid out with a comfortable bed. A great choice

title: Great place!
text: Definitely a gem. The front desk staff was amazing. The restaurant had great food and the bar was pretty nice too. It was a little hard to find, but I did. Great location. I am anxious to go back again!

title: A Fantastic Staycation in the City
text: Loved my stay here.  The room was perfect and had a pretty view of the Chrysler building from the window.  Was given a free happy hour drink at Covina which was such a cool spot on the main floor of the hotel.  The pizza there was also a star!  Ended the night at their Roof at Park South where there was a scene at 11pm despite the spot closing at midnight.  The frozen drinks were strong and delicious which proved to be the perfect nightcap before heading in for the night.  Will definitely be back.

title: Hidden ‘facility fee, ruined otherwise nice stay
text: I hate it when hotels hide fees. Avoid this hotel! Staff are also unfriendly but the hidden facility fee is my main issue. Hyatt needs to prevent this behaviour. Location was decent. Rooms were small.

title: Amazing Bachelorette!
text: Great hotel, amazing roof top terrace, nice size room for 4, perfect customer service with really friendly staff. Beds are really confortable, room is not noisy, great location and walkable distance to all NYC highlights. Highly recommand this place!

title: Perfect location, clean rooms, free bottled water at front desk
text: I stayed here for 2 nights for a work meeting that was being held nearby. The location is excellent, close to so many things. I walked to 42nd street, it took about 15 minutes. It is about 3 minutes from the Subway station.  The rooms are small as all NYC hotels are but clean and comfortable. There is body wash in the bathroom, I  just wish there were shower caps. (I checked in late at night and asked the front desk person for a shower cap and he said there was one in the room. There was not.)  They provide free bottled water if you ask at the desk.  The reservations manager Samoya was top notch. Super helpful in changing my rate to the group block rate when I didn't have it on my reservation. I did not have a chance to have a drink at the bar but it looks gorgeous. All in all I highly recommend.

title: Great Stay!
text: We were only in NYC for one night, but this hotel was perfect.  The location is great, just steps away from a subway line and an easy walk to many spots.  The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful.  The room was clean and comfortable, decorated in soothing grays and whites.  The bed was one of my favorite hotel beds.  Our "city view" room actually had a view of a brick wall, but we weren't in the room enough for that to matter and the best part of that is it meant our room was super quiet!  The bathroom was small, but laid out well and the shower had great water pressure.  I would definitely stay here again and recommend this property to friends!

title: Fantastic hotel in great location
text: Really recommend this hotel for family trips to NYC. Visiting with my mother, aunt and sister in law - very comfortable and quiet rooms with super cosy beds! Breakfasts really good in corvova restaurant in hotel. Visited the Rooftop bar on our first night, a bit pricy but food really tasty, a great atmosphere and views and you really feel like you have arrived in NYC! Hotel in a Great location next to subway, shops and restaurants and walking distance to Empire State Building and other attractions. But the best thing about the hotel are the staff - warm and friendly - have really made our stay feel special. With a special mention of the guy on the door with a great smile and who gave us lots of great tips for getting around, using the subway and just being super nice to my mum and aunt which they loved! Great hotel which has really added to our fantastic trip to NYC.

title: Great location
text: We stayed as a three generation family-everything was great and it was really convenient to be close to a subway station. The staff was very friendly. Breakfast was good in the cafe. Our room was comfortable - just a little noisy at night-but could be a problem anywhere in NYC.

title: Bien situé, et prix correct
text:
Nous avons réservés cet hôtel sur Booking.com car le prix était interessant et le petit dejeuner était compris, contrairement au site officiel de l'hôtel.
Malheureusement en arrivant, on nous a attribué une chambre sombre au 6eme étage avec vue sur mur! Je suis descendue à l'accueil où on m'a dit que j'avais réservé une chambre donnant sur cour, Je lui ai quand même expliqué la différence de la vue sur cour et la vue sur mur! Pas moyen de négocier un upgrade, il a fallu payer un supplément de 30$ (sans taxes)  par jour pour avoir une chambre supérieur avec une vue sur le Chrysler building. Le petit dejeuner se prend dans le restaurant attenant à l'hotel, et est correct. C'est à la carte avec un choix; L'accueil est charmant, souriant et il y a toujours qualqu'un pour vous aider avec les bagages. Le restaurant attenant à l'hôtel, propose des pizzas et autres plats italiens, mais vous trouverez juste derrière l'hôtel un excellent petit restaurant italien (TRULLI) où les pâtes sont faite maison. 
Nous conseillons cet hôtel pur son emplacement et sa proximité d'une station métro.

title: Short stay in NYC
text: I really enjoyed this hotel.  The roof top bar is great.  The food is good. When you sit in the lobby you can watch the world walking by.  A glass of wine is too pricey. The staff is great, friendly and helpful.

title: Volvería sin dudas
text: Tanto la cordialidad y el servicio fueron excelentes, siempre atentos a nuestras necesidades... la ubicación es muy buena ya que esta en una zona que queda relativamente cerca todo, y el metro está en la esquina. La habitaciones muy confortables, yo tenía la estándar y eramos 2 adultos y dos niños, tal vez algo justas en el espacio pero adecuadas. Limpieza excelente

title: Gutes zentrales Hotel
text:
Ich war für zwei Nächte über das Wochenende im Park South Hotel in der 28. Straße.

Das Hotel liegt sehr zentral, optimal zur Erkundung der Stadt. Die nächste Metro ist direkt in der gleichen Straße.

Die Zimmer sind ziemlich klein, aber modern eingerichtet und vor allem sauber. Ich habe mich dort wohl gefühlt.

Kleines Manko: wenn man mal nicht lange unterwegs ist abends/nachts, hört man insb. im 8. Stock dann doch relativ lange die Geräuschkulisse aus der Roof Top Bar (hielt sich aber noch im Rahmen). Auch die Klimaanlage war recht laut.

Das Frühstück im Hotel war ebenfalls gut, allerdings nicht ganz günstig (Joghurt mit Früchten z.B. 15 Dollar vor Steuern etc.).

Das Personal war stets freundlich und hilfsbereit.

Insgesamt ein gelungener Aufenthalt.

title: an excellent hotel in a perfect spot of manhattan
