text: The hotel is well located for exploring Manhatten and the surrounding area. Near the Subway and in a quieter neighborhood (Flatiron). Great room with coffee and tea service and a great bed! Very friendly and helpful staff. The roof terrace is beautiful but you have to take into account the locals who come to drink after work (quite noisy and little space)

title: Over-priced and disappointing
text: After making a reservation directly on the hotel's direct website, I was informed upon arrival that that the price I'd been quoted wasn't real. I was actually asked: "Why would you believe the person on the phone?" After I proved I'd spoke directly with the hotel and not with a service like Expedia, the bullheaded manager begrudgingly backed down and honored the promotion (not a big deal - just a restaurant credit I might not even use daily) he called up top my room later with "but you can't have..." blah blah blah making things even more unfriendly. My first room was okay - no tub, but nice shower and giant TV.  An alarm right by my head woke me up at one AM. The man who came to fix it explained: "This happens quite a bit - our alarms are quirky..". and he unplugged it. My 2nd night, a dump truck directly under my window woke me up at 3am. I was then moved since construction would be going on all week with late-night dump trucks the entire time. My second room was a tiny squished little rectangle room with barely space to walk by the beds, but it was nice and quiet. The bathroom was tiny and old, but clean. This hotel has an awesome restaurant. I suggest having breakfast in the restaurant downstairs  (something I'm destined to do - I visit NY often, but don't recommend this hotel. I paid over three grand to stay a week and it just wasn't worth it. I wish I'd been pre-warned.

title: Best hotel in NYC - Service Location and Value for Money
text:
Excellent location, wonderful service, rich breakfast, large rooms, renovated hotel in the heart of NYC.

Breakfast in Covina was far above expectations. 
The rooms are big, convenient and quiet. 

The location is just in the right place!

title: If  you want to feel at home in the city, stay at Park South!
text: I found this gem of a property almost 5 years ago and will not stay anywhere else when I visit NYC for work or personal reasons.  It is a boutique hotel located in a great neighborhood with immediate access to the 6 train that will get essentially anywhere in the city.  The staff are very warm, inviting and hospitable and make you feel like you are family.  There is a great bar/restaurant on the main level and a rooftop bar that is exceptional.  The rooms are always clean, modern, comfortable and quiet.  Many great restaurants located on the block of hotel if you want to venture out, but my favorite place is the deli right next door.  I highly recommend Park South Hotel!

title: Great stay
text: Great personal service, clean rooms, terrific food and beverage. Price was good for NYC. We were able to walk up and down town, so its location is great. Covina restaurant was perfect for atmosphere...plus lots of local stores nearby.

title: Park South Hotel is a gem!
text: If you like a nice mid-priced hotel on the East Side with a staff that makes guests feel like they truly care about your experience, the Park South is my favorite. We visit here often to see family and stay at the Park South because it’s well-located, a good value, and consistently a pleasant experience!

title: Business + Fun
text: PSH is perfectly located in the far end of Midtown/Flat Iron district walking distance to offices, restaurants and travel hot spots.  The subway and Grand Central Station are steps away to make business trips a bit more fun!  This is my second stay and I recommend due to location, accommodations and service a little off the beaten path.

title: Loud and uncomfortable
text: Vending machines, and necessities store. Hotel faucet water had a bad taste, there was no where I could find with a vending machine for bottles of anything. The front desk was able to give me two 11oz bottles of water. I'm glad they were free, but not having options to get supplies in the hotel was a real disappointment. Also, there was some kind of party happening nearby with very loud music and cheering which made it difficult to sleep and work. There was little I found convenient here, and the say was not comfortable.

title: Overall ok and staff very nice
text: A bit disappointed by the rooms (less attractive than on the pictures), the A/C is noisy, but overall the room was ok (if you just plan to sleep ). The staff was very nice and friendly and the hotel is very well located uf you want to be downtown.

title: Never Judge a Book by its Cover
text: From the outside, you’ll never know what’s in store for you. Be sure to get the value for money at this hotel, location, comfort, and hospitality can be expected and are up to par with some of the best hotels.

title: Great location & Relaxing stay
text: The location was very convenient for all that we wanted to do. The room and bed were super comfortable. The staff was courteous and hospitable. Roof and Covina were both really great with wonderful food and drink options, and great staff.

title: Lovely stay, boutique feel, great location.
text: This was my first solo trip to New York and the Park South Hotel was the perfect place to stay. The hotel is beautiful with a great restaurant and an amazing rooftop. The room was cozy and comfy and the shower had good water pressure and lots of hot water. Ubers found the place easily (not always the case) and the hotel was perfectly located between my friends on the UES and LES. It's also very decently priced. I would definitely stay here again!

title: Exceptional Staff & Hotel
text: Stayed 4 nights and each and every day and evening the staff was friendly, nice, and helpful.  Would not consider staying any where else after staying at Park South. Our room was super clean and comfortable and safe.  We met friends that also stayed for 4 nights.  The hotel put us on the same floor.  Very much appreciated that.  We did enjoy the rooftop bar and used the coffee shop for early morning coffee and quick food.  Covina was great. We ate brunch and two breakfasts.  I am sorry we did not have time to visit O Ya the adjoining Japanese Restaurant. Next time we will try it. We did like the close NYC subway stop.

title: Spacious, quality, excellent location, helpful personnel
text:
We have traveled to NYC many many times throughout the years, and particularly in the past 4 years as our son attended college in the city.
We stayed at the Park South Hotel during Mother's Day weekend with our family. This is the most spacious room I've seen in NYC at this price point. 
Location: right around the corner from Little India, this location has excellent access to subway lines, restaurants, shops, and tourist spots. 
Facility: clean, well-appointed throughout. 
Staff: from the doormen to the front desk to the housekeeping, all were excellent. A+!
Would definitely stay here again.

title: Great Place to stay
text: The rooms were clean and very modern.  Front desk was very hospitable when I arrived and throughout my stay.  This hotel is very convenient to my job which makes it even better.  This  was my second time to stay at Park South and I have enjoyed both of my visits. The only drawback were the car horns at 3 AM but then again Welcome to NY!

title: Hilde & Luc
text: We were 4 nights in the hotel. It meets the requests of a boutique hotel, modern, trendy and very friendly personnel, who assist with personal service. You are not a number. The rooms are rather small but this is common for NY. Very positive that you cannot hear any noise during the night. The restaurant is nice as well, good qualityfood.

title: NY Gem
text: Park South is not to be missed. The friendly staff and the comfortable, clean rooms make for a very pleasant stay. It all comes at a great value too It is our go to destination when visiting family in the city.

title: Paid $300 for a small room, view of a wall, and shower pressure was next to nothing.
text: Paid $300 for a small room, view of a wall, and shower pressure was next to nothing.  This hotel is not worth the price.  Location is ok and is near a Subway station.  I need to add more words to meet the 200 letter min.

title: Great hotel!
text: Very much appreciated the staff - they were helpful and easy to communicate with. Also very much appreciated the staff at the front doors - they immediately helped grab my luggage and lead my inside the second my taxi door opened.

title: Amazing stay
text: We stayed for our wedding at the beginning of May having already stayed with Park south in April the previous year. Staying in a brownstone king gives you the much coveted space that’s so often lacking in Midtown hotels; and the hotel is a 30 second walk from the subway, making it perfect to get to anywhere within manhattan with minimal effort. The staff were amazing, helping arrange some in room surprises for my (now!) wife in the room and generally are a just really nice people! We will definitely be going back, just hope that Hyatt keeps it as it is given it’s just been bought!

title: Hidden Facility Fees and NO Breakfast before 7:30am
text:
The hotel was clean and nicely decorated, but that is where my positive experience ends.  I am 5’3” and the bed must have had a shortened custom mattress because my feet reached the end of the bed. Given my stature, this is never a problem I’ve experienced before.  Beware if you are tall....you will hang off the bed. 

Breakfast is not available in the hotel (and there is no room services) before 7:30am. This is a real inconvenience when you have an 8am meeting elsewhere in the city. Sadly, there is not even a way to make coffee or tea in your room.

title: Bullying Manager - False Booking
text: We chose this hotel after the rep on the hotel's website offered us a 25 dollar a day credit in the downstairs restaurant. When I arrived, the manager refused to honor the credit, insisting I'd book on another site. After I proved that I booked through the hotel, his assistant said, "Well, our rep doesn't know what deals each of our hotels offer. Why in the world did you believe her?" A sweet third clerk took the manager in another room to talk sense to him. Upon their return, the manager honored what we'd been promised, but later stubbornly called up to my room with: "You better use up your credits!" - too aggressive for words. The first night, a quirky alarm in my room woke me up at 3AM. When I asked the manager if it could be unplugged (the furniture was too heavy for me to move alone to get to the plug) he again became angry. "It's probably noise outside!" When the hotel fix-it guy came to check, he laughed and said, "These things are always going off at the wrong time - they're quirky. Yep, let's just unplug it." The next night, a dump truck under my window woke me up at 1am. This was not the fault of the hotel - just bad luck - construction ongoing in the area. I was moved from an okay room to a squishy room with beds so short, my feet hung over the side. My room was quiet - I stayed. We've been searching for a hotel to frequent near our son who lives a block away. This hotel could have made well over 6 thousand dollars off our family per year for years to come, but now we'll be looking for a better run hotel. Covina, the restaurant downstairs, is amazing. That's how we found this hotel - my son and his GF eat there all the time. I shared our family info with the manager right up front. A good manager would have done the math and been gracious. This odd person just wanted to be right. He didn't connect the dots. btw, the restaurant (and waiters) are adorable as is most the staff. Too bad the manager spoils it all.

title: Great stay
text:
The hotel was very clean, very fancy. The rooms are quite tiny unfortunately, and I a little overpriced in my opinion so I would look for a discount in the future. 

However, the hotel has been recently renovated, and is super clean and comfortable so would stay here again. The restaurant and rooftop bar were great. The staff were very welcoming and wonderful.

title: Amazing!
text: We loved our stay at Park South Hotel!  The building and decor is exquisitely New York boutique and the staff is friendly and helpful. Covina restaurant is on the lobby level and is delicious!  We loved it and will be back!  ❤️

title: Gute Lage
text:
Sehr gute Lage, 50 m weiter ist die Subway 28 th Straße. In wenigen Minuten ist z.B. am Flatiron. Die grüne U-Bahn-Linie 5 bringt einen direkt zur Grand Central oder nach Brooklyn. In Kips Bay  - so heißt das Viertel, wo das Hotel liegt - sind viele Lokale, Delis und somit rund um das Hotel.  Gerade wer Indisches Essen liebt, ist hier richtig. Sichere Gegend, alles gut.

Das Hotel selber ist klein, auch die Zimmer sind ziemlich eng. Aber das ist halt so mitten in Manhattan. Alles sehr sehr sauber, sehr guter Service, kleiner Fitnessraum, auf dem Dach eine "Rooftop-Bar".

Mit dabei ist ein italienisches Restaurant, was den Vorteil hat, dass man dort Frühstücken tut, dieses auch sehr gut ist und man wird bedient. Allerdings wechselte in den ganzen 7 Tagen, die wir hier verbrachten das Menu nicht und so hat man sich schnell aus den 5 oder 6 Menüs ab gegessen. Für ein paar Tage sehr ok, auf längere Sicht würden wir aber ein Büffet bevorzugen,

title: Hôtel agréable
text:
Nous avons séjourné 6 jours, et globalement très satisfaites : chambre executive spacieuse, bonne literie, bien insonorisee, seule la climatisation est épouvantable, bruyante, nous l'avons coupée car les températures du printemps s'y prêtaient, mais surement un vrai problème l'hiver et l'été.
Le petit-déjeuner inclus est top, l'assiette de pancakes est mortelle en particulier, le service est lent le matin par contre. Sinon, les lieux communs sont sobres, pas d'environnement démesuré, ni de décor clinquant, et le service est cool, à l'image de la personne qui vous ouvre la porte. Rooftop visité, mais pas essayé (trop frais !) : sympa mais pas extraordinaire ; par contre, il y a un super club de jazz juste en face, sur la 28eme st. Bon point : station de metro ligne verte à côté. Le prix de la chambre tous frais inclus reste toutefois élevé compte tenu des prestations, même à New York, et c'est le principal point négatif.

title: perfect position on the map of manhattan, but not unforgettable
text: the staff  looks like very kind one, but just for a lot of smiles... the only two request:  changement sheets of beds and a further luggage bench, have gained  as their feedback :at first three times a "yes, yes" and at least a "sorry, it isn't possible"!!!! very nice the boy at entrance, to whom I'm very sorry to not have given any final tip, because money cash was finished! the hotel is located in a very comfortable position, very close to the subway and a very good pret a manger, very good for breakfast

title: Tried and True❤️
text: Park South Hotel is a true gem! Upon my frequent visits to NYC to visit my son in grad school, I stayed here. As a solo traveler, I find PSH to be the best in creating a warm, welcoming atmosphere time after time. The staff is extremely accommodating from arrival to departure.The hotel is meticulously maintained.

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text: That's a case of great value for money in the heart of Manhattan. Very friendly staff, excellent location, and very clean premises. I've been there several times already and will certainly return. Highly recommended!

title: Hotel was great
text: The Park South Hotel has the perfect location for visiting up- and downtown NY. Very nice and helpfull staff and clean rooms. I would like to stay again in the Park South Hotel. Greetings from Austria. :)

title: Great experiance.
text: Great location, lovely facility. Quiet and comfortable. Affordable. Building very well designed. to meet our needs. Staff very accommodating and helpful. Would definitely recommend. Good food, good coffee bar. Good recommendations for restaurants and bars in neighborhood. Convenient to MTA.

title: Superb hotel
text: Perfect hotel with a nice athmosphere. The restaurant is nice and the food is great. Friendly staff and nice rooms.Good location near the subway. This was our second time at the hotel and we can warmly recomend it.

title: Excellent service.
text:
Excellent service. Nous avons vraiment apprécié le sens du service du personnel. 
Le bar est top et le cocktail mascalero est fabuleux. 
Très bonne situation dans Manhattan. 
Les chambres sont de taille habituelle pour NY donc pas très grands.

title: Great location, amazing staff.
text: We stayed at this hotel for four nights with our two teenage kids. We booked two rooms so we would all have plenty of space! We loved it. The location was perfect, only a few steps from the subway. The facilities in the hotel were good with coffee machine and a little fridge for essentials. The beds were comfortable and my daughter particularly liked the pillows! It was spotlessly clean and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend. The staff were extremely helpful with everything from restaurant bookings to sim cards for mobile phones so we could stay connected while we were out and about. We ate in Covina restaurant on one of the nights, the food, while expensive, is excellent.

title: Fantastic location, best beds ever & employees almost like family!
text: The employees of the hotel are warm and welcoming from A to Z. Especially the doormen say goodbye and greet you every day with a warm greeting. My mom and I have been the first time in NewYork. The location of the hotel was excellent - we could do everything on foot. Around the corner is the subway and nearby is the Empire State Building. And we LOVED the beds. So cozy... The only thing: we did not arrived to open the window which usually I prefer to sleep. It was very heavy. And to people who are delicate with noise: you will hear a lot from floor-side like talkings, the elevator etc. It was not too worse for us but if you have a light sleep ask for a quiet room. The promised city view after upgrading the rooms was very poor - on 5th floor we only saw a few walls from the buildings on the other side. We expected a nice glance on the city. Anyway- those are just small things to be ignored :-) We can warmly recommend the hotel.

title: Very good hotel .... but....
text: Have stayed here a number of times. Staff are excellent. The bar really terrific with great food and a lively early evening atmosphere. Room allocation makes this either a poor or very good stay. I switched rooms after a night in search of  a quieter room. The new room was larger,  bright and a very good size for NYC on the 8th floor ...but the noise from the street and trucks  was continual throughout the night . There is construction around the hotel and the window sound proofing just isn’t good enough to keep noise out. Which is a shame as this is overall an excellent boutique hotel. A couple of other points swing this from very good to average on this visit. They still charge an additional  daily facility charge of $26 on top of your agreed room rate . This is just a not so smart way of being seen as cheaper on online travel sites and hitting you after the  event. Not transparent and not evident what you get for it as there  is not even bottled water in the room. Finally the showers whilst looking good lack any power at all . So, I want to like the hotel because it has a lot going for it  but the overall experience ends up being average and not as good value as expected.

title: Publicidad engañosa
text:
La hermosa terraza que publicitan está cerrada. La habitación para 4 con dos camas matrimoniales es imposible. Cada cama mide 1,30, tenis que dormir apretados, pagando como si fuera un buen hotel. 
No pago barato y elegí todo por lago fotos. Una decepción.

title: Great Stay at Park South!
text: We stayed at Park South Hotel from 04/05-04/09 and had a wonderful time.  The location was perfect for us while visiting our daughter.  The rooms are good size for in the city and very clean.  They have a nice restaurant and bar onsite.  Excellent service from everyone.  I hope to stay here next time we are in the city.

title: Sunday trip
text: Great place staff was wonderful clean rooms and its perfect. I recommend it to anybody staying in NYC and the area around it had great restaurants and places to visit. Rachel set up my trip and staff came out to get our bags

title: Excellent staff and clean, beautiful property.
text: The front desk and door staff provided excellent service, and personal attention.  The beautiful common room in the hotel with fireplace was a unique area to meet guests as well as quietly read.  Both Covina and Oya are excellent healthy restaurants on-site.  The hotel rooms are spacious, clean and provide excellent amenities.

title: Hidden gem
text: It’s a special self-satisfaction to find your own New York niche. This hotel provides elegance and comfort for a reasonable price in a great location. I woke for back anytime my travels took me or any of my family back to a

title: cozy place to stay
text: Excellent place to stay. Love the cozy feel of the fireplace library to read or just have a drink. Rooms are clean and also have a cozy feel to them. Hotel on the quiet side which is a nice feeling for NYC.

title: No Sleep
text: It greatly surprises me when I stay at a hotel that is noisy.  I have travelled quite a bit and find that even high priced hotels often do a terrible job of doing the basics.  Clearly, hotels are most specifically charged with providing a place in which you can sleep.  That is job one.  Yet, here I am in the big apple exhausted from a sleep interupted night.  And, the noise was all the hotels’ doing according to management.  Drilling in the hall outside our room at 2 a.m. and lots of other banging and clunking noises.  Doing duct work.  Why?  Why would management choose that time to have workmen making noise in the hall in a fully booked hotel? And, their response to our complaint? To take a facility charge off of our bill for one night.  I do not want a minor bill reduction - I want SLEEP!  Last time we stay here.  Really, I could get a bad nights sleep at a Motel 6 by the airport.  In the city one would think an upscale hotel (advertised as such) would be run better.

title: a beautiful oasis in NYC
text: This is my come-back-to-always hotel. I've tried many hotels in an effort to get the best price that will save money for my clients. What is clear to me is that this hotel is a gem, and I try to come here vs other hotels whenever I can. It's quiet, clean, welcoming, safe, hip in a quiet way (no techno music), and close to many really good ethnic restaurants. The staff is so kind and upbeat; Covina has tasty food and a nice wine selection. Beds are comfy, internet is fast. Subway is less than a block away, as is a drugstore, in case you forget your hairbrush! Try it, you'll like it.

title: Great Place, Great Staff, Great Accomodations
text: Hotel was located in a central location and was very clean, beautifully decorated and updated. There were great restaurants and bars in the hotel. The staff was professional, friendly and helpful. Rooms were quiet and comfortable. Would definitely recommend and would stay here again!

title: Great hotel
text: Great location and friendly staff. I had a very enjoyable experience during my arrival and departure. All of the doormen were extremely friendly and helpful. Hopefully on my next trip I will be able to visit the Roof Top bar.

title: Great find!
text: Super location and such friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are comfortable, clean and great for working! It was so refreshing to stay in a smaller, quaint hotel where the service was personal. The happy hour (where you can use your token for a free beer or wine) was really fun.

title: Excellent experience
text: I had stayed here a few years ago and all was good so since I remembered the place, I figured why not? Great location to walk to the theaters and to the 9/11 museum. My two granddaughters and I ate breakfast and dinner at the restaurant, Covina, at the hotel. Really good breakfast ( bagel and lox etc) and especially tasty pizza and salads for dinner!  Room was large and comfortable; but, the best was the staff. Helpful, pleasant, professional  and friendly. Will definitely stay here again the next time I visit New York.

title: A fantastic place to stay!
text: Staff always friendly and courteous.  Willing to help with any requests you may have. Rooms are always clean and spotless. A great value to stay in a mid town Manhattan steps away from all the highlights in the area.

title: My Trip & stay at Park South
text:
Five Stars for Park South Hotel!  This boutique hotel is just that - welcoming with an extremely attentive staff. Amenities & cleanliness top notch!  Will definitely book again.
Easy access to New York via car or walking.

title: Enjoyable stay
text: No complaints--lovely staff, clean room--very NY.W  Rooms small however, everything needed wast there. Had no time to visit restaurants and hopefully next time we stay we are able to enjoy them.  Convenient to NYU

title: great location, friendly and helpful staff
text:
great location with all of one's needs within 2-3 blocks. helpful staff who were polite.
good value. 
the room i had was spacious and clean. very nice tv with many channels to view.
i would recommend it for people who like a boutique hotel in this part of manhattan.

title: Basic Hotel with nice staff
text: Enjoyed our stay, major plus points were clean rooms, really nice staff who were polite and couldn't do enough for you, the restaurant and bar are also great. Only negative was the iron didn't work despite changing it three times but that is an easy fix for them for the future. A mini bar would have been useful too but given the service you really can't complain about little things like that.

title: Great NYC Hotel
text: We had a wonderful 2 night stay at Park South. Top to bottom we thought everything was terrific. Great staff, clean & comfortable rooms, and a terrific breakfast.  I would go back again just to have breakfast, it was really that good.

title: Excellent service
text: Park South is a lovely boutique hotel.  The service and staff are excellent. Louis went out of his way to make me feel welcome in the hotel. I would highly recommend it--there are also many trendy restaurants within walking distance in the Flatiron district and it is quiet and unpretentious.

title: good breakfast, noisy aircon
text: I was a little disappointed that my room was considerably smaller and far less glamourous than any of the rooms shown on the website. My first nights sleep was dreadful due to what I can only think is a giant air con unit that was below my room at ground level. When I asked to be moved to a higher floor to try and escape the noise reception were very helpful and moved me to a very similar room a few floors up. The noise, whilst still noticeable at this level was improved. The room was basic and small. The bed was very comfortable and one of the nicest I have ever slept in a hotel. It’s a shame that the room didn’t match up to the lovely public areas, the lobby and cosy restaurant are both smart and stylish. We ate in the hotel restaurant several times and the food (breakfast and dinner) were excellent. The staff were very helpful when we needed them, for example to book town cars. A pleasant stay, good staff, would recommend but suggest you request a higher floor

title: Clean modern room & friendly service
text: I’ve stayed here a few times for business and it’s always pleasant. Staff went over and above to help me when I was panicked because I couldn’t print out my Hamilton ticket for a matinee. The staff always super friendly and greets you warmly, and the rooms are clean and comfortable.Love the rooftop deck - it is gorgeous even if the drinks are a little overpriced.

title: A gem in Murray Hill!
text: Second visit to the Park South.  The staff is always gracious and welcoming.  The facility is modern, clean and updated.  Always a good value and enjoy the neighborhood and proximity to the subway and major venues.  Love Covina!  The only request would be coffee somewhere in the hotel for early morning risers.  There is a wonderful bagel shop next door, however, that we went to that didn't seem to mind our bed-heads and no makeup!!!  I've found my home away from home in NYC!

title: Excellent Business Hotel in NYC
text: Location is excellent.  Good, clean modern rooms and excellent staff.  I will stay here again when business needs arise.  There is also a great bagel place next door and the subway is at the end of the block

title: Superb stay !!
text: Superb stay @ Park South , exellent restaurant Covina , perfect location to visit NYC. Friendly staff , subway nearby , exellent checkin and checkoutout service untill your taxi arrived . Would recomment to all my friends !

title: Great Boutique Hotel in NYC!!!
text: We visited this wonderful spot this past weekend.....early March.  Located at 28th and Park Ave S., very close to the subway, the great service started from the first person we encountered, the front desk clerk, who was courteous and kind as well as helpful.  Everyone we encountered was service-oriented and anxious to please.  We enjoyed our clean and pleasant room.  The restaurant, Covina, was great for a quick bite, breakfast, lunch, or dinner.  The coffee shop was well equipped and the coffee drinks were wonderful!  We enjoyed the bar the most, had some wonderful wine and cocktails, and good service.  In all, I highly recommend this gem, and I will return on our next stay to NYC, you should too!

title: Best in NYC
text: Hotel location excellent, staff helpful and friendly, breakfast excellent, room clean and spacious for NYC, already visited, next time again. The central location is excellent with the subway connection. Many attractions nearby.

title: Birthday week-end
text: The staff was kind and welcoming, from the folks at the front desk to the gentleman at the door. The room was extremely comfortable and the mattress was like sleeping on a cloud! All in all, a memorable experience.

title: Great hotel, but be warned of un-authorised payments...
text:
My partner and I enjoyed an absolutely fantastic stay at Park South NYC in November 2018, i couldn't fault it at all! Until the last day. We woke up to a message from reception letting us know that they attempted to make the final transaction which was declined by our bank (they charged our debit card instead of our credit card). 

We went to reception and settled the final bill, and all was well. We then returned home and saw a week later that another transaction attempt was made on our debit card, but this was went through! We've raised a dispute with both our bank who has raised this with the hotel, but 3 months later still nothing! We're now down hundreds of pounds and can do nothing but 'wait'. This is such a shame because i would love to recommend this hotel, but cannot believe they won't return us the money we're still owed.

title: another great stay
text: I always stay at the park south for business and pleasure. having been doing so for 19 years. It is a great location. the hotel has strong personal service. Covina is a great addition. I know the staff -- Crystal and Chuck -- and look forward to seeing them on my visits.

title: Anniversary Stay
text: Very nice hotel and great location.  Very close to the 28th street stop on the lexington ave train line. Greate places to eat within 3 - 5 minute walk.  Staff is extremely helpful and friendly. Always opening doors and greeting. Awesome group of people. Bathroom was a little dirty but we cleaned the toilet and sink on the first day. It wasn't a show stopper.  Comfortable beds and the room size was wonderfully.  Double beds, small but acceptable table area for laptop and writing.  No refrigerator :(. Not a child friendly hotel but great for a romantic get away!

title: Very good experience
text: It was my first time staying at Park South Hotel and the experience was excellent.  Great location close to subway, nice decor, good service, valet parking and excellent Covina restaurant on site are the amenities this hotel offers.  I was pleasantly surprised to find a welcome letter addressed to me with a little box of chocolates. I will definitely come back next time I'm in NYC.

title: Loyalty and service
text: We have visited Parksouthhotel many times in the past five years as our daughter lives just three blocks south. We are never disappointed by the accommodations and treatment by the staff. The fact that the staff has remained the same throughout this time,  indicates to me, that there is consistency in hiring, loyalty in employees, which translates to exemplary service. It is our home away from home In New York.

title: Great little hotel
text: I stay here every time I go to NYC. It is the perfect location for me. My family lives only 2 blocks away and the subway is practically out the door. The food is good at Covina and there are other great restaurants that are close to the hotel.

title: Wonderful Boutique Hotel Experience
text: Excellent visit in this newly renovated boutique hotel. Room was on the small size but clean and comfortable.  Service was above and beyond.  Breakfast at Covina the following morning was pleasantly part of the package I booked and was delicious to boot.  Heading back to Park South and Covina in March.  Highly recommend!

title: Great hotel, friendly staff, central location
text: Queen rooms are small but on par with similar hotels.  Rooms are very nicely appointed and are designed to make maximum use of the space.  The staff in very friendly, personable and helpful; the location central but quiet.

title: Nice stay at Park South
text: Perfect location, super accommodations and very friendly staff. Right by the subway and walking distance to restaurants and stores.Clean and comfortable room, and lovely bed. Loved the privste coffemachine in the room!!

title: Modern, comfortable, great location
text: Room is small and very comfortable except for the constant hum of the cooling/heating units located outside my 4th floor courtyard facing window. Coffeemaker is available upon request, a plus. The two restaurants attached to the hotel are quite good. Hotel is located a few steps from a subway station.

title: Great Location, Service and Accomodations
text:
We just had a perfect experience on Park South. We stayed in the hotel for a week and it was the best choice we could have had. It is really well located, next to a lot of good restaurants and hotspots, and yet right beside the subway station. We could feel the team works there with pleasure and always seems happy to receive us specially, but not exclusively, Chuck.
To sum up, I don't think we could have been better in Manhattan within the same price range.
Thank you guys!

title: boutique hotel with personal touch
text: Hotel staff were friendly and accommodating during my stay and seemed to genuinely care that my experience was first rate. I found the room clean and comfortable, and the hotel seemed just the right size. The only negative I can say is that there was construction noise outside of my window, but that was no fault of the hotel.

title: Very nice hotel with great service.
text: Really helpful staff all around.  Nice place.  Everything was clean and new seeming.  Good location.  Good Italian restaurant.  Nice lounge with interesting books and fireplace.  Price was good compared to some comparable places.  We really liked the warm and welcoming atmosphere.

title: Hotel de charme en plein Manhattan
text:
Tres bel hotel pour le prix. Le restaurant est un vrai plus. Les chambres sont de taille très correct.
En hiver, la cheminée, en été, le rooftop, bref l’ideal pour un séjour à New York. Station de métro à quelques mètres même si nous utilisions surtout le traxi. On recommande. On reviendra.

title: Nice Nomad Hotel
text: The ParkSouth is a nice, clean hotel in Nomad.  The quarters can be a little small, but for the price is good value.  On the plus side; it was clean and modern;  technology (internet, TV) worked well; Covina is a pleasant, spacious breakfast spot (we had the included breakfast, but the pricing was fair even if you were paying cash).   On the negative side; the lobby area is downscale and not as elegant as the rest of the hotel; serving hershey chocolates in a bowl is decidedly declasse; and as I mentioned, the rooms are pretty tight and on the small side,  but I don't expect much space from NYC hotels.

title: Amazing hotel!
text: My boyfriend and I stayed here for only 3 nights and it exceeded our expectations. The first thing we noticed was the amazing smell in the lobby! The room was perfect size for us not too small not too big. The staff were so welcoming and it overall was a great experience. Would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great choice!
text: My wife and I stayed here recently and could not have been happier with our choice. The hotel staff was friendly and attentive. The rooms were clean, quiet, and comfy; I mean, what more can you ask for? Lastly, if you are looking for delicious drinks and food, please do check out the hotel restaurant (Covina). My wife and I will definitely be staying here again!

title: Good hotel
text: Just a nice easy place to stay.  Outside of the hubbub of midtown but just south of Grand Central.  The access to cabs and walk-to sites is convenient.  There is a great service attitude here.  And the room was very comfortable.

title: Family visit.
text:
Great boutique hotel. Very comfortable and spacious rooms. Location was easy. No coffee maker or serví bar in room, but plenty of availability nearby. 
Manager , Claire, of the restaurant Corvina next  to the hotel, was very helpful when I had a problem with lunch. Would highly recommend hotel and we will return

title: Park South doesn't disappoint
text:
This cozy hotel is in a great location to so many things.The fireplace in the lounge is very inviting and the moment you walk in the front door you are greeted with a pleasant infusion ( aroma ). How lucky to have 
O Ya as one of the restaurants! My favorite eatery in both NY and Boston.

title: highly recommend
text: Staff are friendly. The location was great. The rooms were very good. The Food and staff were great.Definitely would recommend it for Business and leisure. The location is Central. It was reasonable walk to Madison Square Garden.

title: Quick getaway!
text: Very nice hotel, the attention to detail throughout was wonderful.  A free drink upon arrival was a nice touch. Loved the restaurant for brunch! Staff was accommodating and very friendly. Would not hesitate to stay here again. Great location, not far from Penn Station and easy access to uptown or downtown.

title: Great hotel all the way around!
text: We just got back from a three night stay at the Park South.  It was terrific all the way around.  Great location.  Subway in same block.  Drug store and bagel shop right next door.  The in-house restaurant was so amazing, we ate there twice!  Room was decent size for NYC.  Staff were friendly and helpful.  Immediately accommodated is when I needed a late checkout at the last minute.

title: Correct, bien placé, pas beaucoup de charme
text:
J'ai réservé sur Agoda, une chambre queen soit disant de 24m2 en arrivant ils nous ont attribue une chambre d'a peine 14m2, pas de cafetière, pas de frigo et difficile d'ouvrir deux valises quand on y est pour 8 nuits... Je descend a la réception et on me demande de envoyer le mail avec la copie de la réservation mais qu'il faudra attendre le lendemain pour changer de chambre. Malgré le fait d'avoir été placé dans une chambre qui correspondais en surface a notre réservation, aucun geste concernant la première nuit. 
L’hôtel est bien placé, quartier sympathique et plein de restaurants autour. Le restaurant de l'hotel Covina fait de bonnes pizzas ( pour le reste de la carte pas gouté)
Le bar est sympathique et le Barman David très accueillant et prépare de bons cocktails.
Le lobby est sombre et pas accueillant, rien d'extra au niveau décoration... a l’arrière entre le lobby et le restaurant il y a un petit salon bibliothèque avec une fausse cheminée plutôt sympa. La décoration de la chambre est quelconque pour un 4 étoiles, le système de chauffage extrêmement bruyant car clim réversible donc oreilles sensibles pensez au bouchon d'oreilles.... La literie est de bonne qualité, les produits de confort ( savon, shampooing...) c'est vraiment le  minimum . C'est dommage surtout quand une taxe RESORT FEE de 23 euros par nuit vous est imposée. Pas de bouteilles d'eau gratuites dans la chambre... 
C'est un hôtel sympathique, assez calme malgré l'insonorisation et le chauffage.
Il manque un peu d'âme, et de chaleur humaine pour un "hôtel boutique"

title: Very Nice Hotel
text: I haven't been to the city in a while and was there for business.  I am all about convenience when on business, and lodging is critical.  While it doesn't have to be the "Ritz," I do expect a nice, clean place that caters to the business traveler.  Park South was a pleasant surprise.  Outstanding staff - very helpful and friendly.  They genuinely want to please you and are will to help in any way they can.  The rooms are small (hey - it's NYC!), but very comfortable.  They have done a good job with space allocation and though small, do not feel claustrophobic! There's ample space and outlets for business at the desk; very nice sized TV placed well for viewing.  Room was well appointed and clean - priority 1!  There's a main lobby sitting area, and a small, separate and cozy one as well.  They are attached to a bar and restaurant with great food and, again, very friendly staff.  If you're in the city and find yourself in need of lodging - the Park South will be on my "sure to return" list.

title: Good location and restautant surprise
text:
I chose this hotel because of its location reasonably close to NYU. There was a lot of construction thereby which made getting to and from the hotel more of a problem. Since that's the case with many New York properties, I wouldn't downgrade it based on this alone.

I use a wheelchair, and there is no street ramp close Since that's the case with many New York properties, I wouldn't downgrade it based on this alone.

I use a wheelchair, and there is no street ramp close by. by. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful but still… The entrance foyer was relatively small with steps leading down to the actual first floor. They had a one-person wheelchair lift to the side of the steps, but getting in and out of the hotel was a bit awkward.

The room itself was quite nice but nothing really exceptional. The hotel proximity to Greenwich Village is a plus if you're planning to visit this area. The price, although exorbitant by Colorado standards, is median for New York City.

We had dinner at the Covina restaurant on the first floor in the back of the hotel, and it was truly excellent. A great cut above the usual hotel restaurant.

Except for the quibbles about handicap accessibility which unfortunately is common to many properties, the Park South is a nice property with friendly and accommodating staff in a great Midtown location.

title: Excellent Customer Service / Luis
text: I needed to confirm and update my reservation and Luis answered all my questions professionally and politely, setting the mood for my upcoming stay. I just want to say that customer service starts with the reservation, sooooo I give you guys a 10 and thank you to Luis for your help and starting us on the way to a fantastic stay.

title: Great Find
text:
Good location in mid-town, on a side street so you miss the heavy traffic of Lexington and Park.  The lobby is lovely, the service friendly and the rooms comfortable.  I was actually surprised at the size of mine  # 716.
Be sure to check for a coffee maker -- my room did not have one, but after a call to the front desk I received one immediately.
There are two amazing restaurants in the hotel -- one Japanese an one sort of Italian --   pizza, salads, etc..

title: An Excellent Boutique Hotel
text: I've posted about the Park South many times and am checking in to confirm that it remains an excellent value and experience. The location is great, there are restaurants, a drug store, a bodega and an excellent breakfast spot all within a block. Service is personalized and everyone is friendly. Rooms are typical New York size but the executive kings and queens are unusually spacious and a good value.

title: 設備のきれいなホテル
text: 大寒波が来襲した時に泊まりましたが、暖房設備、窓の断熱もしっかりしており快適に過ごせました。バスタブはありませんでしたので、ゆっくりお湯にはつかれません。チェックイン時のホテル予約サイトの特典サービスをつけてもらえなかったのは残念でした。利用はしませんでしたが、レストランもあり便利そう、近くにもデリ、ファストフード、Fedex等もありビジネス用途では十分な環境です。ロケーションはその時の予定によると思いますので割愛。次も近くの用事があれば利用すると思います。

title: Stylish, aber gemütlich, perfekt Lage für einen NY Trip
text: Modern und gemütlich, schöne, sehr saubere Zimmer mit bequemen Betten. Leckeres Frühstück, würde aber ein  Arrangement empfehlen, sonst günstiger außerhalb. Tolle Bar im Hotel, Restaurant haben wir nicht getestet. Wir hatten Zimmer nach hinten, keine Aussicht, dafür wirklich ruhig.  Super Lage, Subway Station (28th St./ Park Av.) direkt an der Ecke. Flatiron,  Empire State, Times Sq., RFC, Grand Central St. durchaus fußläufig erreichbar. Supermarkt (Walgreens) und etliche Restaurants in nächster Nähe.  Hervorragend freundliche,  hilfsbereite Mitarbeiter. Haben uns willkommen, gut beraten und absolut wohl gefühlt. Tolles Team, vielen Dank.

title: A hidden gem -- makes the city your own.
text: The Park South Hotel is one of the best finds in NYC -- unpretentious, detailed comfortable rooms and incredibly convenient in the center of Nomad The restaurants range from high-end Japanese, neighborly Italian bistro to a roof bar/restaurant.  More Inn-like than a hotel.

title: Mid Town Hotel
text: I book for business and am often all over Manhattan as my business deals with video technology.  This hotel is a great location and the staff are helpful and friendly.  The rooftop is great in the summer but even in the winter Covina bar is a great place for dinner and a nightcap.  I love these renovated, boutique hotels and experiences like this keep me from going back to the brands.

title: Really Grest Manhattan Hotel
text: Spotless beautiful modern accommodations. Great on site restaurant. Very personable and attentive staff. Awesome doorman. Within walking distance to everything. We love this hotel! We are never disappointed.

title: great stay
text: The room was great size for a New York hotel. Clean room and comfortable bed. Location was walk-able to fun or a short cab ride.  Staff was polite, and fun, as well.   We wanted a fun get away and we had one.

title: Love this hotel!
text: This was our second stay here and it never disappoints. We’d stay more often but it’s been fully booked on other occasions.  The rooms are spacious, new and very comfortable. Highly recommend this hotel!

title: Satisfied Customer
text: The staff was superb. I would recommend that 2 people not be booked into the small room as it was not suitable for 2 people (we could not move around in it). Every staff member exceeded my expectations and made this a very enjoyable experience.

title: Great Small Unique hotel
text: Buttoned up, kept up and a fine experience. Restaurant is authentic and very good. Typical small NYC rooms, but well organized and well appointed. Service was particularly friendly and professional. Will use them again.

title: Perfetto per visitare New York
text: Splendido hotel piccolo e tranquillo in una zona ideale per visitare Manhattan. Prima colazione superlativa, ottimi sia i ristoranti nei dintorni, che quello all'interno dell'albergo, personale professionale e cortesissimo.

title: Great new spot
text: I'm a local that had my mother in town. The two of us stayed at the Park South when she came up for a short weekend visit. It was a great experience, and I found it particularly good for that type of stay. going to keep this one in my back pocket for future visits from family and friends!

title: Really nice Hotel with superb location
text: Really great experience!Team is super nice and helpful ! I recommend 100% due to the quality of the room, perfect location on Manhattan close to shoppings, Madison square and Empire State Building !!!

title: Honeymoon destination No.6
text: Beautiful place to stay from the very beginning: great location, because Empire SB, Time Square, Broadway is in a walkable distance. Pleasant fragrance in the lobby. Extremely helpful, hospitable and friendly staff.  Good food in the restaurant. Very calm corner with a fireplace, sofas and newspaper to sit down and read. We had great view on the city skyscrapers from our window. As a bonus, after we returned from our sightseeing day, we found a bottle of Champagne and chocolate sweets in our room. We totally enjoyed our honeymoon stay! Thumb up!

title: Lugnt o mysigt
text: En liten oas på Manhattan. Bra läge, trevlig personal, rummen har en traditionell stil men med fantastiskt sköna sängar. Frukosten är väldigt dyr men bagelstället som är granne med hotellet har jättebra frukosterbjudanden från fem på morgonen. Välj de större rummen som har utsikt.

title: Short NYC Visit
text: A very new boutique hotel w many elegant touches. The small fireplace reading area was comfy. Staff was very nice, helpful, and accommodating. Price was very good. Would definitely stay again on a future trip.

title: Great hotel and ideal location
text: Ideal location in central Manhattan, walking distance to uptown and downtown, very nice and trendy hotel, with great restaurant, the ventilation systems in the rooms are a little loud (a common problem in the US). We will certainly stay there again.

title: Things have gone downhill
text: Had visited the hotel on previous occasion and was pleased with the service and quality of rooms. On this trip, many of the amenities we had received on our last trip were no longer offered - coffee maker and pods, water bottles, slippers, and basic toiletries, such as q-tips or a shower cap. The room we were in looked tired, with chunks dug out of the headboard, and the bed was poorly made by housekeeping. In addition, the doors are so thin we could clearly hear the conversations of our neighbours in the hallway, which woke us up on multiple occasions. Would probably not stay here again.

title: Great staff
text: Everyone on the staff went out of their way to be friendly and helpful.  We opted for the bigger room, which had a $25/day restaurant allowance and wasn't that much more.  Recommend it.  Also got a couple free drinks.

title: Awesome staff / Experience
text: Stayed at this boutique property for a week during a career trek with 20+ students. Front office staff were amazing and helpful. My room was beautiful comfortable. Located close enough to transportation to get all over the city. Definitely will stay again.

title: Great location and comfy bed!
text: The bed and pillow in this hotel were about the most comfortable I’ve ever experienced outside of my own home. The location of the hotel was ideal for someone who came in through Penn Station and had to visit offices on 23rd St. There’s a sneaky “facility” fee for wifi (and business center if you even use that) of $23.95 plus $3.54 taxes on that alone. Nobody mentioned that to us until we got the bill. We booked through Booking.com and they didn’t mention it either. Other than that, it was a nice place to stay. L

title: très bon hôtel!
text: Très bel hôtel, à la déco soignée et design, très bien situé à Manhattan (tout proche du Flat Iron et des super hamburgers du Shake shack), avec un très beau roof top branché. Accueil francophile et sympathique. Très bien tenu et très propre. Resto de l'hôtel branché et très bon, (mais bien cher hélas) , avec un personnel diligent. Chambres très bien insonorisées++ et plutôt grandes. Un bel hôtel à recommander, avec un très bon rapport qualité/prix!

title: Confortable
text:
Confortable and large bed in a King Executive room. 
Helpful staff.
Subway close (green line, that was closed for now).
We can go walking either up or downtown.
Breakfast a little expensive outside. Maybe it will compensate at the hotel but we didn't tried it.
Good wi-fi.

 Air conditioner working well but too noisy.

title: Una bella scoperta
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato per una settimana in questo boutique hotel in occasione delle vacanze natalizie. Scelto per caso in seguito ad un’offerta su Booking si è rivelata un’ottima soluzione dal punto di vista logistico: trovandosi in posizione baricentrica tra Uptown e Downtown Manhattan, ha reso pressoché superfluo l’utilizzo dei mezzi di trasporto. per chi come noi ama visitare le città a piedi, è vicino a tutti i punti topici di New York! La zona è molto piacevole anche la sera essendo l’hotel molto vicino al Flatiron District ed il quartiere offre una moltitudine di ristoranti di ogni etnia. Vi è anche una ristorante abbastanza buono all’interno dell’hotel seppur con una scelta limitata di piatti. La nostra opzione prevedeva la colazione, anch’essa abbastanza soddisfacente anche se con una scelta obbligata di una bevanda è un piatto dolce o salato. 
Per quanto riguarda la camera vi sono un paio di appunti da muovere alla direzione dell’hotel: il climatizzatore esageratamente rumoroso e la porta del bagno assolutamente poco pratica. Essendo una porta scorrevole dovrebbe essere dotata di guida che non la renda pericolosa e che consenta a chi occupa il bagno di non sentirsi in pubblico! Anche da chiusa restava scostata dal suo alloggiamento di parecchi centimetri. 
Il personale dell’albergo è molto gentile e disponibile a fornire consigli . 
Peccato fosse chiuso il Roof garden!

title: Little gem in NYC
text:
This hotel is absolutely stunning! We stayed for 5 nights and it was a treat from day one, you almost feel as if you are visiting old friends as the staff is so friendly and helpful. 
The hotel restaurant, Covina is one of thé best restaurants I have ever visited. They have a “hands on “ manager, beyond spotlessly clean and delicious food with great service.
Great location.
Rooms are great, the only downside being the size of the standard room IF you have a lot of luggage, otherwise it would be perfect.
Would definitely return given the opportunity to visit NYC again.

title: Great stay
text: Great stay, no complaints. Left behind an item and staff found it and mailed back promptly. Highly attentive staff. Covina a great spot for dinner and drinks. Bartender made creative and great tasting drinks!

title: Amazing choice for Christmas
text: amazing hotel clean family friendly breakfast but above but all the people make you feel like in your home !! Near by to metro and to the attractions !! I recommend it unconditionally!! Congratulations to all

title: Great Hotel & Staff
text: We stayed here for 10 days over Christmas, and we could not have asked for more!!! The staff we friendly, attentive and warm.. Great customer service!! The rooms were great and the hotel location was perfect. We could honestly not have asked for more. When we come back to NYC we will be returning here for sure. Big thank you to Chris for his chats and great personality, really made us feel welcome

title: Let down
text: Rooms small, make sure you check before accepting room assignment. Watch coming in construction right next door.Room small, bathroom very small. No amenities except bathroom.We will not stay here again

title: The place to stay in NY
text:
We stayed over the Christmas holiday, booked the executive double with 3 adults and had plenty of room. The rooms were beautifully done, everything looked brand new and very chic. There is not a lot of room for storage, we left our clothes in the suitcase and worked with that. The iron board feature was very convenient. You do hear street noise, (it did not bother us) but if you are a light sleeper ask for a higher floor.
We had Corvina for Christmas dinner, everything was very good. My son said it was the best caesar salad he ever had. The bar was a great spot to stop at, at the end of the night for a night cap. All the bar tenders were very friendly and we had great conversations with them. My son tried the cafe frequently and loved everything he got from there, especially the Carmel Coffee.
Never quite made it to Corvina for breakfast because there is an amazing bagel place two doors down, everything they have they make in house, even the bagels, we would go there get our breakfast and eat it at the hotel library that was beautifully done, interesting books and a fireplace. If you go through the hotel cafe you are on 27th street, there is a Jazz club there and some really good restaurants. Try Blue Smoke the brisket is the best I have ever had. Thank you Park South for an amazing Christmas Holiday, we will return.

title: Great experience in NYC
text: Park South hotel is a hidden gem. It has all the amenities that you need with a great location. Very friendly staff that go the extra mile. The rooms are well appointed but a little small. We had an Executive King which is a little bigger but King rooms looked pretty small. Pay the extra for the Executive King

title: Good Hotel, good Value
text: Good location - very central !The beds are good, some too soft, but this is very personal. The rooms are small, but we understand that problem in NY. Good Hotel for the price ! Very good Food in Covina Restaurant. Perfect Breakfast ! The noise at night, like a ventilation outside was some disturbing. (Maybe only a problem for the inside rooms, we had no view, were in front of an ugly wall). Very friendly and helpful staff. Good Hotel, good Value ! Very happy about our Stay in ParkSouth Hotel - Thank You :-) :-)

title: Second Stay Was as Wonderful as Before
text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel a year ago. We stayed here for a couple of nights again, and it was as wonderful as our first stay. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel. The location is great, the restaurant is excellent, and the people are friendly and fast.

title: Fanastic Guest Service Carl!
text:
I needed assistance in getting some folios updated and the front desk representative, Carl Hudson, was just absolutely amazing. He has been by far one of the best hotel representatives I have spoken to in the MANY hotel's I have encountered and dealt with. Park South is very lucky to have him and I am for sure going to choose this property for future bookings for my travelers as well as my own leisure.

Thank you Carl at Park South for your great service and laughter during the holidays!

title: Worth every penny!
text: From the moment we stepped out of the cab, the staff went above and beyond all expectations. Beautiful hotel, clean rooms and professional staff. Comfortable beds and pillows. Will definitely stay again!

title: No early check in
text: I asked for an early check-in as I was coming in on an international flight. When I arrived, which was later than expected, no room was available, and I was not offered any refreshments or anything while waiting for a room to become available. For international travelers who need flexibility, this is not the hotel for you.

title: Fantastisk service og sentralt
text: Jeg og sønnen sov 7 netter på hotellet. Fantastisk betjening som utøvde enestående service. God frokost. Fine rom. Sentral beliggenhet med kort vei til t-bane etc. Neste New York besøk tar vi på samme hotellet. Anbefales!

title: NYC Visit
text: We stayed just 2 nights but the hotel was very clean and nice. Will definitely stay in the future. Great location near Macy’s and Empire State Building. Staff very courteous. We used their car service roundtrip from the airport to the hotel and then back to the airport. Comfortable mattress. Keurig coffee maker in room. Also had complimentary robes to wear during our stay. Room adequate size for New York. Price was comparable to other hotels in the area. The room was nicely decorated and furnished with a modern appearance. Did not try the restaurant on property because we were too busy site seeing but I will definitely use this hotel as my “ go to” hotel on return visits.

title: NYC 1 night
text: Hotel was nice, staff was excellent, room was average, way overpriced for this location and size of room, we also had to pre-pay to get best rate which was not very good, so beware of cancellation policy. Room was small but very clean

title: A perfect NYC hotel.
text: I'm an NYC local (with a history working in luxury front office hotels) and I recently enjoyed a marvelous staycation at the Park South Hotel. The property is a true gem. I truly loved my stay as the customer service was top notch - all employees in every department were super professional, friendly, accommodating, and personal. Any time I requested assistance there was immediate help and I deeply felt like I was taken care of. I urge anyone traveling to NYC, or those simply looking for a local stay away from home like I did, to book the Park South Hotel! It's the perfect NYC hotel.

title: Excellent service at great location
text: You can tell this place is well run - staff exhibits obvious competence and person ability.  The property is very well located in the City - walkable to lots of restaurants, shopping and various attractions.  Room was small but furnished efficiently.

title: Business and pleasure
text: Spent three nights with my wife here during a cold spell in NYC. I was here on business at NYU medical center and was referred to this hotel for convenience. My wife joined me and we came down a day early to enjoy NYC. The hotel staff were pleasant and helpful. Our room was small but had a good layout and the bed was comfortable. The location was great.  A short walk to Penn Station. Close to the 456 subway line and with lots of great food options close by. Our first day we had lunch in their restaurant and the food was good. The hotel isn't cheap, but it was worth the extra $ over something a bit less expensive but a lot less nice. The place has a roof deck but wasn't open at this time of year. Would definitely come back here in the future.

title: Our Second stay
text: While rates Christmas month weekend taxed our budget, we were glad to meet up with our adult children at this hotel. Staff is very friendly, restaurant on site niceplus, parking lot across the street. Room s were clean and quiet. Good location.

title: Good experience
text: The Park South Hotel was a very nice hotel in a good location. The hotel rooms were well appointed and newly redecorated, there was a sitting area near the lobby with a cozy fireplace. Covina was a great restaurant with good service. I would gladly stay here again for business or leisure.

title: Still excellent
text: This was my 3rd time here and was nervous because it has become part of a chain (maybe it always was but it appeared to be an independent boutique hotel). Either way the amenities, staff and service continue exceptional in a quiet well appointed, very well located hotel. Am planning to return next time I’m in NYC

title: Holiday Visit
text: Had a wonderful time here at this hotel, it is clean and modern and has a great feel inside, it is central to everything, we were visiting my daughter that lives in Brooklyn and took in all of the Holiday Festivities around the city.

title: Christmas Break
text: Loved the boutique feel to this amazing hotel!!   Location is fantastic just 2 blocks from 5th Avenue..  Staff are always friendly and available to help.   Rooms cosy and the beds really comfortable.  Would definately recommend..

title: Weekend Trip
text: Hotel is excellent. Accommodations are nice. Beds were comfy. Staff was pleasant. The Covina coffee shop was great. The restaurant was good too, but felt food was a bit overpriced for what we received at brunch. Would definitely stay there again!

title: Great Visit
text: Nice Trip to New York for business.  The hotel was cozy and Carl at the front desk was AMAZING!  He remembered my name the entire trip and always greeted us with a smile.  Covina restaurant was an added bonus connected to the hotel.  The beds were comfortable and location was convenient.

title: PleasurebThanksgiving visit
text: Nice and clean property for a good value. Good location. Very nice staff! I would recommend the hotel to friends. On my return trips to NYC I will stay there again. It is nice to have a restaurant, bar and coffee shop in the hotel.

title: Family Time
text: We had 11 family members in our group. We were in New York for the parade and to enjoy the city. PSH was one of the most attentive facilities we have visited as a family. We recommend this property recommend this property and we will return.

title: Highest Recommendations, Lovely Boutique Hotel in NYC
text: Excellent. First of all the staff is superb, friendly and helpful and Crystal at the front desk was professional and very pleasant helping work out a small issue. The room was comfy and the overall decor is well done. Love the little library set up in the back of the lobby, great cooking books to look over, fireplace and comfortable chairs. As it was Thanksgiving only had a salad one evening at the attached restaurant Covina which was excellent. The wood fired pizzas look great also. We were given tokens for drinks at Covina which was also a nice little touch. The neighborhood is great for lovers of Indian food and spice shops. Definitely would be a pick if we ever needed a hotel in NYC again. Highest recommendations for this charming boutique hotel and staff.

title: Helpful staff
text: Anytime we had a question the staff was always very helpful.  Others have commented on their views but we didn’t mind, we were just there to sleep and found it quiet and restful. Many have mentioned the size of the rooms but I felt like they were a decent size for NYC - one can’t compare NYC hotels to suburbia hotels. Overall this hotel suited our needs perfectly.

title: Look no further- you’ve found the perfect place to stay in NYC
text: This is the only place I stay in New York City.   I’ve been staying here for the past several years.   The hotel it’s self has been remodeled and the rooms are very comfortable and up to date.   The beds are super comfy.   When the weather is nice you certainly must try the rooftop bar it is amazing with perfect view of the Chrysler building .  Corvina is a lovely restaurant with great food choices and very warm and welcoming .   that might be enough to persuade you to come to this hotel but the thing that sets it apart is the wonderful staff working at Park South.  Everyone is very welcoming and personable they remember you from the last time you stayed and they always greet you with a friendly smile and offers to help or assist you in anyway .

title: Great stay in the greatest city in the world.
text: The Park South is a great place to stay in NYC. The location is convenient (and great ethnic restaurants abound in the neighborhood) and the staff are amazingly helpful and friendly. Other things were good too, but the staff are a highlight. I promised I would remember names but did not, because everyone I met this weekend was wonderful.

title: Great hotel/experience
text: We come to NYC from Buffalo at least once a year. We will only stay at the Park South. The staff, service, location are second to none. They make us feel like we’re at home there. The restaurant in the hotel, Covina, is a great spot for breakfast, lunch , dinner, or to just have cocktails at their well-staffed bar

title: NY in Nov
text: Great hotel in a great area!  Nice walking distance to everything. Loved it!  Staff is excellent - beds are super comfy!  Rooms are large for NY   Very happy with this choice! We have rebooked to come back in March!

title: Never Again
text: I had stayed at this hotel a year ago and decided to stay here again due to it's proximity to the metro and the medical complex at NYU. I had booked my room directly with the hotel and had hoped for an upgrade if possible, Was told at check in due to the hotel being full they could not accomodate my request. This was exceptible but our room was not. Our room was dirty and faced the street where a garbage truck parked outside till after midnight several nights making it difficult to sleep. In addition, we found The hotel definitely showed signs of wear and was not as nice as other hotels at this pricepoint. The morning after checking into the hotel a message was left saying their was a problem with my credit card. After clearing this issue with my bank I found that the hotel had charged my account 3 times, this caused a hold on my card where I could not use it for several days. Lastly upon checkout the staff at the front desk was overheard by myself and other patrons making derogatory comments about someone inquiring about a room at the hotel. I found this very unprofessional and would never stay at this hotel again.

title: The reviews were on target
text: I booked the hotel for my last stay based on the reviews I read and they were dead on.  Very friendly and helpful staff.  Nice rooms.  Great breakfast.  I didn't get a chance to visit the rooftop bar unfortunately.  I would definitely stay there again.

title: Great location,nice rooms friendly service.
text: The hotel is located in a nice part of Manhattan close to Park Avenue South and within walking distance (15 min.) of Union Square and Madison Square Park. At present the nearest subway station is closed but there are others 4 blocks away. There are some very nice restaurants around including Gramercy Tavern, Park Avenue Autumn and Sarabeth's which is great for brunch. The hotel also has an Italian and a Japanese restaurant. It also has a great Roof Bar but it is closed for the season. Staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are not very large but normal for NYC, bathrooms are  functional and pretty new. Beds are quite comfortable. I've already stayed there twice this year and would return. I specially love that it is not an area as crowded as midtown but if you want to shop the Flatiron district is very close and has much to offer.

title: business stay
text: great hotel. great location. staff was more than welcoming and friendly. eager to answer any questions. the food at Covina was excellent. great pizza and great service. definitely worth checking out anytime.

title: Very Nice hotel on a quiet street
text:
Loved this hotel! The room was spacious and nicely furnished; beautiful decor; very quiet. 
The hotel lobby is small and very dark but there is a lovely sitting area with a fireplace in the back. 
I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

title: Location location
text: This hotel is located very close to where  my children live. Easy access to subway..uprown or downtown easy.Rooms are small very nice. Gym is TINY! Didnt like that cardio machines face the wall, away from door. Doesnt feel safe if alone..located in base,ent.

title: Fantastic experience
text: The best accommodation in new york to visit the city. Magnificent food, very friendly and helpful staff, unbeatable location and an excellent terrace where you can spend a pleasant time enjoying the views of the city.

title: Great service. Tiny room with depressing view. Very small bathroom too.
text: Staff were very helpful and professional. Room was very small and looked out into another building and back alley. Requested a coffee machine, which was delivered promptly but didn't work and tray it was on had sugar splattered on the tray.  Given the price of the room, I expected more in terms of space and cleanlness.

title: Very Small, Noisy, Centipede in Bathroom
text: The rooms are tiny. The place has a loud bar and dance club on the top floor. You can hear the noise all over the hotel. Don't get the 8th floor or you'll be sorry. We did, and we couldn't sleep until 2 in the morning due to the noises from above. We called down, they did nothing to help. In the morning, we found a huge centipede crawling on the bathroom floor. The toilet was dirty, hair in the tub when we checked in. Not a great place, but it will do in a pinch.

title: Brilliant value hotel in Midtown
text: A loveky hotel with the best beds in NYC.Staff and service are excellent.Great location.We stayed as a group of 4 friends and found the hotel good value for money.  It was easy to access the subway from the hotel.

title: Park South Hotel
text:
My husband and I stayed here in August 2018. This was the last stop of our honeymoon and there was sparkling wine and chocolates waiting in our room when we arrived which we appreciated - Thank you again for this Park South Hotel!

Our room was an Executive King and was spacious, clean and modern. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in!

Every member of staff was very helpful and friendly, and really made our stay so enjoyable. Also, it was so nice to always be greeted by such friendly and welcoming doormen every day.

We were happy with the location of this hotel as we wanted to stay in this part of Manhattan for this trip (the location was one of the reasons we chose this hotel). 

We loved the roof top bar, it had a great atmosphere and the cocktails were fab! We loved it so much we visited every day before going out for the evening.

We really enjoyed our stay at Park South Hotel and we would definitely want to stay here again when we next return to NYC.

title: Let me tell you what’s wrong with this place...
text: Nothing. Even with a small child in tow, The Park South either met or exceeded each and every one of our expectations. Fabulous location within walking distance to several major attractions. If you enjoy sight seeing by foot you can even walk to Times Square and Central Park. We loved exploring within the hustle and bustle then retreating back to our well furnished, clean, and quiet room. Enjoyed a complimentary drink the afternoon of check in at the onsite bar. We appreciated having the ability to purchase food, alcohol, and coffee in fun spaces onsite, especially the hidden gem of a rooftop bar. As often as we’ve traveled we’ve become accustomed to finding something wrong even at the finest of hotels. How impressive it was to not run into one teeny tiny issue during this stay and actually have a break of seamless relaxation. I only wish I could remember the names of each valuable staff member we enjoyed speaking with. This place has a solid team of professionals who offer true hospitality and service without a hint of pretentiousness! Special note to Brad - the delightful door attendant, sorry the Giants lost again, but with your incredible personality, we know you’re still smiling!

title: Wonderful place to stay.
text: A homey hotel with all the best features of a large. Rooms are slick,modern and comphy.Corina restaurant is outstanding. Breakfast is outstanding.  Try the ricotta pancakes with a side of their bacon. Best pancakes I ever had in my life. Substantial and will hold you the day. Breakfast sandwich is amazing and they make great coffee. Dinner runs the gauntlet. From pizza from their wood burning oven to a full range of appetizers. Their caesar salad is a meal in itself and constructed to be a virtual work of art.The staff is courteous and very responsive and helpful. From the front door to the bartender - they have a great attitude. They pick their people well.Really enjoyed the Park South.

title: lovely hotel in a good location
text:
it would have been five star rating if our room didnt face another building with windows (so we had to keep curtains closed at all times) and if breakfast was a bit more rich. Breakfast was a la carte (nowhere mentioned) and you could only choose 1 thing of the menu. Service was just ok for breakfast, it could be much better if I am honest.
Reception staff (special thanks to Crystal and Barbara who were superb and absolute highlight of the stay and helped with every issue we had!) was great as well as bellstand staff.
good locations a few mins away from Empire State building and FLatiron building.
Facilities ok a roof top bar perfect!
would recommend it.

title: There’s a reason this is highly rated
text:
We ended up here by accident...our Airbnb was a scam and we had to find something quickly. Booking.com came to the rescue here! We need 3 beds and 2 distinct sleeping areas, so a 2 bedroom apartment works for us. However we had to take 2 rooms in thus hotel which made it alit mire expensive for us. Not really a negative, just spent way iver budget because of bad luck.
But we got a bonus here... extremely comfortable beds and surprisingly quiet for a midtown property. NYC is ALWAYS noisy... construction everywhere and MAD CRAZY TRAFFIC. Sirens, horns 24/7. Fortunately we were well sheltered from all of that.
Breakfast was included and was fantastic....way too much. 
The staff without exception were great. Loved the doorman who always made me feel like I was coming home.
No negatives here, perfect!

title: El hotel perfecto en Manhattan
text:
Solo puedo decir de este hotel que desde que llegas hasta que te vas son todo facilidades y buen hacer. Desde el personal de recepción hasta el personal de la entrada donde sin duda, destaca Jason. Es una de esas personas que hacen que tu estancia sea maravillosa. Se preocupa por ti, te recomienda sitios, intercede por ti en recepción si no llevas muy bien el inglés y es una persona maravillosa. 

Nuestra estancia en NY empezó mal por culpa de otro "hotel" pero acabar en el Park South hizo que recordemos la ciudad como algo maravilloso. 

En plena calle 28, muy cerca de todo, pero sin el agobio del centro. En pleno Midtown. A destacar su espectacular y acogedora terraza, sus confortables habitaciones y los servicios cerca del hotel. 

Sin duda repetiría y si lo hago, espero encontrarme de nuevo con Jason. 

See you soon!!!!!

title: Lacked amenities that were listed...
text: The room itself was really nice, but there were certain amenities that were supposed to be included that were nowhere to be found.  Both Expedia and the hotel are to blame for allowing this practice to go on.  Hotels shouldn't be allowed to copy and paste amenities for all of their rooms.  That was pretty upsetting for an otherwise good room.

title: Just right!
text: Great "cozy" hotel ~ good location & everything you need for an enjoyable stay in NYC!  Staff was very courteous ~ more than ready to accommodate your requests.  I will stay there again & gladly recommend to my friends.

title: No need to stay here
text: Rooms are the size of a postage stamp even for NY and they are enormous compared to the gym which was so small that it’s impossible to stretch after your workout.   Covina restaurant was fantastic, and the rooftop bar was hopping.    Definitely stop in for these amenities but stay somewhere else.

title: Grrat location, friendly staff and fun rooftop bar
text: We like the Park South for it’s location and friendly staff. Rooms are small but clean with comfy beds. We have stayed there many times and always had a good experience. Price is a good value. Close to lots of good restaurants and subways.

title: Just fine I guess
text: The service, location, quaintness and staff of this hotel were great. The rooms lacked some basic amenities like fridge that I have come to expect from even average hotels.
