I traveled with a group of 6 friends. We didn't spend much time in our rooms so it was too terrible but I know better hotels for the same price.

title: Stayed 6 night but only able to sleep 3
text:
I do not like writing anything negative but I need to be honest about my experience. I went to nyc for a business trip. I found the hotel staff friendly and the hotel lobby as well as restaurants very nice. 
I was given a room on the second floor facing the street. The trouble came at night. A group of men congregated outside my window and were very loud until about 4 am . I told the desk the following morning and showed a photo of the men. I was told it had happened before but not every night. The second night it happened again and the following morning again I told them what happened. It was suggested I buy earplugs. The third night was the final straw and I ask for another room the following morning. They should have remedied it when first reported. I am still surprised that they would put someone who had a reservation for 6 nights in that room knowing they have a problem.

title: Small rooms and bathrooms
text:
Very small.... we couldnt even move
I believe they need to upgrade group with more than two people because we had problems just moving around all three together
Bathroom so small you can not close the door if one person is inside without smashing him
BUT BEDs very confortable
Nice rooftop and bar but elevator broke wit us inside the first night!!!!!
Nice area full of restaurant

title: Quick NYC stay
text: Very nice boutique hotel, clean, comfy, safe!  The staff was super friendly and attentive.  Close to fun, little restaurants all in walking distance.  Heard good things about the hotel bar and restaurant, but there was no time on this trip.  Next time we'll book them!  It came recommended by my son, who lives close by.

title: Reflète bien les avis
text: Nous avions trouvé cet hôtel grâce aux commentaires et sa cote sur TripAdvisor. L’hôtel est très bien situé ce qui permet de faire une visite des principales attractions de NY à pieds. Les chambres sont magnifiques. Le service à la clientèle est bien. Je recommande cet hôtel!

title: Great Hotel
text: Enjoyed our stay! Staff is very pleasant, rooms are clean and there's much to do nearby. I have stayed in the hotel twice before, just for business. This was the first time I extended my stay to spend some time enjoying the city. It was well worth it! I discovered a wonderful little bagel shop right next door to the hotel...Bagels and Schmear! A must try! The hotel is within walking distance of many great restaurants. It feels like New York!

title: Perfect for some circumstances
text: Great location for business and transportation in mid town. The rooms are very good for a single business person with all of the plug ins above the small but functional desk. Very good bed and bedding. No suites and not enough room for a longer stay family.

title: Lovely hotel in ideal location!
text: I love staying at the Park South Hotel. It is a great location, walkable to so many places and near great restaurants! The rooms are well appointed and comfortable! The staff are also super friendly and accommodating!

title: Schönes, gut gelegenes Hotel
text: Das Zimmer war sehr elegant und gut ausgestattet (Kaffeemaschine, Safe, WLAN etc.). Es schien ziemlich frisch renoviert zu sein. Trotz Lage im 7.Stock war der in New York unvermeidliche Straßenlärm (Müllautos) gut zu hören. Frühstück haben wir in Läden der Umgebung genossen. Das Personal war superfreundlich und zuvorkommend. Die Lage ist gut, wenn man gut zu Fuß ist, kann man Manhattan von hier aus "erwandern". Ansonsten sind öffentliche Verkehrsmittel schnell erreichbar. Es gibt eine sehr schöne Dachterasse mit rstaurant! Ich würde wieder dort einkehren.

title: New York
text: It was a nice hotel and everyone was very helpful. Very cute and the staff was nice and the breakfast was delicious.  It was very close to a lot of things and it was nice walking around and checking out the neighborhoods.

title: Night on the town
text: 1AModern room. Very clean, comfortable bed, great area, very safe neighborhood, The best restaurants in the city.  Excellent service, defiantly will be back. will highly recommend to my friends. keep up the good work.

title: Great stay for business
text: Check in and out were quick and easy, room was great (no noise), and staff were welcoming and efficient (called when my take-out was delivered and brought it up to my room). The only downside was the view (very close to and facing another building) but that's Manhattan for you.

title: Great hotel!
text: Wonderful spot! Great staff, super helpful and friendly. Arrived after 11:00pm and we’re delighted to have a delicious pizza in Covina. Room very comfortable. The Roof is very nice! Will definitely be back on another visit to NYC.

title: returning guest for at least 13 years
text: very good situation near everywhere with mta except line number 6 closed for a few months for works done in the station, nearest staion 33rd st or 23st or buses 3rd avenue and 2nd avenue to uptown or downtown

title: Highly recommend Park South
text: Bed/pillow comfort and cleanliness are extremely important to me.  This hotel exceeded my expectations.  The shower was amazing with dual shower heads.  Water pressure could be adjusted for more pressure.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Absolutely Fantastic!
text: My sister and I loved this hotel. A Gem! Great location, fantastic coffee shop on the main level (coffee was awesome and the in-house pastry chef makes everything available each day and it's a destination), roof top deck was perfect, stylish, great food and the view! Lobby was lovely and we had a glass of wine in the lobby and a cup of coffee in the back library one morning.

title: Noise Noise Noise
text:
The room is spacious for NY standards, awesome bed and shower is amazing. Clean, friendly staff. 
Wifi logs you out all the time, doesn’t remember your device so you need to reinput the Name/password all the time. Super slow connection, so working was out of the question. Requested room on higher floor as I was travelling alone and really needed some time to recharge while on business but I was given a room on the 2nd floor facing the street. You can hear people’s conversations, the staff taking the garbage out and the trucks picking it up. Constant noise, where falling asleep can be challenging. I’m a new mama, so I was definitely looking forward to catching up on my sleep and that did NOT happen. 
For the price we paid the room 1500$ for 2 nights some piece and quiet would’ve been nice. I know I’m in NY and it’s always busy but hearing people’s conversations right outside my windows is a little much. Either soundproof better the first floor of rooms or don’t charge so much. 

What’s the point in asking to be changed to another room in the middle of the night and really are they going to accommodate that. Oh look almost 1 am and more garbage trucks. 😫

Maybe provide earplugs

title: Excellent Location
text: Park South Hotel is an adorable boutique hotel with great character and ambiance. The location is great to walk to restaurants, some tourist attractions and shopping. Their staff is always so very helpful and personable.  I would definitely return.

title: A few easy improvements could make this place much better.
text: WIFI connectivity was poor with the system deliberately logging you out every few minutes.  Beds were marvelous with down comforters and pillows.  Room was relatively quiet even with the external air conditioner running.  A bottle of water per guest per day would be cheap and easy.  In room coffee would be even better.  These are basic accommodations with small rooms so don't expect much for your money.

title: Quiet, Clean, Comfortable Rooms and Great Service
text: I stayed here for one night this week while I was in town for work. The rooms are very clean, nice and modern. I found the hotel to be quiet and the beds extremely comfortable. The staff is very friendly and helpful, especially Marco the Chief Engineer, who helped me get around. I look forward to a future stay.

title: Great Service
text: Our room was good size, clean and modern.  Every employee that we encountered was friendly, polite and helpful.  Convenient restaurant, coffee bar and roof top venue.  A little pricey but overall a good stay.

title: Park South Reveiw
text: Hotel and staff met and exceeded our expectations. Courteous, professional, friendly across the board. We have stayed at Park South several times and have never been disappointed. Great location for restaurants and sightseeing.

title: 1st impressions count
text: Coming to the end of my 5th USA road trip and I class myself as an experienced USA driver but driving around Manhattan in rush hour traffic when the Sat nav can’t cope with the street layouts is not for the faint hearted 😄 hotel is on one way street and hotel name sign is hard to spot so I missed it by 50 yards and pulled over to get my bags out and hand over my keys to the car valet service. Young man on hotel front door was miserable and most unhelpful, disinterested person you could wish to meet. Just told me to reverse car against one way traffic or go around block again. Yes I guess it’s a low paid job and maybe the end of his shift but he represents hotel and 1st impressions count. Now by contrast Luis on check in was very friendly, humorous, informative with excellent people skills. Room was tiny as the norm for most Manhattan hotels. Bed was comfortable, bathroom tiny and tv good. Roof top bar was great and very busy.

title: Kind and gracious service
text: Not a ton of amenities but for the business or solo traveler, this spot is perfect. Comfortable and accommodating. Food and drinks are good on property and there's a very adult feel. I enjoyed my experience at Covina as well- food and drinks were great and the staff was genuine and kind.

title: Excellence in Midtown
text: Great location and beautiful amenities. The service was perfect. Clean - I will definitely return whenever I’m in NYC. The downstairs restaurant, coffee bar and full bar is comfortable and trendy. Highly recommended!

title: The best place around Gramercy
text: The title says everything. Park South is the hotel I prefer in the Gramercy area, and maybe these few blocks are currently the most delicious place in NYC... Nice bars ans restaurants, close to several Subway stations, not far from Tribeca or the Park. Small delis and huge stores not far.The rooms are perfest, modern and nice. Overall perfect architect work.And the people that works here are really perfect, kind and professionnal.Warm regards from Paris, France.Guy D.

title: Great Stay at Park South
text: We loved everything about this hotel! The staff was accommodating, room was clean and well decorated, location was ideal. We loved our meals at Corvina and the roof bar had a great atmosphere. We will definitely stay again!

title: Posizione strategica
text:
La posizione è veramente buonissima, comoda per muoversi sia a piedi che in metro. L'hotel è piccolo ma di gusto, come anche sono le camere. Il ristorante è molto buono, il roof bar panoramico e il servizio accogliente.
Unici difetti, il Wifi non sempre funzionante e il prezzo elevato.

title: Excellent deal in Manhattan
text:
Right near Park Ave. This hotel is modern with a great staff. Very clean and really convenient. Restaurants (like all NYC hotels) are expensive but you are near Park Ave (100 feet) and about a 1000 restaurants. Go to Pret a Manger for Breakfast and lunch.

Hotel has awesome rooftop deck for drinks with a limited menu.....lots of fun though at the end of the day...rooms in this price range are often small but then again this goes for any major city....close to subways etc.....very quiet in amongst the noise of Manhattan. I travel lots and this is a good deal. We will be back.

title: Excellent hotel and staff
text: After an intensive online search for hotels in NYC, I found the Park South, and was so happy that I did. The hotel and staff significantly exceeded our expectations. A special recognition to Mr. Luis Maldonado of the Front Desk staff, who was extremely helpful in answering numerous questions and who provided outstanding service. I highly recommend the Park South!

title: Exceeded expectations
text:
We had booked a room for four nights and neglected to double check the confirmation email. As we were approaching NY we looked at the email to verify their address and were alarmed that the confirmation was for one night for a date that had already passed. We had been charged as a no show. When we called the hotel to rectify the issue, they could not have been more gracious. They rebooked us, moved the no show charge to cover one night and even though it was our oversight, the hotel staff, and Krystal in particular, went out of their way to make us feel at home. When they learned we had guests visiting us, they offered to upgrade us to a room that was large enough, sent us a bottle of wine and boxes of chocolates. We were greeted by friendly staff at the door and at the reception desk every day. 
The central location of the hotel near outstanding restaurants, sights, and many conveniences, the roof top bar, as well as the very comfortable and beautiful rooms are some of the many good reasons to look no further than the Park South. We will return for sure.

title: Hidden Jewel
text: Hidden Jewel.  Perfect in service.  Born and raised in NYC and for a native perfect spot.  Covina restaurant is amazing with Robert Castellon a rock star!  Rooftop bar is beautiful and offers spectacular views.

title: Amazing hotel and even more amazing staff!
text:
My partner and I stayed at the hotel last weekend. We were visiting from Toronto and had not been to NYC in a while. The entire experience was lovely and refreshing. Every Bell person that opened to the door for us had a welcoming smile and great demeanor. The hotel is very clean, chic, located in a central part of the city. The restaurant Covina and the rooftop bar were amazing. I would highly recommend this hotel and the food and beverage.

All the staff were so pleasant, personable, and more importantly FUN! Everyone was great but I have a special mention for Melvin from the Front desk, the check in was seamless. David bartender in Covina was so passionate about his job. He was mentioning a new cocktail that he created for the new menu, and he even made it for us to try (how awesome!!). and finally Server Mardy in Covina was so knowledgeable about the menu and the city, gave us some great recommendations, and was just delightful to chat with. 

Thanks for an amazing stay!

title: Comfortable and quiet
text: Being new to the Park South, I was very impressed by the cleanliness and comfort of the hotel. During an extremely hot week in NYC it was good to return to the pleasant room for a quiet and cool night’s sleep. The excellent bed and spacious bathroom made for an outstanding stay, and the staff were welcoming and efficient in all that they did. I will be sure to return!

title: Leisure
text: Outstanding service that started at the front door and continued throughout hotel.The hotel was centrally located to city transportation and the staff was more than willing to assist with information and recommendations. The Park South Hotel exceeded our expectations and made this trip to New York one to remember.

title: Labor Day in NYC
text: what a perfect location to see and do all things NYC.  We picked the hotel for the location and it was perfect.  We went to the US OPEN and it was an easy subway ride.  also went to a play and selected areas restaurants to dine daily, including CORVINA in the lobby, which was just perfect.

title: Très bon emplacement
text:
L’hôtel est bien placé. La chambre et la rue sont calmes.

La chambre est confortable et le personnel attentif.

Un petit regret : la climatisation est bruyante.

Pour ce qui est du petit déjeuner, nous n’avons pas celui de l’hôtel. Il y a un boulanger qui fait de délicieux Baggels au pied de l’hôtel.

title: Wonderful Stay!!!
text: I can’t even begin to tell you how wonderful our stay was!! We went for my mother inlaws 88th birthday and Chuck, Krystal & Cat made her feel like a queen! They went above & beyond to make our stay perfect! Chuck arranged transportation for us & recommended a great spot to eat breakfast!! The rooms were perfect! We will definitely be back & look forward to our next trip!!

title: Good, not amazing
text: The final price is not the final price. Just know you will be paying additional facility fees and extra taxes (about $30 extra per night, in our experience). The staff were very friendly. However, cleanliness of the room left a little bit to be desired. We found a couple pistachio shells under the bed and our pillows smelt like the previous guests' cologne and perfume. Other than these things, our stay was very pleasant.

title: Honeymoon
text: Heerlijke ontvangst, we kregen upgrade ifv honeymoon en was piekfijne kamer, prachtig gezellig romantisch hotel, lekker ontbijt, helemaal top! Rooftopbar ook heel gezellige sfeer, maar zelf geen maaltijd/drank genuttigd dus kan daarover niet oordelen.

title: Perfectly located, great hotel!
text: Very well located, walking distance from Union Square and Times Square, perfect to see shows off-off Broadway and on Broadway. Verrrry comfortable beds, well soundproofed windows and pitch black at night thanks to the window dressing. Great eating options on site, and great view from the rooftop bar.

title: Great location
text:
This hotel was beautiful on the inside. The pictures of the outside are a bit misleading but that is New York. I would stay at this hotel again for sure. Everyone was very pleasant the door men remembered us from morning to night shifts. The rooms look exactly like the pictures which is a first! Very pleased with the room. I would say, the city view is just the street in front of the building so nothing spectacular. The hotel was on the same street we were working on that week so it worked out very nice. Also, free parking with the room I selected that was amazing! 

The Roof restaurant was a bit misleading, there is a lot of construction going on so when you look down all you see is a pile of stuff. The food was ok, nothing to hoot about.

title: Solid choice: good location and very clean
text:
This was our second stay at the Park South.  This review is for our most recent.

The hotel is conveniently located on the east side.  We even walked from Penn Station about 20-30 minutes.  There’s an awesome bagel place next door and tons of good Indian restaurants in the neighborhood.  You can also walk to Madison square park and visit the original Shake Shack.

The rooms are ok size - not huge but I’ve stayed in smaller in Manhattan.  The rooms are very clean and modern.  The WiFi worked well.  Our room faced East 28th on third floor and I expected it to be loud, but we slept in no problem with blackout shades.

The only thing I didn’t like was the heavy sliding bathroom door.  But, toiletries were nice.

title: Quick Getaway
text: We stayed just one night for a quick getaway before school starts.  We got so lucky to book this last minute.  The room was clean, comfortable and quiet. The staff was so friendly and helpful.  The roof top bar/restaurant is beautiful with great skyline views.

title: Può andare
text: Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel per qualche giorno....tutto nella norma. Il personale è gentile ed educato. Non abbiamo ne fatto colazione ne pranzato quindi non posso esprimermi a riguardo. Rooftop bellissimo. Camere essenziali e letti piccoli ma comodi. Ci sono solo 2 punti a sfavore: un albergo frequentato da molti forestieri dovrebbe avere un personale multilingue; seconda cosa....le addette alle pulizie dovrebbero spazzare un Po di più..almeno il bagno.

title: Centrally located
text: We stayed for 3 nights in August and walked as far as Central Park (about 30-45 minute walk). We also walked back from Times Square one night (20 minutes or so). Several small restaurants were open when we arrived after midnight to check in. It was nice to find food so late. There is a small cafe next door if you want a less expensive coffee option, breakfast sandwich, or good pastry.Café in the hotel is quaint and opens to the adjacent street. Rooftop bar gets busy but is a nice touch. You should have at least one drink there during your stay. We arrived shortly after it opened and it got pretty busy within 30 minutes. There is a separate elevator for guests to access the rooftop. You don’t have to walk outside as another reviewer states.We stayed at Hotel 50 Bowery last year and feel it is far superior but this experience was unique and enjoyable too.

title: Awesome stay as always
text: Awesome stay as always!!! We love the Park South Hotel. The hotel is great and the staff is truly one of the absolute best. Hotel is very convenient and in a very residential area. Easy to get to anywhere from there. Wouldn’t stay anywhere else.

title: Ideal for short stay
text: Nice concept hotel but in a not so nice neighbourhood. During our stay non stop road works and in the extreme heat very smelly streets due to abandoned garbage bags. Near Empire State Building and Union Square but 3 blocks from nearest metro station due to road works. Very comfortable beds and pillows, excellent shower and soft towels!

title: Excellent choice in Manhattan
text: Service is superb, you feel like at home.Location is great, nearby subway stations, lot of places to eat around. Quiet street, without any noise at night.Sure, I will be back, thanks specially ot Barbara and Cristal from the fornt-desk. They both were gorgeous with us.

title: Amazing location
text: Stay here to feel like a local with class. They recommend restaurants in the area, service is great. Rooms are just the right size and beds allow sound sleep. Main pull is really where it is located since its so convenient

title: Great Stay
text: We stayed here for a week while we explored NYC.  Our room was really clean when we arrived and was well-cleaned each day while we were out.  The beds were extremely comfortable.  It was also really quiet (by NYC standards - this is a big, vibrant city and there is obviously a certain level of noise).  The service was excellent; every staff member we dealt with was professional, kind, patient, and friendly. The location of this hotel is very convenient - close to many things and very easy subway access.  We were impressed and we will return.  Thank you!

title: Finally found our go-to hotel in NYC
text: I've long sought a hotel in NYC with a both an authentic soul and excellent, fresh rooms.  Every inch of the establishment... from the lobby to the room to the rooftop, has been thoughtfully conceived  This will be our go-to place (hotel and roof top dining) in the city.

title: Great one night stay
text: Great one night stay .The room was very clean and the hotel was as well. The employees were kind and friendly .We were just disappointed with the parking fee on top of the room and service fees. Would definitely stay again!

title: Good experience
text: Spent a week here and had an overall good experience. I received a good rate.  Hotel is near a subway station in Midtown. When I had a maintenance issue, they sent someone right up and got it corrected. Clean room.  Good location. I would stay here again.

title: Great stay in Midtown Manhattan
text: I had the best experience at the Park South Hotel, I just got back home and I miss it already! Kind and friendly stuff, cosy and clean rooms, strategic location in Midtown Manhattan (you’re a few steps away from the subway station and the main attractions, plus the area it’s quieter than the city standards) and great restaurants (Covina/rooftop bar) made the difference. The guys at the reception area couldn’t have been more nice, so helpful and caring! I would totally choose this hotel again for my next staying in NYC. Highly recommended. Thanks for making my first trip to New York unforgettable!

title: Great location, very friendly staff.
text: Great location! 5 min walk from madison square and eataly! Both places can get very good breakfast (Shake shack and eataty). This part of new york is not as crowed as the times square block, is another way of seeing NY.Close to restaurants, stores and parks. Good shower, nice staff.

title: Great Experience!
text: Stayed here while visiting our daughter and was very pleased with the overall hotel.  The location was perfect. Our room was newly decorated and clean.  The rooftop bar and the restaurant are very nice.  Would stay here again.

title: A great NYC hotel
text: A fabulous hotel in a great neighborhood. It is located near a subway station and many great restaurants. We loved the room and the friendly staff. Try Covina the restaurant for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

title: Little gem
text: Great location. Lovely staff. Comfortable and clean room. Not cramped like many NYC hotels. Was grateful for the ability to receive an early check in and late check out. Front desk folks were helpful and accessible.

title: Perfect Hotel, Perfect Location
text: If you looking for very affordable accommodation then look no further. This is the hotel for you. Clean, decent size rooms and most of all the staff are friendly!! Pretty good roof top bar as well. Great Value for money!

title: Poor internet service
text: The internet service was very poor. Slow connection and the service kept dropping each time your device goes into sleep mode. It was problematic when it came to using apps like Uber which requires the service not to drop out. I would not stay here again if they can't figure out such a basic necessity for travelers.

title: My Go-To Hotel In NYC
text: There is no better place to stay than here. it is convenient, spotlessly clean, friendly staff, and a good restaurant and bar, all for a real good price. That is almost impossible to find in NYC. But voila! this hotel delivers. I have stayed here on all my NY trips and I will continue to.

title: Think again
text:
We booked this specific hotel on recommendation from a work colleague and from numerous tripadvisor  reviews...

I paid this hotel in FULL and when I called the hotel It was confirmed that we were upgraded ( thank you so much for it ) and that we will have no extra or any costs to pay !

it all went downhill when we checked in ! 

We were allocated room 805 .Gorgeous and very boutique feel .
Wifi not working at all - I did bring it up to recpetion for 5 hours - Still not working after 3 nights ! Had to found out that that part of the hotel is weak and much stronger on the back side : even using a differentr sign in  code : still did not work .
no turnaround service in the evening - for a boutiqye hotel unacceptable !
no room servoce menue - really for a boutiqe hotel ?
had to pay 82 US when checking out for fees and taxis .. even confirmed that no extra fees or charges is payble after paying in full .
uncomforatble mattress and worn out and sleeping for 3 nights on the same linen ebven though we put it on the floor as requested for new ...
water dried up in shower at 7 pm .....

It was not what we expected and I feel robbed and could have stayed in Hilton Hotel and earn points and pay less per night : and have room service and turn around service !

will not even consider stayiing here again !

Vernon

title: Comfy and trendy place in midtown
text: I loved this little boutique hotel! We were upgraded to a king room immediately upon arrival and had a really posh little place, especially for NYC! Centrally located, pretty rooftop, great food and staff. I only wish they had room service! ARG! Overall very pleased with our stay.

title: Still Love the Park South
text: Having just returned from my at least 15th stay at the Park South in the last four years, I can report that it remains a great option and a very good value in NYC. The current construction on 28th Street is a bit distracting but the noise level was reasonable and hopefully it will be over soon.  The Park South staff is always great, and friendly, and the neighborhood is safe - restaurants, bars, drugstore, bagel store, coffee, fresh fruit, all within a block in any direction.  I highly recommend it.

title: Fair Boutique Hotel
text: Stayed for a five day business trip. Pretty good service and room was clean awith good facilities, Reasonable dining opportunities with atmosphere. A few grumbles from a British traveller but these were resolved instantly.

title: Just ok
text: The Park South is a boutique hotel that is clean & very nice but has a few service and space issues. First, it would be great if all hotels made it clear up front if they offer curb side baggage assistance or not, not maybe. Here, while my wife went inside to check in, I waited in my car a good ten minutes right in front of the hotel before a hotel staff member finally came out and asked me if I was going to need help with my bags. I also had to ask about him about valet parking even though I knew in advance that they offered it. The room we were given was so small it was actually uncomfortable & the walls & ceilings are not sound proof. They have a great roof top bar/restaurant but, to access it, you need to leave the hotel and go around the block and then take the elevator up to the roof! However, when you are leaving the roof, you don't need to go around the block again...you can access the floor you are staying on from the elevator!! When it came time to call for our bags & car, I tried calling the front desk several times on the room phone but nothing happened when I pushed the "Front Desk" button. I finally called the hotel directly from my cell and the person I spoke to apologized stating that it was a "little confusing" and that you needed to dial "0" for the front desk. I suggested that the hotel should either fix the "front desk" button on the phone or remove it and put a sign on the phone instructing guests to dial "0".  I did that and finally got through but was put on hold and then hung up on twice. We gave up and carried our own bags. We then had to wait for our car. All problems that shouldn't be the guests problems.

title: Excellent Hotel
text:
We loved to find an excellent room. Only, it was a little small for our needs. We would have been able to manage it, but why not ask if there would be anything possible? Our inquiry was handled by Louis, a very professional Hotel Manager. He was very friendly, patient🙏 and found a perfect solution! We highly recommend that hotel!

Sehr empfehlenswertes kleines aber feines und professionell geführtes Hotel! Sehr nette Mitarbeiter (wir hatten sehr viel Unterstützung von Louis) und die Lage ist für Manhatten ausgezeichnet!

Thanks a lot!🙏🙏🙏

title: Good choice for New York.  Great location.
text: Recently stayed at PSH for 3 nights on a work trip.  Will definitely consider it for future trips.  Clean, big rooms and relatively quiet, central location are major pluses for this hotel.  Also the roof terrace is fantastic and worth checking out even if you are not a hotel guest.  My only, small gripe is that, because of its design, the shower leaks water all over the bathroom floor.  So, I had to use towels to control it.  I imagine many other guests have done the same, because all the towels I received during my stay were rather old and tattered.

title: Easy   to   go    everywhere
text:
It  was a  hotel not  listed  in the  magazines   so   it  was   like    a   Newyorker.
The   station   is   near    so    you  can   go   anywhere,.    
The   staff    was    always    nice  so    we     could   stay    comfortable.
I   think   that   everyone   is   sure   to   be   able   to   spend    calmly.

title: Great Hotel
text: Lovely hotel. Clean rooms with comfy beds and great rooftop bar. Lots of shops and restaurants nearby and walking distance to lots of attractions such as Empire State Building, Flat Iron Building, Times Square.

title: Amazing Experience!
text: The room was lovely and so comfortable. Staff was incredibly friendly (especially Jason who took great care of us even recommending a driver, Benny, to pick up and return us to the airport complete with Champagne). The location is perfect. Couldn't have asked for anything more except perhaps to stay longer!

title: A Place to (Re)Visit
text: The hotel was great in every level. Every employee made my stay more enjoyable and provided everything I needed. The rooms were a good size (it's New York after all) and always very clean. The location is the best, being within walking distance from the Empire State Building and other landmarks as well as the 28th Street Metro Station if you need to go further away. Recommend it completely.

title: Klein und fein
text: Ein ordentliches Hotel zu einem fairen Preis. Zimmer sind klein und unseres war etwas dunkel. Das Personal war super und es wurde sich sofort gekümmert. Die Gegend ist nicht so schick, aber viele gute Inder und Delis um die Ecke. Die Dachterasse ist öffentlich und Abends von sehr jungen Leuten bevölkert. Wir dachten das es exklusiv für die Hotelgäste und etwas entspannter ist.

title: Perfect location for us
text:
Clean modern hotel located on 28th street  between Lexington and Park, closer to Lexington.
We had a superior queen room and it was very small.  We did not spend much time in the room other than sleep and shower. 
Roof, the roof top bar, was a nice outdoor bar but not a very high roof top if you are expecting a view. We enjoyed the outdoor space...quite a lively after work crowd. On Fridat At 630 there were about 30 people waiting in line to get in.
I would recommend this hotel and would return even though the room was small.

title: Very easy place to stay.
text:
We arrived late one night, and had Diego give us a great run down on what to do and how to do it.

Followed by a visit to the roof top bar for a night cap!

Very easy to get on the subway 6 line, and buses ran on nearby avenues as well.

Room was clean and tidy, quiet without a view though. We didn't dine at the restaurant, and breakfast was not offered or included but no matter.

And when we needed to go to the airport on our departure, a car was called for, but a limo arrived at the same price! Plus we got given bottles of water.

Well worth considering for your NYC stay.

title: Excellent location
text: Very good services from staff and excellent location. The rooms could have more amenities (i.e. small fridge, kettle, coffee & tea etc.). The air-condition system was not functioning well and there was a bit of noise from the outside

title: NY family holiday
text: Had a great time. We were well helped by the staf.  Only point of improvement is the space to put the luguage. We were 4 in a room and had Only 1 accesible layer to put our clothes. Our room was More forseen for a short stay,  not for a 6 Day stay.

title: Simply Chic
text: Loved this for a weekend getaway with my husband. They gave us a lovely room near a top floor. The service was impeccable, they were so respectful, boutique angles in hallways, new furniture - city style, and neighboring restaurants top-notch. The area itself left something to be desired but that's New York and I preferred an eclectic area around versus busy Times Square. We walked everywhere from this mid-point, including some great restaurants in India Town and to Greenwich VIllage. Also, the bagel shop next door was sooooo yummy!

title: Sadly Disappointed
text:
I had high hopes for the Park South Hotel. After my first visit, I felt as if I had finally found my NYC home away from home. Since my first stay, however, the hotel has started charging a "facilities fee." Fees such as these drive me crazy. Why not add them to the basic cost of the room? Is it to "game" the online booking sites so that the visitor thinks she is getting a better deal than she actually is?

When I asked the front desk why the hotel instituted the fee, the answer was that all the hotels are doing it. Well if you want to be average and just like all the other hotels, you deserve an average rating.

And for the record, not all of the other hotels are doing it. I will stay at one of the many hotels that don't.

title: Love This Hotel!
text: The first time I stayed at this hotel it was a couple of years ago.  At that time, I thought it was quite nice, but I recently stayed there with a couple of friends and it is even better.  The room was gorgeous and appeared to be updated.  The beds and pillows were so comfortable.  Everything was clean and bright.  We asked for a room with a window with a view and were lucky enough to get one.  The lobby area was cozy and welcoming.  All of the staff were very nice and friendly and welcomed us each time we came back from our adventures for the day.  Located conveniently to the Subway. Looking forward to staying there again in the future.

title: Amazing
text: Everything was great. O Ya food and service were amazing, Jenna and Jordan are amazing servers. The chef came out and checked on us and the maganager did also. Everyone was super. I recommend O Ya to anyone that enjoys real quality food. The Waygu was superb.

title: Fodder for Larry David’s Curb Your Enthusiasm
text:
About to spend my fourth night at this lovely small NYC hotel... comfy, clean, small rooms, updated.... with controls for air conditioning you can actually read!

But, I mean big BUT... I returned today and my clothes were gone...personal hygiene products...everything gone!  I could have made a scene! 

I Packed extremely light for this trip so I had my backpack with me, with my computer all day. The front desk person seemed a bit clueless and not very reassuring (concerned, but not reassuring... this is a teaching moment!) when I told her my things were gone. Earlier she was super nice recommending a yoga place nearby.

It took about 40 minutes to solve the case and a very friendly manager brought two bags of things by my room, all jumbled up. If I was a fussy man with finely pressed clothes I would be rather pissed off.  The manager asked me if I was all set, as he handed me the two small garbage bags that were ripped open and not really that well-managed. I responded, “I don’t know I’ll have to go through them.”

No offers or apologies, no free cocktails at their swank roof top bar, no free nights in NYC.  Oh well nobody died!

title: Great Stay at the Park South Hotel!
text: This was my first stay at this hotel an I have to say it was one of my best hotel experiences in all of the years I've been traveling to NYC.  Great location, very personal boutique setting with attentive and professional staff.  I highly recommend it...amazing value for the high quality of the stay!

title: Nice interior and good value for the area
text: Park South does have nice rooms that are relatively sound proof.  I felt the price I paid was fair.  It is the rooftop bar that attracts people to this hotel and that bar is very nice with a good view. Beware that if you want to watch the fireworks on 4th of July at their Roof bar, you must buy a ticket in advance so just staying in the hotel does NOT get you into that bar on the 4th of July.  Drinks are pricey, but that's how NYC is.  I have stayed in nicer hotels in NYC and paid more for them.  I did miss having room service and I found myself asking for missing items like a washcloth.  It's a small hotel so I doubt any of the rooms have a fantastic skyline view.  All in all I might stay here again because the location is convenient (midtown) but I missed some of the perks of paying a little more for a fancier hotel. Interiors were upgraded though with big TVs and nice furnishings.

title: Trendy and hip but not the best in NYC
text: While the rooms are new, updated, clean and most of the room had an efficient use of space there were 2 things highly disappointing. The double bed rooms were only full size beds - which are shorter than standard queens - and the bathroom was the size of a coat closet.

title: Quiet and attractive hotel
text:
I enjoyed my stay at Park South Hotel. The neighborhood was a nice surprise. It is an easy walk to the Flatiron District & Union Square. Madison Square Park--just a few blocks away--is lovely for sitting down with a book or taking a snack break. 

The hotel decor is nice, and there are good sitting areas on the main level. My room was about the size you would expect in a New York hotel room, and it was so quiet. I have never been in such a quiet hotel room in New York. So happy about that!

title: Better than most 4/5 hotels in the area!
text: Park South is a shinning star in the neighborhood! The room we booked was immaculate. The front desk was very friendly and welcoming, especially Lauren. Thank you for adding to a wonderful weekend in the city!

title: Great Service
text:
Small but very nice room. I usually don't mention furnishings but these we above average. View was the interior courtyard and AC units.

Wifi a  bit slow. Room had noise drifting down form the rooftop.

The front desk staff were amazingly helpful when I forgot my briefcase in my valet parked car and I heard them solve problems from several other guests as well.(None of the problems were caused by the hotel)

title: Park South Hotel-An undiscovered Gem
text: Overall my experience at the Park South Hotel was great.  My mother and I have stayed at many hotels in NY for business trips and Park South was an undiscovered gem. We will definitely be back to stay!

title: Lovely little hotel
text: Spent a great few days in this lovely hotel. Staff could not have been more helpful when we arrived and all throughout our stay. Room was a good size, comfy bed and always clean. Roof terrace was great if always packed. Had breakfast in the restaurant one morning and it was delicious, massive New York style portions! Would highly recommend and would happily return.

title: Elegant and quiet boutique hotel
text: We booked this hotel as we had read it had the best rooftop view of the Macy's 4th of July fireworks on the East River. But we were thrilled to find that the property was on an unusually quiet street, had a wonderful onsite restaurant and elegantly appointed rooms. The staff was professional and accommodating. The food at Covina was fresh and tasty. We also took advantage of the hotel's luxury SUV to get to the airport and it was less pricey than Uber. Park South is our new favorite NYC hotel.

title: 4th of July
text: A very pleasant stay. I have already commented on our stay in the previous evaluation.  Please read it.  I don't know why I have to repeat it all again.  Briefly, the hotel and staff was excellent including the rooftop staff and food.   THE FIREWORKS VISIBILITY FROM THE ROOFTOP ON THE 4TH WAS VERY VERY POOR AND NOT WORTH THE MONEY OR BUILDUP THE HOTEL LED US TO BELIEVE.

title: Nice boutique in mid-town.
text: The Park South is a nice boutique hotel located in mid-town. We enjoyed a drink on the rooftop bar and we enjoyed a delicious breakfast in Covina. Their menu is unique, the prices are reasonable. We upgraded our room after receiving an email from the hotel. As a returning guest it would have been nice to be upgraded at no cost. We will return on our next trip.

title: Nice over night stay
text: Upon checking in I was greeted by a nice, courteous staff personnel.  My room was nice with a modern type look to it.  Lighting in the room had a nice ambiance and was quite relaxing. Good location for taking the 28th St. subway which was quite convenient.  I would stay at this hotel again if circumstances warranted.

title: one  night stay
text: The accommodations were very nice and clean.  TV size was nice.Front desk personnel were friendly and polite. Room was quiet.View was OK. No ice machine on floor.  Décor of room was nice.  Not enough room for clothes. Small closet.

title: A great find in New York
text:
My family and I stayed here for our New York stay. We had two rooms. Fair sizes for both. One king, for husband and I and another with two doubles for our girls with a great view!
Would have liked fridges in rooms plus kettles for tea and coffee.
Didn't use the restaurant so cannot comment.  The lady who served us in the bar was chatty.
Rooftop bar was busy and full of cool people.
All staff that we engaged with were extremely pleasant.
Just read about wine hour? If this happens regularly we were not told, however we had a busy time walking the sites so would have probably missed anyway. We loved it! Would we go back in a heartbeat 💖

title: Nice room. Great staff. Could use a few more amnenities
text: We had a nice room on the 8th floor. With a Queen bed its a tight fit, and the mattress was a little too soft but OK.  A fridge in the room would have been nice, but there was really no place for it. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms and common areas very clean. The wine happy hour is nice but maybe add some fruit or  cheese & crackers. The chocolates at the front desk were a nice touch. The A/C was perfect. Plenty of good restaurants near by, and the 6 Line (Subway) is on the same block.

title: Leuk hotel met rooftopbar!
text: Wij verbleven hier met twee stellen voor 4 nachten. Kamers zijn klein, maar netjes. Locatie is centraal en dichtbij de metro. Heerlijk ontbijt met de beste gastheer van NY! Op het dak van het hotel is een leuke rooftopbar.

title: 4th of July
text: Exceptional hotel  greeted by  wonderful  helpful smiling staff. The hotel was a   great location the beautiful room had a chandelier over our bed, comfortable bedding and temperature the walk-in shower and bathroom were spotless.  There is  no reason to stay anywhere else in NYC.  We walked to restaurants, bars and saw the Macys fireworks.   It couldn't have been more perfect

title: A great place to stay
text:
We stayed in the hotel for 5 nights . 
It's a wonderful boutique style hotel. Quite an intimate feeling. 
The hotel's location is on the 28th st. And park ave. Very close to a subway station which was very convenient. 
The place has his own restaurant for breakfast which was a great one. Also has a rooftop bar which was quite fun to end the night up there (though not too high). Everthing which we asked to fix or delivered was taken care immediately. The girls at the front desk Lauren and Krystal were sooo nice, helpful at all times, lovely smiles . Such positive women ! Really an asset for the hotel . 

Thank you for a great stay and I would definitely recommend this hotel for all those who don't like the mess near times square.

title: First trip to NY and Park South delivered
text: I found NY to be similar to San Francisco, which I have visited many times having lived in California most of my life.  This was my first visit to NY. Overall I had a nice experience and Park South came through is spades being a clean, and classy place throughout. I was in on business so spent most time away from the Hotel, but it was always a pleasure to return to.

title: Wonderful neighborhood hotel
text: Located between Park South and Lexington in the Gramercy neighborhood, this is a great spot for dining as far south as Greenwich Village. Reasonable and very clean, with helpful staff. The Roof bar is a hot spot on the weekends and a leisurely respite during the week. All in all, a nice place for a city visit.

title: Always the best choice
text: I have been coming to Park South for a number of years, and it is always a pleasure. From working with Samoya for the best value to seeing Crystal’s smile when we arrive to enjoying breakfast and maybe dinner at Covina, this place is a true gem.

title: Good Hotel in Good Location
text: We have stayed here twice.  The first time - we were in a much larger room (green) with a much larger bathroom.  Also, a free continental breakfast was included in the lobby area.  This time, our room was much smaller and the free breakfast was eliminated.  The hotel is clean and has modern decor. Safe.  Location is good for subway, Madison Square Park/Flatiron area, restaurants, fruit stand, drugstore, etc..  It is a good hotel, but we felt let down after our first experience.  For what we paid, I may try a different hotel next time.

title: Saved us from the Four’easter!
text:
This story is necessary for how much we appreciate Rachelle and love this hotel. 

After our flights were cancelled, we were trapped in the city with students and no rooms. My bosses and I called throughout trying to make reservations and happened to get four rooms here for the next day. The next day rolls around, I call to confirm before heading over and apparently the confirmation number is from 2016?!! I, trying to keep calm, do a terrible job and the lovely Rachelle reassures me they have rooms and books me then. She patiently dealt with my baby freak out. 

We roll in around 11am with our bags, covered in snow and defeat. We knew the rooms wouldn’t be ready but just wanted to leave our stuff. Rachelle hurries some things and managed to get us one of the rooms free so we can put our bags somewhere. Lifesaver. As she’s going, she gets us into all but one room. 

Later in the evening, we hung out in the lobby, playing card games, watching the nonstop snowfall. Idyllic end to a chaotic day, all saved by Rachelle. 

Just about the hotel: This place is lovely. There’s a heated towel rack, great view of the Chrysler building, lemon water, comfy lobby, great restaurants attached, and just general clean, elegant but simple, lovely.

title: Good Quality in small space
text: Standard double bedroom was quite cramped and bed too soft. Room clean and modern with wall safe and ironing board. No fridge or tea/coffee making equipment.  Sixth floor you could still hear noisy street but quieter after midnight. Staff very friendly and helpful.  Breakfast in Covina delicious but pricey.

title: Great Boutique Hotel
text: I took a chance and stayed here in Jan 2018 for business. Prices at that time ranged from $219 to $250 per night. Nice, clean hotel with a good restaurant. Close to Union Square. I would definitely stay again.

title: Excellent stay in NYC
text: Park South Hotel is a lovely hotel with a great vibe.  Location is ideal for us visiting our son.  Do not miss a visit up to the roof top bar which gives you a great view of the city.  Great perk having access to a quick bite in the morning from the Cafe.

title: Typical
text: Nice place to stay. Roof is a big plus. Comfort is a little bit below expectations, no fridge in the room and the AC is noisy (as in most hotels...). But the staff is fantastic, very helpful. Good value for money

title: NYC Pride 2018
text:
Great layout, nice amenities, friendly staff and delicious coffee. Comfy bed with great views. Hope to stay here again next year for WORLD PRIDE. 
Wish there was an ice machine but the call buttons for do not disturb were neat.

title: Don't stay anywhere else!
text: The Park South Hotel is everything I could want in a hotel for a stay in the city. Fabulous location, friendliest staff imaginable, pretty, clean. Covina is wonderful and the lobby is relaxing and funky. A++!

title: Nice hotel, convenient location
text: Nice hotel in a good location.  I had a Executive Townhouse room, which was quite spacious and the bathroom was amazing.  Hotel staff were very friendly and very helpful.  I didn't eat at the restaurants, but did have great coffee and breakfast from the little coffee shop at the back of the hotel.  Two things prevent me from giving this hotel 5 stars:  1 - the closet is extremely small, there is almost no room to hang your clothes, and without a dresser or bureau storing clothes for a longer visit is difficult.  2 - this room was on the second floor above the entrance and the window did not close completely - tons of street noise.  Fortunately, I travel with earplugs, but this could be a problem for others.

title: Excellent PLace right in Midtown!!!
text: Had a blast Pride weekend! Amazing Front Desk Staff!!!! Food and drink at Covina was excellent and the atmosphere of the rooftop bar was super fun with a great view. Definitely recommending to my friends.

title: NYC surprise gem
text: Great location and service. Front desk staff was very attentive and even offered to bring lunch up to my room as I was running late to a meeting, I later found out the hotel does not typically offer room service.

title: As always...a great place to stay.
text: Have stayed at the Park South many times and it continues to get even better.  Nice update to the finishes in the room.  Like the new restaurants and support areas.  The lobby seating area is a nice addition.

title: Fantastic hotel in ideal location!!
text: Park South Hotel is a wonderful place to stay!  I love staying there for so many reasons -- great location, really friendly staff, and delicious restaurant and cafe!!  It is great for both business and pleasure since it is near so may NYC treasures!!

title: My home away from home in NYC
text: This is a wonderful place to stay.  The staff is always friendly and courteous.  I enjoy the convenience of Covina for very good food in the hotel.  The rooms are small, but adequate.  The roof-top bar is fun in season.

title: Horrible experience. Abrasive Diego
text: I recommend everyone to stay far away from this hotel. The nighttime supervisor Diego strikes me as an unsafe, unreasonable person in dealing with customers. Instead of resolving things in a decent fair way after issue, he made sure to stick it to me in the worst way possible. He was rude and domineering in his attitude, and completely loses sight of what the hospitality industry is all about - to make a guest feel safe and welcomed, and for the hotel to provide a restful night of sleep.

title: Clean and Comfortable
text: My stay at the Park South was fine.  Room clean and bed comfortable although room was quite small with a view of a roof.  Bathroom also small but well appointed.  TV good but not in great line of sight from bed.  Service was friendly.  Covina restaurant quite tasty but overpriced. Although there was a guy at the door to the hotel, he was absent at times and seemingly let anyone in and into the elevator, so I’m thinking that security could use an upgrade.

title: Good location
text:
Myself, husband and 2 children stayed for 4 nights. Location is very good the subway station is right at  the corner. Staff are nice and friendly and the bell boy always had a big smile. 

I must say the room was really small and so were the beds. We did stay in a double queen room which we have done in plenty other hotels but these beds were really small. My husband is 6 ft 4 so it wasn’t good for him. Bathroom was also a tight squeeze. Not enough towels in the bathroom either which I had to bring to receptions attention. 

Our room was next to the elevator to bring other guests to rooftop bar which was noisey when there were 2 children staying in the room. I didn’t say anything at reception as it would mean moving all of our bags to another room if offered. But, I would have presumed that when the booking was made our room location would have been taken into consideration as the children were 4 and 9. 

Air con is also very loud. We did have a great time in NYC though.

title: Great Hotel!
text: Great location, friendly staff. It was my first time staying at this hotel, however my company has been staying there for the last several years. I brought the staff 8 racks of ribs from the big apple bbq block party on Madison ave. I hope everyone enjoyed them!

title: ParkSouth
text:
It's a safe bet.  It actually was much nicer than I expected.  The rooms are small, but so are most everywhere in New York City.
I had to be in that area.  There were very few choices that had a short walk to my destination.  I feel I made the right choice.

title: Nice hotel off Park Ave
text: Hotel was good, rooms clean and decent size for NYC. Great restaurant choices. o Ya is spectacular if you like Japanese. Roof top bar was great as well. Breakfast was wonderful, I had the avocado on toast, delicious.

title: Great stay in the middle of manhattan.
text: It was easy to get to all the local sights from the hotel. Great staff. Friendly. About a 30 minute walk to time Square. Easy access to subway. Great rooftop bar. Short subway ride to Central Park. Would definitely stay here again.

title: My favorite business Hotel in NY
text: I love this hotel for business trips. They are super central located. The staff is extremely helpful and accommodating. The restaurant are perfect and easy. We were lucky to have the roof top open while we were there. Covina is ideal for a late dinner.

title: A nice hotel, but perhaps a bit too 'boutiquey'
text:
I stayed for four nights in June as a solo traveller wanting to see NYC for the first time. Overall the hotel is good. Friendly, helpful staff and in a good central location close to the subway. My room was very comfortable and spacious, with everything I needed and there was very little noise from the street (which I believe is a rarity in smallish NYC hotels).

As a traveler on my own, the hotel did feel a little awkward at times. After sight-seeing and before dinner, it would have been nice to have chilled out with a beer and a book. This is where I felt the victim of the hotel's success. The foyer would have been too conspicuous, the library was oddly too dark to read in and the bar too busy. Even when I thought I'd have a coffee in their coffee shop and have a read, with only two other people in there, a member of staff (doing her job, but not really assessing the situation) clocked it was 5pm came in and turned the music on and the lights down so I couldn't read. The rooftop bar would have been perfect, but be warned, this is a destination for young, trendy New Yorkers and fills up quickly. People even queue at the back of the hotel to go up there, so for the paying guest it's a hard place to chill. At times I felt quite uncomfortable relaxing in the hotel and preferred to nip to a pub behind the hotel on 27th street (oddly next to the queue of people wanting to get up to the hotel's roof).

Breakfast in the hotel is expensive, but very nice. The bar is also quite pricey with cocktails being better value than wine or beer.

All in, for me it was a very nice hotel, but probably a bit too 'boutiquey' for my tastes and clearly a very successful operation.

title: Park South is a great value
text: The Park South hotel is my go-to business hotel in the Union Square/Madison Square Park area.  The service is friendly, fast, and efficient.  Rooms are clean and well-appointed.  The restaurant is good for breakfast, lunch, dinner, and/or drinks.  Also, the rooftop bar features great drinks and ambience.

title: Nice little hotel, great position
text: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights, the room was a bit small, but clean, and service and location was very good! Breakfast and also dinner were good, I would highly recommend staying in this hotel!!

title: Boutique Hotel offers lovely stay!
text: Loved my recent trip and my stay with Park South. Gracious and accommodating staff, and the small boutique feel of this gem in a great location was superb. Loved the room and the intimate lobby areas — decor fresh and pleasing. Elegant and not stuffy. Quiet rooms with comfy beds and linens. Roof Top Bar an added bonus and great for snacks, or just hanging in after dinner. Covina on ground floor has the 6th Best Burger in NYC (I’ve been told) and as a restaurant owner myself (Citron Baltimore), I agree it is delicious. Talented staff and touches that sparkle throughought my whole stay.  Drinks superb and pizza in that wood burning oven at Corvina also perfection. Glad we found you. See you again soon. PS Parking nearby a plus. As is the little collection of cool books in your library with fireplace. Just enough to relax with after dinner before turning in. Thanks!

title: Exceeded expectations
text: Good in every way....wish we could have stayed longer. Staff were very relaxed and helpful. Excellent location to explore New York. Room was very well appointed and the hotel very attractive. Breakfast was tasty, speedy and well prepared. I would thoroughly recommend.

title: Great location
text: This hotel is perfectly located. Rooms can be tight, space-wise, but you don't spend much time in them. They are clean and updated. Breakfast at Covina is fabulous and affordable. Many subway lines are accessible from here with very short walks.

title: Great location
text: Great hotel within walking distance of many good dining options near Madison Square Park, as well as some of the more touristy destinations in the city - Empire State Building especially. Very walkable to everything in NoMad. ROOF at Park South a great spot for a nightcap.

title: I chose this hotel because I news close to a venue I had to visit. But too small better value in Times Square
text: I chose this hotel because I needed to be close to a venue close by. Convenient area with informal eating places close by. But room size was very small for the money. Times Square area has better value. I did like smallness of the Hotel.

title: Mrs JH
text: Really enjoyed my stay I will definitely revisit and stay again as soon as able. But also like to sign up for the rewards card to be sent to my home and to receive points from this visit.  Staff is very helpful and the breakfast that I had at the restaurant was very much enjoyed.  Can’t wait to stay again!  Rooms are very spacious but recommend a microwave also be added to the rooms as a convenience for the customer. Unfortunately I experienced  to nats were in the room in which I had to kill but overall cleanliness was displayed.

title: Tiny rooms and way too soft beds
text: I stayed in the hotel for several days. The front desk staff was very nice and helpful. However, the room was very small; the bed was too soft that caused me with terrible neck pain after the first neck. Even I reported the problem, nothing was done by the hotel. The hotel never responded to my several emails regarding my experience. It is one of the worst experience I had with a hotel stay.

title: Fabulous Hotel
text: I have stayed in many hotels in New York City and this is my favorite by far.  The rooms are good size for NYC, the beds are comfortable, the bathrooms well accommodated, the water pressure great, the service excellent and the location is great.  The people who work at this hotel are professional, friendly, caring and competent.  They truly care about their patrons.  I stay here every time I stay in NYC now.  Love this place!!!

title: Comfy, Chic, and friendly service
text: One of my best hotel experiences in NYC. Comfy bed, spacious rooms by Manhattan standards, and this hotel has a fantastic location right by Madison Square Park, the 6 subway, midtown. Reception sent me to Penelope's for brunch and it was exactly what I needed.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text:
Stayed for 8 nights at Park South hotel in May. 
Since We usually stay in the Village or in Chelsea on our twice a year trips to New York the Nomad neighborhood was new to us. 
It was simply wonderful. From the very helpful staff at front desk (thank you Luis M) to our sweet house maids who kept our room nice and super clean we loved the stay there. The location is perfect and the city can be easily navigated from the hotel and the neighborhood is also filled with restaurants, coffee shops and bars. The Covina restaurant and coffee shop at the hotel is also very nice and the barista at the coffee shop met  our high standards when it comes to good coffee. Would recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again 
Thanks guys, it was lovely
Oddny M 
Reykjavik, Iceland

title: A must hotel
text: I stayed in a Superior King room and it was fantastic. It is a great location and the staff are very attentive and helpful. I am really looking forward to coming back again to visit New York and stay at the Park South
